loans.name: Nann

texts.en: Mr. Nann N., 37, sells chop-wood that he carves from the forest or buys from people who live near the forest. He has been operating in this sector since 2000 and makes around $3 per day. His wife, Mrs. Lux Gnek, 37, is a mother who farms in two seasons, both rainy and dry, earning approximately $2 each day. This couple lives with their three children in Sort Nikom commune, in the province of Siem Reap. Nann N. will be using the loan to hire a laborer to repair his old house.

loans.use: To repair his old house.

loans.name: Yon Cherling

texts.es:
Yon tiene 26 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus tios en el distrito de Guadalupe, un distrito de la zona costera perteneciente a la provincia de Pacasmayo, en la región La Libertad, ubicado a una hora y diez minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se gana la vida vendiendo verduras y frutas desde hace mas de un año en los exteriores del mercado de la ciudad de Guadalupe, el ofrece todo tipo de productos frescos a sus clientes. Como esta actividad es la unica que le provee de ingresos económicos, el trata de ofrecer productos de buena calidad y un trato amable a sus clientes para poder mantener su negocio.

Su negocio ha ido creciendo y la demanda por los productos que ofrece ha ido aumentando, por este motivo el desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas verduras y frutas, por lo que se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Yon es un joven bastante trabajador y muy resposable, su mayor anhelo es poder tener un puesto mas grande dentro del mercado. Las personas que lo conocen le tienen mucha estima y lo consideran una persona de confianza.
texts.en:
Yon is 26 years old. He is single, and he lives with his aunt and uncle in the Guadalupe district. This district is in a coastal region that belongs to the Pacasmayo province in the La Libertad region. It is located one hour and ten minutes from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. For over one year he has been earning a living selling vegetables and fruits outside of the market in the city of Guadalupe. He sells all types of fresh products to his customers. As this is the only activity that provides him with economic income, he tries to offer good quality products and good customer service in order to be able to maintain his business. His business has been growing, and the demand for the products he sells has been increasing. Therefore, he wishes to expand his business by purchasing more fruits and vegetables. That is why he is asking Edpyme Alternativa, for the first time, for a loan for 1,500 PEN. This is to help him achieve his objective. Yon is a very hard working young man, and he is very responsible. His greatest goal is to be able to have a larger stand inside of the market. The people who know him hold him in high esteem, and they consider him to be a trustworthy person.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruits and vegetable to expand his business

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida P. is from the village of San Luis, Gingoog City. She is 48 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Leonida owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Leonida has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Leonida joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children's education.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

location.town: San Luis, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Domingo Rufino

texts.es:
El  microempresario: Domingo Rufino Zeledón A. tiene 65 años de edad es casado y tiene cinco hijos todos adultos. Desde hace 14 años se dedica a vender sorbete en un carrito de madera de manera ambulante por toda la ciudad de Bluefields. Actualmente vive con su esposa quien se dedica a la venta de tortilla de maíz. Con el ingreso de ambos pueden mantenerse ya que no reciben ayuda de sus hijos quienes se encuentran fuera del país.

El señor Zeledón ya fue beneficiado con un primer préstamo por parte de Kiva, el cual ya cancelo en tiempo y forma. Don Rufino agradece el gesto de los prestamistas en ayudar a familias pobres tanto de nuestro país como de otros países también pobres como el nuestro.

Don Rufino esta solicitando se le financie para comprar lo siguiente:

Dos  Llantas para el carrito el par cuesta US 50.00 dólares, una caja de leche que cuesta US 65.00 dólares la caja, un quintal de azúcar que cuesta US 35.00 dólares, tres tanques de sorbete que cuesta 35.00 dólares cada tanque, tres cajas de cono que cuestan US 25.00 dólares cada caja y dos sabores para sorbetes que cuestan US 35.00 dólares cada caja.
texts.en:
The micro-entrepreneur Domingo Rufino is 65 years old, married, and has 5 children, all adults. For 14 years he has sold sherbet from a small wooden cart in the streets of Bluefields. He lives with his wife who sells corn tortillas. With the income of both they are able to maintain themselves, and they receive no help from their children who live outside the country. Rufino has already benefited from his 1st Kiva loan, which he paid off as prescribed and on time. He is grateful for the offer of loans to benefit poor families in his country, as well as in other poor countries like his. Rufino is soliciting a loan to buy the following: 2 tires for his little cart, totaling $50 dollars; a package of powdered milk, costing $65 dollars; a 100-weight of sugar, costing $35 dollars; 3 tanks of sherbet, costing $35 dollars; 3 boxes of cones, costing $25 dollars per box; and 2 boxes of sherbet flavoring, costing $35 per box.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING TIRES FOR HIS CART, AND MILK, SUGAR, CONES, FLAVORS FOR SHERBET, AND TANKS OF SHERBET

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy food products

loans.name: Renee

texts.es:
Renee es conviviente y tiene 25 años, Renee viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende ropa variada, actividad que realiza 2 veces por semana, y de las ferias compra quesos, leche que vende en su barrio. Además Renee vende golosinas en el cerro acuchimay en donde tiene un puesto.
Renee es socia del Banco Comunal Florecer y solicita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropas interiores, chompas, productos que comprara en la ciudad de Lima.
Los sueños de Renee son tener un puesto estable de ropa, tener una casa propia porque hasta ahora vive en la casa de su mama.
texts.en:
Renee is 25 years old and in a common law marriage. She travels to the different fairs in the region to sell a variety of clothing. Renee engages in this business twice a week. While at the fairs, she buys cheeses and milk and sells them in her neighborhood. Renee also sells candy at Acuchimay Hill where she has a vending stand.

Renee is a member of the Communal Bank “Florecer” (To Blossom). She is requesting a loan of 1200 PEN to buy undergarments, sweaters, and other products that she acquires in the city of Lima. Renee dreams of having a stable vending post where she can sell clothing and having her own home because she currently lives at her mother’s house.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase undergarments, sweaters, and other types of clothing

loans.name: One Love Group

texts.en:
Nancy S., shown holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers. The group is called One Love. Nancy is 35 years old and married. She was not able to attend school due to lack of financial support. For the last five years, she has been a vendor of rice and meat at Redlight Market in Paynesville, located on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 8,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 40,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more bags of rice and meat. She describes herself as a determined woman.

Her goal is to expand her business and eventually to build a shop.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice and meat for sale

loans.name: Mrs. Rin Sao Village Bank Group

texts.en: In Khvav villge, Takeo province has fourteen people who are made up a village bank loan and they all have been selected Mrs. Rin S. is a village bank president who is 1971. Each member will use portion of their loan for different purposes in which it can improve their businesses. Mrs. Rin S. and her husband, Mr. Khnet Chea, are farmers who owns one-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support their family and he is a basket maker. Both of thE. try to work hard but they can earn less income. So to improve production, Mrs. Rin S. is finding for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business. She is a mother of three children whom all are studying in local public school. Mrs. chanthol Torn is a group guarantor so she is presented in the picture. All the members are shown in the picture but one of thE. is blocked.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Penina

texts.en:
Penina A. is a 38-year-old enterprising mother of one 19 year old. She is married to Joseph and they stay in Bungoma town.

Penina has been operating a poultry business for the last seven years in Bungoma, a town located in the western part of Kenya. She operates her business from her homestead where clients come and select poultry to purchase at wholesale or retail prices. Good customer relations keep her going in this business because customers come from far away to buy her poultry.

She learned about Kadet Limited through a friend who introduced her to a group. She joined and took out her first loan which she paid without default. She is now taking out her second loan and plans to use it to buy more poultry for raising which she will later sell. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

Her desire is that one day she will become a leading supplier of poultry to five star hotels in Western Kenya.

loans.use: To buy poultry to raise and sell.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
This is 28 year-old Sabina S.. She is married and has no children. In 2005, she established  her grocery shop business. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she supoorts her family. In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates.

loans.use: increase inventory of store

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila L. is from the village of Kibatang, Don Carlos, Bukidnon. She is 41 and married with three adult children. To make a living, Lucila and her husband own a vulcanizing shop offering vehicle repair services. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Lucila joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase materials needed to expand services. This will be the first loan taken out by Lucila from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to expand services

loans.name: Celia

texts.es: Celia, de 57 años, es una mujer sabia y con experiencia, vive con su hija Katy  de 20 años en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Palcamayo. Desde que era niña se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería; “cuidaba a los chanchos de mis padres y ayudaba a la cosecha”, menciona. Con el tiempo ella invirtió su fuerza y su tiempo en progresar, por ello cuando era joven se dedicó a la pastelería, actividad que práctica durante 10 años; y que hasta el momento sigue vendiendo panes, pasteles y demás productos. De las ganancias que obtenía, pudo ahorrar dinero y comprar su propio terreno para cultivar hortalizas, producto que es vendido al por mayor en el mercado central de la capital. Ahora instaló en su casa una pequeña tienda, de esa manera podrá generarse ingresos adicionales. En tanto, no se da abasto para trabajar en la agricultura, por lo que se vio en la necesidad de buscar una socia para que le ayude en la siembra y en la cosecha, de manera que ella solo se ocupa de cuidar sus plantaciones hasta que llegue la temporada de recolección. Su mayor anhelo es comprar y vender terrenos y continuar apoyando a su hija en sus estudios de Agroindustria. Es el décimo crédito con MFP y agradece el apoyo que le proporcionó su banco comunal en el desarrollo de sus objetivos. Con los mil soles que solicita, invertirá en la compra de abono para su próxima cosecha, así como pagar los estudios de su hija.
texts.en:
Celia, age 57, is a wise woman with experience. She lives with her daughter Katy, age 20, in her own home in the Palcamayo area. From her childhood, she has worked in agriculture and with livestock; "I took care of my parents' pigs and helped with the harvest", she says. With time, she invested her strength and time in improving; so when she was young, she worked as a baker for 10 years. She still sells breads, cakes and other products. From her earnings, she has been able to save money and purchase her own land to cultivate vegetables, products which she sells wholesale in the central market of the capital. She recently opened a small store in her home. This way, she will be able to generate additional income for herself. Working in agriculture does not give her enough income, so she found it necessary to find a partner to help her with the sowing and the harvest, so that she only works alone on her land until harvest time. Her greatest wish is to purchase and sell land and to continue supporting her daughter in her agribusiness studies. This is her tenth loan with MFP, and she is grateful for the support that her community bank has offered her in the development of her goals. With the 1000 soles that she is requesting, she will invest in the purchase of fertilizer for her next harvest, and pay her daughter's tuition.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Juana Liliana

texts.es:
En las afueras de Portoviejo en Km 5 vía Manta  encontramos el Banco Comunal Loma De Los Vientos, que se reúnen cada quince días, lugar de gente dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales.

La señora Liliana tiene 26 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 6, 5, y una hermosa bebita de un año,  su marido trabaja en una granja de pollos, tiene una casa de caña.

Vende cartillas que es una modalidad de venta de artefactos en sistema acumulativo. Además  se dedica a la fabricación y venta de empanadas, tiene un puesto cerca de su casa donde todas las tardes y noches venden estas deliciosas empanadas que son muy apetecidas por la gente. Trabaja todos los días  desde las 14h00 hasta las 19h00 en las ventas,  pero en la fabricación las realiza en las mañanas de 8am hasta las 10am, dice que le va muy bien además de que las ganancias se ven a diario. Trabaja con la ayuda de su tía.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar unas mesas y sillas para mejorar la  atención de sus clientes. Es su segundo ciclo en el Banco y está muy contenta por la ayuda que ha recibido.
 
Su sueño es tener una casa de hormigón bien construida.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Loma de los Vientos” is located on the Manta road, 5km outside Portoviejo. The group meets every fortnight and its members work in agriculture and livestock rearing.

Liliana is 26 years old and lives with her common-law husband, with whom she has three children: a 6-year old, 5-year old and a beautiful 1-year old baby. Her husband works on a chicken farm and their house is made from sugar cane stalks.

She sells cards, which people can collect in order to buy various items. She also makes and sells empanadas. She has a stall close to her house where she sells these delicious empanadas in the afternoons and evenings, and they are very popular. She sells them every day from 2pm until 7pm, but makes them in the mornings, between 8am and 10am. She says it suits her very well and she makes a daily profit. Her aunt helps her with the work.

She will use this loan to buy tables and chairs to improve the service her customers receive. This is her second loan cycle with the bank and she is very happy with the help she has received.
 
Her dream is to have a well-built concrete house.

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha M. is 40 years old, single and has two children, ages 17 and 10 years old, whom she hopes to give a good education to the university level. Her business is located in a busy market known as Likoni in Mombasa, Kenya. Her business is well known by the name of "Gathoni Salon and Boutique". Mombasa is in the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many, many tourist attractions sites; not forgetting the white beaches of the Indian Ocean. Martha's salon provides hair and beauty services mostly to the local women. Besides the salon, she also has a boutique in which she sells clothes and ladies accessories. She has been in this business for six years now and has one employee. She says that this business is lacking enough capital; however, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more clothes to boost the boutique business, especially as we approach the Christmas festivities. She hopes to grow her business and open other branches within Mombasa. She describes herself as a simple but determined woman.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Meas R., 46 years old, is a humble villager living in Phnom Penh in the middle of Cambodia. She is married and blessed with four children. Her husband is a motorbike taxi driver.

Meas is on the cleaning staff of a garment factory and earns a monthly salary suitable to that position. Meas finds it hard to walk to work and dreams of having a vehicle to drive, but she doesn’t have the money yet to buy one. Therefore, Meas would like a loan to purchase a secondhand motorcycle.

loans.use: To purchase a secondhand motorcycle

loans.name: Esterlina

texts.en:
Esterlina M. is from the village of Barangay Mauan, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 55 years old. Esterlina is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Esterlina owns & operates a business raising pigs for breeding. Esterlina has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 7,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Esterlina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Esterlina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 21,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Esterlina is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Esterlina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies.

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz C. is from the village of Cabunga-an Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years-old and married with five school-aged children. To make a living, Paz owns and operates a “sari-sari’ store business in the retail sector running a general store which sells a variety of products to local community. She has been engaged in this business for six months and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, she joined Kiva partner PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Paz is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products for her retail store. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Paz from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living condition of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To purchase additional products for her retail store.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon G. is from the village of Maac, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 46 years old. Corazon is separated from her spouse and has 8 children. To make a living, Corazon owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling vegetables like stringbeans & eggplant & also spices in the local community. She also makes and sells a variety of dishes like fried chicken & pork adobo in the local community. Corazon has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Corazon joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Corazon has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Corazon is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional raw ingredients for cooking viands. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Corazon from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw ingredients for cooking viands

loans.name: Bello

texts.fr: M. S. est né en 1952 et a 4 enfants  en charge.   Pour pouvoir   répondre aux besoins  de ses enfants, il  fait la couture. Mais il a associé la vente des  articles de mercerie. Il a débuté en 2001 cette activité et s’approvisionne dans un magasin  à Aguiarkomé.  Ensuite il revend dans un atelier à coté de l’ho tel Diamant. Il demande un crédit pour acheter un moteur à machine et 10 rouleaux de popelines.
texts.en: Mr S. was born in 1952 and has four children to support. To provide for their needs, he works as a tailor. In addition, he sells haberdashery articles. He began this activity in 2001. He gets his supplies in a store in Aguiarkomé. Then he resells the goods in his workshop located next to Hôtel Diamant. He applies for a loan to buy an engine for his sewing machine and 10 rolls of poplin.

loans.use: To buy an engine and poplin

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch P., 52, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. She is a farmer, earning an income of about $1.80 per day. Her husband sells palm products, also earning an income of approximately $1.80 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $55 on food and $10 on other necessary expenses. 

P. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a truck to transport workers from the factory. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy a truck to transport workers from the factory

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
Doña Marta, reside en Concepción Batres, departamento de Usulután, se dedica a vender pupusas y administra una tienda, es madre soltera y vive con uno de sus hijos; El negocio lo fundó hace 29 años, por iniciativa propia, trabaja todos los días de 6:00am a 7:00pm, sus clientes son amigos de la misma zona, a la fecha no presenta problemas con el mantenimiento del negocio.
Actualmente comprara mercadería para surtir el negocio por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar arroz, aceite, papel higiénico,  entre otros productos para la tienda, esta inversión le ayudara a incrementar su inventario y a crear mayores utilidades las cuales le ayudaran para cubrir los gastos familiares.
Doña Marta espera tener el negocio en buenas condiciones por largo tiempo, que sea competente y cubra las necesidades de los clientes.
texts.en: Doña Marta lives in Concepcion Batres, a Department of Usulutan.  She sells pupusas (an El Salvadorean dish) and manages a shop.  She is a single mother and lives with one of her children.  She began her business over 29 years ago and works every day from 6:00 am to 7:00pm.  Her clients are friends from the area where she lives.  To date, she does not have any problems with maintaining her business.  She is currently seeking a loan in order to stock her shop with more merchandise, such as rice, oil, and toilet paper.  This credit will help her increase her inventory and her profits, which will help cover her household costs.  Doña Marta hopes to keep her business in good condition for a very long time and keep it well stocked in order to fulfill the needs of her clients.

loans.use: Purchase products such as rice, oil, toilet paper.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
This is Geraldine Z., 31, a resident of Caloocan City City, Philippines. She is married to Demetrio Z., a security guard, and the mother of their three children. The entire family helps to manage the household while operating the business. At this time, Geraldine is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Geraldine operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, Php5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Arlene earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house, and her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php400 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Geraldine is requesting a Php10,000 loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her enterprise.

Geraldine hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. Each comprised of 15 to 30 community partners, the fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Maria Adela

texts.es:
La Señora María Adela L. R., es madre de tres hijos de los que tiene a su  cargo actualmente se dedica a brindar consulta odontológica en una clínica particular, cabe mencionar que lleva 2 años dedicados a esta labor, anteriormente se dedicaba al comercio (Venta de granos básicos).

La Señora  L. R., solicita este crédito para compra de cerámica, cemento y puerta los que utilizara para acondicionar una clínica en su casa de habitación y así obtener más utilidad para mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y la de su familia.
Con los créditos que Ceprodel  le ha brindado ha logrado hacerle muchas mejoras a vivienda.
texts.en:
Sra. María Adela L. R. is the mother of three children who are in her care. She currently provides dental consultations from a private clinic. It should be mentioned that she has been in this business for two years. She previously had a business selling basic grains.

Sra. L. R. is requesting this loan in order to buy ceramic, cement, and a door so that she can remodel the clinic in her home. The space will be more useful so that she can improve the living conditions for herself and her family.

With the loans from CEPRODEL, she has been able to make many improvements to her home.

loans.use: Purchase materials to remodel her dental clinic

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en: Anastacia is 43 years old and a single mother of one. She sells construction materials to earn her daily bread. She also does dairy farming to supplement her income. She is very grateful to Faulu Kenya because she has managed to expand her business and improve her standard of living. Being the single mother of a 16-year-old child, she works hard in her business so that she can educate her child. Her desire is to become a successful farmer in the future. She has requested a loan of 35,000 Kes to buy construction materials.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Aulelerie

texts.en: Aurelia is 65 years old. She has three children who are between the ages of 13 and 19 years old. She sells Irish potatoes, small fish, flour etc. She has done this business for six years and it has enabled her to meet her needs and her family’s needs. She is requesting a loan to buy more Irish potatoes, fish and flour for her business. With the profits she plans to open up a shop.

loans.use: to buy more Irish potatoes, fish, and flour.

loans.name: Gerlie

texts.en:
Gerlie G. is from the village of Agay-ayan, Gingoog City. She is 30 years old. Gerlie is married and has two school-aged children. Gerlie owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling canned goods, junk food, biscuits, shampoo, soap & beverages in the local community. Gerlie has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2011, Gerlie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Gerlie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like canned goods & junk food. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Gerlie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods & junk food

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.es:
Edilberto es un padre de familia de 30 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en el caserío Santa Clara del distrito de Batangrande. Un distrito agrícola que se encuentra que pertenece a la Provincia de Ferreñafe, ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una  hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo

Edilberto se dedica  a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura desde que era muy joven. El se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de ganado vacuno desde hace varios años. El los alimenta de granos y pastos naturales, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentemente visitan la zona en donde reside. 

El desea adquirir más ganado  y alimento balanceado para ampliar su establo y percibir mayores ingresos. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Edilberto, age 30, lives with his family in the Santa Clara rural area in the district of Batangrande.  It is an agricultural district which belongs to the province of Ferreñafe, in Lambayeque, over an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

Edilberto has worked in agriculture-related activities since he was very young.  He raises and sells cattle for a living and has been in business for several years.  He feeds them natural grain and fodder and once they reach full development, he sells them to merchants who visit the area frequently.

He wants to purchase more livestock and balanced animal feed to expand his stable and earn more income.  He decided to request a loan in the amount of 2,000 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa, which will help him reach his goal.

loans.use: To buy livestock and balanced animal feed

loans.name: Agapita

texts.en:
Agapita L. is from the village of Poblacion Aurora zamboanga del sur. She is 54 years old., married, and has three adult children. To make a living, Agapita owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling food and drinks to passengers in the bus terminal. Agapita has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Agapita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Agapita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase candies, biscuits, and bottled water for sale. This loan will be Agapita's first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherpeople, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase candies, biscuits, and bottled water for sale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 49 years old. She is married to Paul and they have six children. She has operated her retail shop in Naivasha town for the last three years. She also plants produce in her farm during the planting season to sell.   

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of her friends and this will be her second loan. She paid her previous loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer for planting and also to pay for labor. She sells her produce in the Naivasha market.

In the future, Mary hopes to become a leading farmer in Naivasha town and also grow her retail business to wholesale.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for planting her farm.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa María tiene  64 años es casada, tiene 3 hijos que ya son independientes, vive en casa propia solo con su cónyuge quien se dedica a trabajos de albañilería, la comunidad en la que vive es urbana de tamaño regular ubicada en el distrito de Mochumi, cuenta con servicio de agua y energía eléctrica.

Rosa María cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio la cual es atendida por ella misma. Allí ofrece en venta a los vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida, con esta actividad ella ayuda a su esposo con el sostenimiento económico de su familia.

Rosa María ha venido experimentando una fuerte demanda en su negocio, debido a esto Rosa María piensa  ampliar el negocio adquiriendo más productos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 300 nuevos soles, para lograr sus objetivos

Rosa María es una persona bastante conocida y estimada por los pobladores de la zona en donde reside. Las personas que le conocen la consideran alguien tranquila y bastante responsable.
texts.en:
Rosa María, 64, is married and has three children who already live independently.  She lives in her own house just with her spouse who works doing jobs as a bricklayer.  The community where she lives is urban and of regular size located in Mochumí District.  She has both water and electricity.

Rosa María has a small home-based grocery store that she tends to herself.  She offers neighbors and customers from the area various daily use products, first need and groceries among them.  The business is well received and she helps her husband support the family with income from this business.

Rosa María has been experiencing strong demand in her store.  Because of this she plans to expand the store acquiring more products and because of this she’s thought it advisable to request a 300 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa to reach her goals.

Rosa María is quite a well known and esteemed person by local residents.  People who know her consider her to be calm and quite responsible.

loans.use: to buy new stock items for her store.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a divorced woman with three children, all of whom are adults. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a food vending business, selling from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. Fatuma faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of owning a café in the future.

With the KSHS 30,000, she wants to purchase utensils and 100 plates for her food vending business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her living standard.

loans.use: To purchase utensils and plates for her food vending business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy varnish, nails and soft wood to make more furniture to sell

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en:
Clementine is a 36-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur. She has five children between the ages of 3 and 12 years old. All of her children are in school except for the youngest two. Her husband is a taxi driver. 

Since 2004, Clementine has been selling banana beers locally. This business has helped her meet the needs of her family. She requested this loan so that she can buy more bananas in order to generate more profits. With the profits from her business, she will save and continue to provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase bananas that she will use to make beer

loans.name: Benkola 8 Group

texts.fr:
Les sept  femmes qui constituent le groupe BENKOLA 8 sont toutes mariées dans des familles polygames à Baou, un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative de la république du Mali, avec une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et ont en moyenne 2 enfants.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, MAGNINENI, deuxième personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de main d’œuvre pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Baou, de Koula, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  25 000FCFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The seven members of the Benkola 8 group are all married women living in polygamous families in Baou, a village in the rural community of Banco, Dioila Prefecture, Koulikoro Region (the second administrative region of Mali). They average 35 years of age and have at least two children each.
They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution with the goal of better  managing their activities during the winter season. They cultivate rice and peanuts [ground nuts], among other cultures. They are on their first loan with Soro Yiriwaso. 

With this loan, Magnieni, the second from the left to the right standing in the photo, plans to purchase agricultural inputs [such as fertilizers or insecticides] and small tools and   pay cost of manual labor to work a field of rice and peanuts in the 0.5 ha [about 1.25 acres]. After harvesting, the produce is sold at the markets of Baou, Koula, Banco and N’Gouboougou, to a customer base composed of both men and women. The group members plan to earn an average income of 25,000 West African franks  each per agricultural cycle.

loans.use: to pay for labor, seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, weeding and small tools

loans.name: Corazones Unidos (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Corazones Unidos está formado por 4 mujeres y 2 hombres quienes son amigos, viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió y es admirada por la belleza natural, arquitectónica y cultural que la hace una ciudad muy especial, tiene una gran variedad en su gastronomía que cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños, su gente es muy amable y cordial como nuestros socios quienes laboran día a día en diferentes actividades las mismas que les permiten mejorar económicamente y salir adelante con sus familias.

Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la Señora María Liliana, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 33 años y es madre soltera de 2 hijos de 12 y 8 años de edad, su primer hijo vive con los abuelos y está estudiando en el colegio, su segunda hija estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Doña María Liliana es oriunda del Perú, hace 5 años vino a la ciudad de Cuenca en busca de ayuda para su hija que tiene discapacidad, con las terapias está reaccionando muy bien y tienen una gran mejoría. Hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de productos naturales de la marca Omnilife, este producto lo vende recorriendo y de domingo a domingo sin horario fijo.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de productos naturales de Omnilife.

Su sueño es tener una casa propia en la ciudad de Cuenca.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Corazones Unidos", ("United Hearts"), consists of four women and two men who are friends.  They live in the city of Cuenca.  This city has a cold climate, and is admired for the natural beauty, architecture, and culture that make it a very special city.  It has great variety in its cuisine which captivates the palate of locals and foreigners, and its people are very amiable and friendly; as are our members, who work in various activities on a daily basis that allow them to improve economically and move ahead in life with their families.

One of the members of this group is Señora María Liliana, who lives in the city of Cuenca.  She is 33 years old, and is a single mother of two children aged 12 and 8 years old.  Her oldest child lives with his grandparents and attends school.  Her second child, a daughter, attends a small school in the city.  She does not have her own home, but lives in a rental.

Doña María Liliana is a native of Peru, who came to the city of Cuenca 5 years ago to look for help for her daughter who is disabled.  She's responding well to the treatments, and has shown a big improvement. 

For the last 4 years, she has been selling natural products from the brand Omnilife.  She sells this product by traveling from place to place, which she does from Sunday to Sunday without a fixed schedule.

This is her first loan through the community bank, and she will invest it in buying natural products from Omnilife.

His dream is to own her own home in the city of Cuenca.

loans.use: to buy natural products from Omnilife.

loans.name: Suleiman

texts.en:
Suleiman is a married man with one child who attends school. He lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For the past six years, he has operated a retail shop business, selling household consumptions to his neighbors and passersby. He also sells farm products, which contributes to his other source of income. Suleiman faces a major challenge of delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit. He dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KSHS 40,000, he wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and cooking fat oil. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Mykailo

texts.en:
Mykailo is married with two children. He has owned a retail business selling bathroom equipment for 8 years. His honesty and friendly attitude attracts many customers. A large assortment allows his customers to make good choices and purchase what they need at his store. 

Mykailo would like to expand his business since it is the only source of income for his family. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Grivnas to purchase additional inventory of washbasins and toilets. Mykailo hopes to make more money and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase washbasins and toilets for sale in his retail store.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina es socia del Banco Comunal “Medallitas de Oro II”, ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos.  Estudió sólo la primaria.
Trabaja desde hace tres años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos,  con  su préstamo anterior de   S/. 300.00 nuevo soles compró  granos de la región como papa, chuño, también se dedica a la venta de animales como vacunos y ovinos.
Ahora solicitará un nuevo préstamo por las suma de S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles, préstamo que invertirá en la compra de una vaca o una docena de ovejas, los animales los compra en la localidad de Juliaca, Taraco, Acora, todos los sábados y domingos, a veces los carnea y la carne la vende en la ciudad de Puno.  En el negocio trabaja junto con su hermana, su esposo trabaja en la mina.
Su sueño es mejorar el negocio y así incrementar sus ingresos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal la puntualidad y comunicación con las socias.
texts.en:
Paulina is a member of the Medallitas de Oro II communal bank, which is located in Puno district, in Puno province and department. She is 34, married and has three children. She studied only in primary school.

She has worked with Manuela Ramos/CrediMUJER for three years. With her prior loan of 300 nuevos soles, she bought regional food such as potatoes and chuño (indigenous freeze dried potatoes). She also sells animals such as cows and sheep.

Now Paulina will request a new loan of 2,000 nuevos soles which she will invest in the purchase of a cow or one dozen sheep. She will sell the animals in the towns of Juliaca, Taraco and Acora every Saturday and Sunday.  At times she slaughters them and sells the meat in the city of Puno. She works with her sister in the business. Her husband works in the mine.

Her dream is to improve the business and thus increase their income.

What she likes about the communal bank is the punctuality of the members and the communication among them.

loans.use: to buy a cow or a dozen sheep.

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es:
Pedro de 56 años, vive con su esposa en su casa propia, sus hijos son mayores de edad e independientes,  cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ubicada en el distrito de Chepen que pertenece al departamento de la Libertad.  Esta zona tiene como principal actividad la agricultura y ganadería.  

Pedro se dedica  a la venta de frutas en el mercado de Chepen, con una experiencia de varios años , es por eso que es muy conocido y tiene su propia clientela,  las ventas de sus productos se han ido incrementando; al igual que sus ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida. 

El préstamo que solicitó a Edpyme Alternativa mediante Capital Semilla fue de 1500 nuevos soles, el cual lo va utilizar  para comprar mayor cantidad de fruta para abastecer su negocio y su clientela, ya que es consumido diariamente, el aumento de sus ventas le permitirá cubrir su crédito, cumpliendo con sus obligaciones de casa.  Pedro es una persona con muchos aspiraciones y uno de ellos es que con su trabajo y esfuerzo pueda tener más grande su  puesto en el mercado y contar con más comodidades en su casa.
texts.en:
Pedro is 56 years old and lives with his wife in their own house. His children are all adults and independent. His house has all the basic services and is located in the district of Chepen which belongs to the department of La Libertad. This area's main economic activity is agriculture and livestock.

Pedro sells fruit at the Chepen market and has several years experience doing this. This is why he is well-known and has his own customers. His sales have been growing as has his income to improve his quality of life.

The loan requested by Capital Semilla for him to Edpyme Alternativa was for 1500 nuevos soles (PEN) which he is going to use to buy a bigger fruit supply for his business and customers, as it is eaten daily. The increase in his sales will allow him to cover the loan, fulfilling his household obligations. Pedro is a person with many aspirations one is that with his hard work and effort he will have a larger stand at the market and have more amenities at home.

loans.use: to buy a larger fruit supply for his business and customers.

loans.name: Maher

texts.en:
Maher is a 44-year-old man.  He is married and has two sons and three daughters.  He has a food stall making homos, fool, and falafel - local breakfast dishes in Palestine. This food stall is the family's source of income, which Maher looks in the future to expand into a small restaurant offering more local dishes.

Maher wants to purchase basic ingredients for these dishes such as: chickpeas, black peas and ginger oil, but the amount of money he has isn't enough, so he needs to take a loan of amount $1,000 from FATEN. When Maher gets the loan, he will increase the amount of food he produces for his clients.  This will increase his income and enable him to offer better life conditions to his family. 

Maher appears in the photo next to his stall.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make food for sale

loans.name: Damira's Group

texts.en:
Damira is the leader of this group. She is 56 and married to a teacher. Together with her husband she has raised three sons and a daughter. Ten years ago with an initial investment of 10,000 soms Damira purchased a cow. Her husband and the older son help her in cattle breeding.  Every day Damira sells about 5-6 liters of milk, and in this way she earns about 2,000 soms per month.  With money received from the loan she wants to purchase more cattle for breeding. In the future she wishes to open a small, nice shop.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.es: Vanessa, de 31 años, es una, mujer trabajadora y emprendedora. Vive con Orlando, fruto de su unión tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad a los que quiere mucho. Juntos habitan en casa de sus padres. La actividad que realiza Vanessa es la venta de repuestos de mototaxi, siendo este un negocio familiar, que funciona en otra casa ubicada en una zona céntrica de la ciudad. Aprendió de esta actividad de sus padres, y hace dos años decidio abrir su propio negocio de manera independiente, contando con la ayuda de dos mecánicos que dan servicio de reparación a los que paga por semana trabajada. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el poder sentirse independiente, estar en actividad y ser productiva y no depender solo de los ingresos de su pareja, que es técnico de la Fuerza Aérea en actividad, y así ella misma puede pagar sus gastos y colaborar con la economía del hogar. Desea crecer más su negocio, incrementando el volumen de su mercadería, viendo que tiene bastante demanda ya que esta ubica en una zona céntrica de la ciudad. Este seria el tercer crédito con la institución MFP, se siente bien y le gusta su trabajo de su banco comunal. Con el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en su totalidad en la compra de más mercadería, como repuestos de mototaxis.
texts.en:
31-year-old Vanessa is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman.  She lives with Orlando and, as a fruit of their relationship, they have a 3-year-old son who they love very much.  They live together in her parents' home.

Vanessa's business is selling spare parts for motorcycle taxis.  This is a family business.  She runs her business from another house which is located in a central area of the city.  She learned this business from her parents and, two years ago, she decided to open her own independent business, with the help of two mechanics who provide a repair service, whom she pays by the week.  

What Vanessa most enjoys about her business is being able to feel independent, being active, being productive, and not being solely dependent on her partner's income (her partner is an Air Force technician).  In this way, she can cover her expenses herself and contribute towards the household financially.  She would like to grow further in her business, increasing her volume of merchandise, as she can see that she has a fair amount of demand because she is located in a central area of the city.

This will be Vanessa's third loan from MFP and she feels happy.  She enjoys working with her community bank.  Vanessa will invest all of the sum that she has requested in buying more merchandise such as spare parts for motorcycle taxis.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts for motorcycle taxis

loans.name: Ivan

texts.ru:
Иван разведен. Он живет в Ивано-Франковске, занимается пассажирскими перевозками по Украине. У Ивана есть собственный автомобиль ВАЗ 21114 2006 года выпуска. Услуги транспортных перевозок он стал предоставлять 7 лет назад. До этого торговал овощами оптом и в розницу на продовольственном рынке, а потом решил поменять специализацию. С тех пор его доходы выросли и на данный момент составляют 6 000 гривен. 

Иван планирует использовать кредит КИВА в 7 000 гривен для того, чтобы приобрести зимние колеса, осуществить текущий ремонт двигателя своего автомобиля. Этот бизнес является главным источником дохода для Ивана. Одной из главных целей, которые ставит для себя Иван, является приобретение более нового автомобиля. В будущем Иван планирует и дальше работать в этой сфере, так как пока не видит для себя других, более интересных перспектив.  
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en: Ivan is divorced.  He lives in Ivano-Frankivsk and is involved in passenger transportation within Ukraine.  Ivan has his own car, VAZ 21114, made in 2006.  He started proving transportation services seven years ago.  Previously, he sold vegetables wholesale and retail at a food market and then decided to change his speciality.  Since then, his income rose and currently amounts to 6 000 hryvnia.  Ivan plans to use the 7 000 hryvnia Kiva loan to buy winter tires and make regular repairs to his car engine.  This business is Ivan's primary source of income.  One of the goals that Ivan sets for himself is to purchase a newer car.  In the future, Ivan plans to continue working in this field because for now he does not see other, more interesting enterprises.

loans.use: to buy winter tires and make regular repairs to his car engine

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
This is Amelita, who is 47 and a resident of Tondo, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Roberto and is a mother to her two children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses. 
 
Amelita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a small amount of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns a profit by buying supplies at wholesale prices and reselling them by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 400 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help continue operations of her business, she is requesting a loan of PHP 22,000. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Amelita dreams of being able to give her all her children a good and high quality education through her hard work in her business. She also hopes to have her own grocery store. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which  she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
At her retail outlet in Jinja, 26-year-old Anita sells stoves, cups, plates, glasses, wrapping paper, etc.  Her business took root five years ago.

Anita is still single and without children. Five years of experience have brought her to terms with the grueling rigors and at times, the tough trivial routine of running a business.

Anita goes about her business with diligence, determination, and grit. These are the principles which have helped her overcome adversity and make strides.

Anita hopes to venture out into importing what she sells, on the basis of the fact that she spends excessively in making purchases.
She is upbeat about her prospects once she embarks on direct importing of stoves, glasses, plates, cutlery, etc. from Kenya.

She says this Kiva loan will come in handy for the purchase of the merchandise to resell.

loans.use: to purchase stoves, glasses, plates, cutlery, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Bilgi

texts.en:
Bilgi is a married woman with two grown children. The younger one is 29 and the elder one is 31. She has been a Maya member for two credit cycles. She has a flower shop and has been doing this work for 4 years. She has a broad consumer group. With the first credit she used from Maya, she bought flowers to sell for mother's day. With this second credit, she will be able to sign a contract with a large firm and be able to buy flowers in bulk to fulfill orders. 

When she first opened her shop, she had some financial difficulties, but she says that later, Maya provided her with many benefits. Now, Bilge has improved her business and is working with her younger son in her shop. 

In the future, she wants to open new shops and support her children more. She is a very determined, honest and hardworking woman, and also an altruistic mother who dedicates her life to her children.

Translated from Turkish by Maya volunteers

Bilgi Hanım,yetişkin iki çocuğu olan evli bir kadın.  Küçük olan 29 ve büyük olan 31 yaşında.  Bu Maya’dan aldığı ikinci kredi.  Bilgi Hanım’ın çiçekçi dükkanı var ve 4 yıldır bu işte çalışıyor.  Geniş tüketici grubu var.  Maya’dan kullandığı birinci kredi ile,anneler gününde satmak için çiçek almıştı.  İkinci kredi ile, büyük bir firma ile anlaşma yapıp, bu firma için çiçek getirdi.   Bilgi Hanım,dükkanı ilk açtığı dönemde ve ilerleyen sürelerde ,maddi konuda biraz sıkıntılar yaşamış fakat ilerleyen dönemlerinde Maya’dan çok fayda gördüğünü dile getiriyor.   Bu iş sayesinde zaten çocuklarına destek olabilmenin yanında işlerini büyütmesi ile birlikte şimdi oğluyla beraber çalışmaya başladılar.   Gelecekte ,yeni şubeler açmak istiyor ve çocukları ile beraber yürütmek istiyor.   Bilgi hanım, azimli,dürüst ,kararlı ve çalışkan bir kadın aynı zamanda tüm hayatını çocuklarına adayan fedakar bir anne.

loans.use: to buy flowers.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 41 years old and married with five children.

She is in agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Mary Jane is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Mary Jane has been in this business for 8 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: José Héctor

texts.en:
Héctor is kind and friendly and his business involves selling corn on a cob and hamburgers. He also works as a security guard in a private company. At the moment, he has one employee working in his store, but he would for his business to grow so he can employ more people that need work. Héctor says this Christmas season, he has seen a stronger demand for his products, but he is not able to provide the supply for this demand.

Héctor needs $250 USD to buy raw material so he can sell more of his products. This way, not only will you be helping Héctor, but also his employee who works and depends on this job. Both he and his employee are grateful for your support and generosity.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva Volunteer.

Don Héctor es un una persona muy amable y amigable, su negocio consiste en la venta de elotes y hamburguesas, además de trabajar como vigilante en una empresa privada. Actualmente tiene un empleado trabajando en su negocio, sin embargo él desea que su negocio crezca para poder emplear a más personas que necesiten trabajar. Don Héctor dice que esta temporada navideña su demanda se ve fuertemente incrementada, pero no cuenta con la capacidad de productos para enfrentar esta demanda.

Él requiere de $250 USD para comprar materia prima que le permita aumentar la cantidad de productos para vender, de esta manera no sólo ayudarás a Don Héctor, sino a su empleado quien trabaja y subsiste de este trabajo. Tanto él como su trabajador agradecen tu apoyo y generosidad.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Hipolita

texts.en:
For five years I have dedicated myself to the buying and selling of plastic items for the home, office and elsewhere. They almost sell themselves, since a household always needs a pail, bucket or something similar. I sell door to door, which helps me rotate my inventory faster; many people can't leave their house and go to the market and buy the items they need. The income helps me provide for my three kids. I'm a single mother and I must provide for my family.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer.

Tengo 5 anos de dedicarme a la compra y venta de articulos de plasticos para el hogar, oficinas y otros. Estos se venden ya que en los hogares siempre se necesita una paila, balde y otros. Yo vendo de puerta en puerta lo que me ayuda a rotar mis productos mas rapido ya que muchas personas no pueden salir de su casa a los mercados a comprar los articulos que necesiten. Mis ingresos me ayudan a mantener a mis 3 hijos ya que soy madre soltera y tengo que mantener a mis familia.

loans.use: Buy pails, buckets, garbage cans, water bottles, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bicycles for his bicycle transport business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
43-year-old Maria M. is married with four children. She sells dried fish, vegetables, rice and candies in the village of Kikurala in Northern Sierra Leone.

Maria has been in business for five years but due to lack of capital, she could not make enough profit to expand and diversify her business. Maria says it takes time to save a small amount of cash to build up enough for investment. With her previous loan, Maria was able to purchase six bags of rice from farmers. That increased her profit, and she used some of the profit to hire laborers to work in her farm.

Maria works together with her husband to develop the business. She is requesting a US$ 200 loan to purchase more rice and store it for the off-season.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing wholesale goods for the off season.

loans.name: Tinei

texts.en: Tinei is 48 years old and is married with seven kids. Two of her kids are in school and others are married. She is a hard-working mother who runs her own BBQ business. She started the BBQ business and because of her success, she is only now asking for her second loan. She has a strong work ethic with what she is doing. Tinei earns $180 profit a day from selling her BBQ. It is fun when she sells the BBQ everyday on the road in front of her house. With the next loan, she is planning to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and supplies for her barbecue business

loans.name: Goma

texts.en:
Mrs.Goma S., 49 years old, lives in Tangal. Tangal is located nearby the famous market, Mangar Bazaar, of Lalitpur district of Kathmandu Valley. Most of the people in this area are engaged in traditional work. She has eight members in her family including herself. Her husband, Mr. Krishna Gopal, is a retired government officer. Her older son works in a traveling agency and younger son works in a shop. Her daughter is studying in grade 11 and her granddaughter is in primary school.
Mrs. S. opened small hotel 2 years ago. In her hotel she sells newari food. Newari food is very popular in Kathmandu Valley because the majority of the people in this area are Newars. Now she seeks a loan to buy goods such as food grains, vegetables and others in order to meet the demand of her customers. She wants to change their standard of living and also provide better educations to her daughter and granddaughter.

loans.use: To buy food materials for her work

loans.name: Yao

texts.fr:
Mr Yao D. is one of the best hairdressers of the city. A single man without children, he is 25 years old and has been an owner of his hair salon for the past 6 years. He has three apprentices and with this loan, would like to buy new shaving machines and open a new salon for his younger brother who has just graduated in hairstyling.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur Yao D. est l’un des meilleurs coiffeurs de la ville. Célibataire sans enfant, il est âgé de 25 ans et est maître de salon depuis 06 ans. Il a 03 apprentis et désire avec ce crédit acquérir de nouvelles tondeuses et ouvrir un salon pour son petit frère qui vient d’avoir son diplôme de coiffure.

loans.use: Acquisition of 4 shaving machines and setting up a new hair salon for the satisfaction of customers

loans.name: Nati

texts.en: Nati, 51, is a mother of 4 children. To support the family, she sells bags of ice from her house for $0.5 each and earns $3 a day. Her husband, M., sells vegetables, and earns $10 a week. She is requesting a loan of $100 to expand her business. She is  a member of MBK and she will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Marhamat

texts.en: C. Marhamat is 50 years old. She is a vendor in the central local market where she sells candies and other sweets. This business has been the main source of income for Marhamat's family for the last 12 years, allowing improvement of their living conditions. Now Marhamat is planning to expand her business and to increase the range of goods for sale. Therefore, she requests US$1,000.00 for 5 months. Marhamat has been a client of IMON since 2005 and she promises to repay the loan promptly. She thanks everyone who supports her.

loans.use: To expand a sweets selling business.

loans.name: Bikwao

texts.en:
Bikwao is 48 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages 18,16 and 5 years old. Bikwao has a small business. She started in 1988. Every day, she works from 7am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

In the past, Bikwao has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Sopha

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopha P. and her husband have been married since 1971 and have six children: three sons and three daughters. One of their children is married and lives outside the family home, another one works full time, while three are in school. One of their daughters is a weaver, and Mrs. Sopha's son in-law is a blacksmith. The family lives on an island on Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Sopha has been a weaver for over twenty years, but by now has transferred her business to her daughter. Mrs. Sopha's husband is a farmer. He grows many kind of crops in the farm near the house.

Mrs. Sotha is requesting a loan of US$1,000 to purchase silk material for weaving and blacksmith’s material for her son in-law to allow him to expand his business.

loans.use: Purchase of silk material for weaving and of blacksmith’s material

loans.name: Amira

texts.en: Amira was born in 1974. She lives with her husband in a small village called Dubnica, near the town of Kalesija. Amira works in agriculture, poultry, and cattle-breeding. Amira sells eggs, milk and milk products. She earns about 300 KM monthly. Amira is using money that she earns to buy books, which are very expensive, for her two sons. Her husband is a seasonal construction worker. Because he does not work regularly, her job is important to their monthly income.This is her first loan at MCO WWI and it amounts to 600 KM. She intends to use this loan to buy more chickens to increase her family's monthly income.

loans.use: To buy more chickens.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
Edwin is a young entrepreneur who, at 21 years old already knows the real meaning of work and how much dignity it brings to one's life. Since finishing his secondary studies he has learned different trades, resulting in opening and operating his Internet "cabina," (a place to use the Internet for a fee) and with the effort and support of his parents he was able to buy six computers. Unfortunately, three months ago he was the victim of a robbery. Since then, in an area of his home he has created a dance school, and in addition, this hardworking young man decided to purchase and rent out sound and lighting equipment for various social events. All of this effort is made with the goal in mind of reopening his Internet "cabina" and provide good service to his community. This exemplary young man needs your collaboration in order to accomplish his goal. Edwin promises not to betray your trust.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, a Kiva volunteer.

Edwin es un joven emprendedor que a sus 21 años ya sabe el verdadero significado del trabajo y cuan dignificante es en la vida. Desde que concluyó sus estudios secundarios ha realizado diferentes oficios con el fin de abrir e implementar su cabina de Internet, con el esfuerzo y apoyo de sus padres logró comprar 6 computadoras, pero desafortunadamente hace 3 meses sufrió un robo. Desde entonces en uno de los ambientes de su casa puso una academia de baile, ya que también cuenta con dichas cualidades, adicionalmente a esta labor, este empeñoso joven decidió adquirir y alquilar equipos de sonido y de luces para diversos eventos sociales. Todo este esfuerzo es para implementar nuevamente sus cabinas de Internet y prestar un buen servicio a su comunidad. Este ejemplar joven requiere de tu colaboración para cumplir su propósito, Edwin promete no defraudar tu confianza.

loans.use:
Increase capital in order to continue with his diverse trades with the end result of accruing  money and recover the lost business caused by a robbery.

Incremento de capital para continuar con sus diversos oficios a fin de reunir dinero y recuperar el negocio que perdió debido a un robo.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Ruth is single, 32 years old, and lives with her mother in the city of Juliaca. She works in the business of buying and selling secondhand American clothes and belts. She travels frequently to buy and sell her merchandise in the cities of Puno on Saturdays, in Juliaca on Sundays, and sporadically in Ayaviri. All the cities she visits are more than two hours from her own city. She likes her business as it allows her to survive and to help her mother, but transporting her merchandise is very complicated. With her loan Ruth will buy merchandise and in this way can save in order to buy a small car to transport her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne, Kiva volunteer.

Ruth es soltera, tiene 32 años vive con su madre, en la ciudad de Juliaca. Se dedica al negocio de la compra y venta de ropa y correas americanas de segunda mano, viaja con mucha frecuencia comprando y vendiendo su mercadería en las ciudades de Puno los sábados, en Juliaca los domingos y de manera esporádica a Ayaviri, todas estas ciudades se encuentran a más de dos horas de su ciudad. Le gusta el negocio de la venta ya que le permite subsistir y ayudar a su mamá, pero el transportar la mercadería se le hace muy complicado. Con el dinero del préstamo Ruth comprará mercadería, y así poder ahorrar y comprar un carrI. para transportar su mercadería.

loans.use: To increase the merchandise for her business in order to,  with the profits, buy a car to transport the clothes she sells.

loans.name: Malvina

texts.en:
Malvina D. is married and has three kids. She lives with her family in Obuasi in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She is 37 years old. She runs a clothing shop and has been selling jeans, blouses and skirts, women's slippers and dressing bags for the past seven years.

Malvina is constrained by insufficient funds to run the business. She needs this loan to inject more working capital into the business to scale up her business progress. She believes the loan will help her to have resources to purchase good quality and large quantity to upgrade her inventory. She says she would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To purchase jeans, ladies' wear, and slippers for re-sale

loans.name: Bahodir

texts.en:
Bahodir T., who lives in the Spitamen region of Tajikistan, is engaged in the livestock business. Notably, he is married and has 3 children. Specifically, he purchases and sells livestock for a living, but he supplements the income from his livestock business by growing wheat and rice. He proudly states that he is a very experienced livestock holder and that he has therefore acquired the necessary skills to succeed in his line of business.
