Junto a su esposo, Juliana trabaja todos los días en sus cultivos. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado que sus tierras sean muy productivas, ya que sabe que todo producto que obtenga será D. muy buena calidad. Ella principalmente siembra cacao, café y achiote, ya que estos productos son muy solicitados en el mercado D. la ciudad D. San Francisco. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos D. la plaga D. insectos que pueden afectar su siembra. Lleva 22 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos desD. la chacra hasta los centros D. secados. Con el crédito solicitado podrá comprar varios sacos D. estiércol D. animales para mejorar la productividad D. su parcela. Para el futuro D. su negocio, espera poder comprar más tierras para incrementar su producción actual. Este es el quinto préstamo D. Juliana, y por tanto agradece a todos ustedes por apoyarlo, y en esta oportunidad también espera beneficiarse con un nuevo préstamo. En su banco comunal es una socia, muy responsable, D. lo cual se siente muy orgullosa. Los mil nuevos soles solicitados, los invertirá en mejorar sus cultivos, para ello comprará estiércol D. animales.
texts.en:
Juliana, 48, is a hardworking woman.  She lives in her own house with her husband, Sergio, 47, and their four beloved children that she wants to proviD. a better quality of life for.  

Juliana works on her crops alongsiD. her husband every day.  With much effort she’s managed to make her fields very productive knowing that whatever products she obtains will be of very good quality.  She mainly grows cocoa beans, coffee and achiote since these are the products that are very sought after at the market in the city of San Francisco.  What she enjoys the most about her work is protecting her crops from insect infestations that can affect her crop yields.   She’s been in this line of work for 22 years and considers the most difficult part having to transport her crops from the fields to the drying centers.

With the requested loan she’ll be able to buy several sacks of animal manure to improve her field’s productivity.  For the future of her business, she hopes to be able to buy more land to increase actual production.

This is Juliana’s fifth loan.  She thanks all of your for supporting her and hopes that once again she will be benefitted with a loan.  She is a very responsible member of her communal bank which makes her very proud.  She will use the requested 1000 new soles to invest in her crops purchasing animal manure.

loans.use: to buy sacks of animal manure.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marisol; ella tiene 28 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de bordados, la socia trabaja haciendo trabajos de bordados como manteles,cojines,alfombras entre otros trabajos, ella borda en hilos y lana y luego los vende al por mayor a las diferentes tiendas que vende estos trabajos, la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de bordados. La socia solicita el préstamo para el comprar materiales como hilos, lanas y agujas para hacer los bordados.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This communal bank member belongs to the communal bank "Cusco." This bank is located in the district of Cusco, part of the province and department of Cusco.

She is Sra. Marisol. She is 28 years old and is married. She has 2 children. She alternates her daily activities with her embroidery business. She embroiders such items as tablecloths, pillows, and rugs, among other items. She embroiders in thread and wool and then sells her items wholesale in the different shops that sell these items. She works from 7 am until 8 pm. Through this business she is raising her children. She wants to expand and improve her embroidery business. She is applying for the loan to buy materials such as thread, wool, and needles to do embroidery.

She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy materials such as thread, wool, and needles to do embroidery

loans.name: Soñadores Con Proposito 3, 6 & 7 Group

texts.en:
Margarita is the coordinator of her group "Soñadores con Proposito" (Dreamer with a purpose) 3, 6 & 7. This group is located in the city of El Seybo, one of the most agricultural and rural cities in the Dominican Republic. The borrowers run their businesses in the communities near the city. They sell clothes, shoes, grocery store items and others.

Margarita makes her home here in a simple house with her long-term partner and four children. She is running a clothing store where she sells all kinds of men's and women's clothes. She will use this loan to increase her inventory. She is excited to be taking out her 10th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and expanded her business.

This Esperanza associate began with us because she needed capital to invest in her business. After some loans, Margarita's business has been improving with every investment, and she uses the profits to reinvest in her business and to save. She thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Florencio

texts.es:
El señor Florencio es origen de la comunidad de Cochimita de la Provincia de Tiraque del Departamento de Cochabamba actualmente se encuentra casado con 2 hijos.
Prácticamente la actividad económica a la que se dedica del señor Florencio es la agricultura, la producción de tubérculos y cereales en su comunidad de Cochimita.
El crédito que solicita es para la compra de insumos agrícolas, el objetivo del cliente es incrementar su producción agrícola al año siguiente, y así de mejorar las condiciones de vida en su familia, puesto que las condiciones en las que vive son muy precarias y humildes.
texts.en:
Señor Florencio is from the community of Cochimita, in the province of Tiraque and the department of Cochabamba. He is now married and has two children.

His business is agriculture. He grows root crops and grains in his community of Cochimita.

The loan that he is applying for will be used to purchase farming supplies. His goal is to increase his agricultural production next year and thus improve the living conditions of his family, since the conditions in which they live are very precarious and modest.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Katiuska

texts.es: Katiuska, de 32 años de edad, convive con su pareja y fruto de ello tienen tres hijos en etapa escolar. Juntos residen en la localidad de Santa Rosa, donde tiene su propio techo construido a base de madera y techo de calamina. A pesar de no tener los esttuidos primarios completos, Katiuska no se amilanó ante las adversidades que se les presentaba en el camino, es mas sacó fuerzas para montar su propio negocio. Hoy  produce y comercializa cacao y café, y por tanto recibe ingresos considerables. Su pareja es quien más la ayuda en éstas tareas, pero en temporada de cosecha tiene a cargo de 02 peones,quienes rápidamente extraen sus frutos, siendo llevados a los centros de acopio de su localidad. Su plan a futuro es expandirse en otras zonas, para ello buscará nuevos terrenos de cultivo con la finalidad de progresar. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y siente muy feliz al recibir el apoyo de los financistas ya que sabe que el dinero obtenido le será muy beneficioso en el progreso de su labor. Con el dinero que solicita, lo invertirá en contratar peones para que limpien y fertilicen sus tierras y cuiden sus plantas de cacao y café.
texts.en:
Katiuska, age 32, lives with her life partner and their three school age children.  They live in Santa Rosa, where they have their own home built from wood with a tin roof.

Even though Katiuska did not complete elementary school, she is not daunted by the adversities that present themselves along the way.  She even gathered strength to set up her own business.  She now produces and sells cacao and café from which she receives considerable income.    

Her life partner is the one who helps her the most with these jobs.  However, during the harvesting season she has two field workers who help to quickly gather the crops.  The crops are taken to the distribution center in her area.

Her plan for the future is to expand into other zones.  To do so she will look for new fields in order to make progress. 

This is her second loan with MFP.  She is very happy to receive support from the lenders.  She knows that the money received will be very beneficial to her in making progress with her work.  The money that she is requesting will be to pay field workers to clear and fertilize her fields and to take care of her cacao and coffee plants.

loans.use: to pay field workers.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is 58 years old. She is married with 5 children. She has a piggery where she raises hogs intended for selling. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy vaccines and food for the maintenance of her hogs. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Erlinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase vaccines and food for her hogs.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella, a 30-year-old married mother of two children, both of whom are in school, has a business selling clothes in Kator, South Sudan. She is married to a businessman. Stella has requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase more clothing to sell, and  will use her extra income to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ragchaa

texts.en:
Ragchaa is 30 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Arhangai Province, Mongolia. His wife babysits her two infants. He started his transportation business in 2003 by transporting tourists for a daily fee. He is well experienced and has so many regular customers that he has no day off. He has bought his own yard and upgraded his car with the profit. 

Now that winter is approaching, he needs to service his car in order to survive in the harsh Mongolian winter. He is a hardworking and diligent man who says "I will do everything I can to get my boys educated, I don't want them to live like me." He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to repair the car.

loans.use: To repair his car

loans.name: Phidelis

texts.en: Phidelis is a hardworking business woman, who is 51 years old and married. For over ten years, she has been practicing dairy farming to make a living. She loves farming and she has dedicated most of her time to it.  She has been able to retain her business because of a good reputation with her customers. She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a dairy cow. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Raed

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 36 years old and married with two children.

Raed has had a barber shop since 2008. He offers haircuts and shaves and trims beards. He has significant experience in this field and a deep understanding of local consumers. He is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $1,200 loan to purchase a generator, television and satellite for his shop. He is optimistic about his business development and hopes that the coming years will continue to bring positive growth.

loans.use: To purchase generator, television and satellite for his shop.

loans.name: Gurban

texts.en:
Gurban lives in the village of Azizkendi in East Georgia. He is married and lives with his family: wife – Piala, 13-year-old son and 11-year-old daughter. The children go to school. 

Gurban is leading the agricultural business for his family, which is the main source of the income for the family. The family has 2 milk cows and 3 calves.   Gurban  produces cheese and sells it in the village to dairy products retailers.  The family also has a greenhouse where cucumbers and tomatoes are grown.  The harvested vegetables are sold locally to the retailers as well.  The total average monthly income for the family is 1000 Laris. 

Gurban requested credit to purchase an additional milk cow. The family will have 50% more milk for cheese production from this purchase. They will increase the sale of cheese and thus get more income, which will allow them to increase their spending and improve their family living conditions.

loans.use: purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Maria Leticia

texts.es: La señora Maria Leticia a sus 55 años es una gran hija quien se encuentra a cargo de su padre quien tiene más de 70 años, de un cultivo de papa, cría de vacas y dos sobrinos a quienes su madre murió hace 7 años de cáncer. Con el ánimo de salir adelante y sobrepasar las dificultades que el invierno a causado en su cultivo y en la economía de la familia, la señora Maria Leticia necesita de la compra de abonos y riegos con los cuales puede mejorar su cultivo y así poder sobrellevar los gastos de su hogar y mejorar la calidad de vida de su padre y dos sobrinos.
texts.en: Señora Maria Leticia, at her 55 years of age, is a wonderful daughter who takes care of her father, who is over 70, a potato crop, their cattle and two nephews whose mother died of cancer 7 years ago.  With a spirit that inspires her to get ahead and move past the difficulties the winter caused to her crops and her family's finances, Señora Maria Leticia plans to purchase fertilizer and irrigation supplies.  With the purchase, she will be able to improve her crop and thereby meet the household expenses and improve her father's and nephews' quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural items like fertilizers and irrigation supplies.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is single and she has five children. As a single parent, she is responsible for feeding, clothing and paying her children’s school fees with her income. For the past five years, Sarah has been selling cooking utensils, saucepans, and bowls at Asebu Brebia. Sarah completed J.H.S.  

Sarah is requesting a loan to purchase more cooking utensils and bowls to sell. She hopes to use the profits from her business to build a shop where she can sell her cooking wares.

loans.use: to buy cooking utensils and bowls to sell

loans.name: Vanesa

texts.en:
Vanesa is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala east region of Uganda. She is single and has one child who is currently in school. For the past 2 years, Vanesa has been working hard to manage her small charcoal business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Vanesa has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more and different types of clothes to sell, and will help Vanesa to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her child. Vanesa hopes that, in the future, she will be able to build a very big conmmatial house for herself. 

Vanesa is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more and different types of clothes to sell

loans.name: Anielka De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
La joven Anielka de los Ángeles, labora como operaria en unas de las empresas privadas de la ciudad de León, se dedica a esta desde hace 2 años, inicia sus labores en turnos variados de 06:00 am y finalizándolas a las 02:00 pm y de 02:00 pm a 10:00 pm de lunes a sábado en este mismo horario, ella realiza esta labor para la mantención de su hogar.

la joven Anielka, se acercó a Ceprodel a solicitar un crédito el que utilizo  para la compra de arena, bloques, hierro y cemento, dichos materiales fueron implementados en la remodelación y mejora de su humilde vivienda lo que le permitirá mejorar su calidad y nivel de vida.

loans.use: Compra de arena, bloques, hierro y cemento

loans.name: Chico

texts.pt:
O cliente Chico de 54 anos de idade é casado, militar, pai de 7 filhos dos quais 1 frequenta o ensino superior, 1 já concluiu o nível médio, 4 frequentam o ensino primário, 1 frequenta o ensino secundário, vive na casa própria.
Com o valor do empréstimo pretende comprar, ferros, cimento, pedra, pregos, arame, barrotes chapas de zinco para dar continuidade da sua obra.
A cliente tem como sonho, concluir a sua casa para oferecer um lar melhor a sua família, e futuramente comprar uma viatura para o seu dia-a-dia .
Tem como principais desafios financeiros tem estado a trabalhar e pretende tomar mais vezes o crédito para suprir as dificuldades e alcançar os seus sonhos
texts.en:
Chico is 54 years old and is married with seven children. One of his children is in college, another has graduated from high school, one is in high school and four are in elementary school. Chico works in the military and his family lives in their own home.

With this loan, Chico plans to buy iron, cement, stone, nails, wire, wooden beams and zinc plates in order to continue with a home construction project. His plans for the future are to finish construction of his home in order to offer his family a better living situation and to buy a vehicle for his daily needs. His main challenges have been financial ones but he has been working and he hopes to take out more loans in the future in order to overcome obstacles and to make his dreams a reality.

loans.use: buy iron, cement, stone, nails, wire, wooden beams and zinc plates in order to continue with a construction project.

loans.name: Airene

texts.en:
Airene is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Airene is 30 years old and has three children are still in school.

Airene has a fishing business in the Philippines. Airene requested a PHP 17000 loan amount through NWTF to buy motor engine, fishing net and gasoline for her fishing boat.

Airene has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy motor engine, fishing net and gasoline for her fishing boat

loans.name: Sevinc

texts.en:
Sevinc has a small her own market. She is internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Lachin region. Sevinc is 29 years old, she was settled in  Binagadi region Sumgayit shosse.This single girl wants to be a great businesswoman. She is hard worker, has been engaged  in this business for 11 years. This is not her first loan,  before she borrowed loans 3 time. 
The first loan was $400. She built this market with this loan.
The second loan was $800. This loan she spent to buy the foodstuffs.
The third time she borrowed $1500, bought the 1 refrigerator and the sort of the products.
She has a lot of plans about her business. She applies for a loan of $2000 to expand her market, to open the new other markets, to buy the refrigerator and to increase the sort of products.

loans.use: To open the second market

loans.name: Mike Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a young married man with one nursery level child. He has formal training in mechanics and carpentry. He started his business in 2002 to meet his family's financial needs.

This is Jackson’s second loan with PEMCI and his first with Kiva. The first loan of $150 was used to grow his business and was repaid in a timely manner. With this loan, he was able to open a yard for selling firewood to the local community. Firewood constitutes the main form of cooking fuel and is becoming scarce due to deforestation. Hence, Jackson is providing a vital service to his local community to meet their fuel needs.

With the experience and advantages derived from the first loan, Jackson has now requested another loan - this time of $450 - to boost his timber business further, and to enable him to buy timber and diversify into furniture-making. The business now employs two people who sell firewood in the local markets.

His success in business has made him a local role model for young people. To support his community, he teaches local youth skills in mechanics. This young man is truly worthy of our support, and we hope to find and encourage many more business people like him.

loans.use: To expand his timber & firewood selling business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy three steers

loans.name: Ibrohim

texts.ru:
Баходуров Иброхим является клиентом вот уже четыре года. Женат, имеет троих детей. Образование среднее. Жена домохозяйка. Дети работают, младший сын помогает отцу в его деятельности . Он занимается реализацией продуктов питания и хозяйственных товаров. Когда стал клиентом «Микроинвест» его активы составляли 200$, тогда он продавал только хозяйственные товары. После неоднократного кредитования и целевого использования его активы возросли до 2000$ и он добавил в ассортимент товара продукты питания. В дальнейшем хочет открыть еще одну торговую точку. P.S: На фотографии его сын

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Ibrohim B. has been a MLF MicroInvest client for more than 4 years. He is married, and has 3 children. Ibrohim B. has high-school education. His wife takes care of the house. All children are employed, with the younger son helping his father in business. Ibrohim B. sells food and household products. When he became a MLF MicroInvest client, he had $200 in assets and was selling household products. After receiving multiple loans, Ibrohim B. increased his business assets to $2000 and added food products to the assortment of the goods sold. In the future he plans to open a new retail spot. P.S. His son is on the photo.

loans.use: For business expansion

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Mrs. Jennifer L. a 36 year old woman living in a semi-rural area in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells first class fairly used clothes for a living, and is married with two (2) children. She needs the sum of $550 to purchase shoes, clothes & bags. She has been in this business since 2003. She has been with LAPO for 4 years.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, bags & shoes for sale

loans.name: Jero Darsini

texts.id:
Jero Darsini is used to hard work helping her husband, Gusti Ketut Ratuh supporting their family's income. All of her three children realized how hard the parents work so two of them try to be independent and earn their own livings. Her youngest child is still in primary school, so she still need to pay for his tuition. She saw the opportunity to expand her pig farm. She started with only one pig, and now she owns 3 growing pigs. Each pigs were bought for $25 and farmed for 2 months before sold to a butchery or restaurant for $45. So she earns about $60 from 3 pigs. Jero Darsini plays a big part in earning the family income as her husband's contract farming income is not sufficient. She hopes to expand her farm and increase her profit. She hopes to use the loan from DINARI to achieve that. Jero Darsini is trying to renovate her simple home using the additional profit from the business.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Jero Darsini dalam kehidupan sehari- harinya terbiasa untuk bekerja keras dalam membantu suaminya, Gusti Ketut Rauh, dalam memenuhi segala kebutuhan hidup keluarganya. Tiga orang anaknya sudah merasakan bagaimana uletnya orang tua mereka ini hingga dua diantaranya sudah mampu mandiri dan bekerja, sedangkan anaknya yang masih di sekolah dasar masih harus di biayai pendidikannya. Dari keuletannya dalam menjalankan usaha ternak babi, Jero Darsini melihat ada peluang untuk bisa mengembangkan usahanya. Dimulai dari hanya memelihara seekor babi sampai akhirnya Jero Darsini memelihara 3 ekor babi penggemukan. Babi tersebut dibeli dengan harga Rp 225.000,- per ekor yang dipelihara selama 2 bulan dan di jual kepada pengusaha babi guling dengan harga Rp.400.000, jadi Jero Darsini mendapat pendapatan kotor Rp 525.000 dari ke 3 ekor ternaknya. Dari hasil usahanya inilah Jero Darsini menunjukkan perannya menjadi penopang keuangan keluarga karena penghasilan suaminya sebagai petani tidak cukup untuk memenuhi semua kebutuhan keluarga. Dalam perkembangan usahanya Jero Darsini selalu berharap bisa lebih maju lagi karena kebutuhan hidup semakin meningkat dan lewat pinjaman modal yang diperolehnya dari DINARI besar harapannya bisa mengembangkan usahanya karena Jero Darsini juga sedang berupaya memperbaiki keadaan rumahnya yang sangat sederhana .

loans.use: Purchase growing pigs and feeds.

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr:
Essi S., 40 years old, is married and the mother of 4 children. For the last 10 years she has managed a little roadside restaurant for students and various passerby. She contributes to the financing of the household with the income from her business. Essi Séna wants to improve the environment of her restaurant by building a more attractive and cleaner setting to make her customers more comfortable.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

S. ESSI est mariée et mère de 04 enfants et agée de 40 ans. Depuis plus de 10 ans elle gère un petit restaurant au bord de la route pour les élèves et divers passants. Elle contribue au financement du foyer avec le revenu de son activité. Séna Essi veut améliorer l'environnement de son restaurant par la construction d'un cadre plus attraiyant et propre afin de rendre plus à l'aise sa clientèle

loans.use: Essi wants to enlarge her restaurant with her loan

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 40 year-old Rehema K.. She is married with four children, aged 6, 11, 14, and 17, and has two other dependents, who are her nieces. In 2000 Rehema established a grocery business, and now requires a loan of $175 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: Rehema would like to purchase additional stock in bulk for her grocery business.

loans.name: Roslinah

texts.en: Roslinah is 31, married, and a mother of two children. She sells kerosene from her house and earns $5.00 a day. Her husband also sells kerosene door-to-door around the villages and earns $6.00 a day. She will use this loan to add to her business capital.

loans.use: Increase business capital

loans.name: Abdusattor

texts.en:
Abdusattor is 48 years old and is married with four children.  He is a foreman on a farm and,  at the same time, he works his own land where he grows such crops as potatoes and carrots. Moreover, Abdusattor sells the small cattle that he buys and raises in his household. Abdusattor's wife and two sons are also involved in the business and help him. The business is successful, generating a stable income for the family and allowing for the improvement of their living conditions. 

Abdusattor requests US $1,100.00 for 12 months. The loan will be spent for the purchase of mineral fertilizer,  seeds and cattle. Abdusattor has a positive credit history and promises to repay this current loan on time. He thanks all who support him.

loans.use: To support the coming season's planting and expansion of a cattle business

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en: Bridget U. is a typical business woman. She sells bread in Ireke Community, Lagos State, Nigeria. She was botn there and lives there even now. Bridget acquired her business skills many years ago and has been in this business since1988. At 53 years of age, with 8 children, she still has the energy needed for business. According to her, selling bread is the only skill she has acquired and, she treasures it. She is requesting a loan of $700 to buy more bread to sell.

loans.use: To buy more bread to sell

loans.name: Ebenezer En Cristo Group

texts.en:
The women from Pancho Mateo have completed paying back their first loan, and are now re-applying with a larger group! Teresa is one of the new women in this group, and she is excited to experience the same success as the other women in her community. Teresa is 48-years-old, and a single mother of 2 children. She wants to sell clothes and shoes once she receives her loan. She told us that her favorite food is lentils and that in her free time she loves listening to music. In the future, she would love to own a home and have a safe place for her kids to continue grow up.

We are so blessed to continue working with this group of women, thank you again for your generosity!

loans.use: To purchase clothing and shoes for retail.

loans.name: Rock City 2030-4 Group

texts.en:
Jane K., the group leader, is currently in the business of selling bread but has applied for this loan in order to buy a photo-copying machine. Jane is 40 years old, married, and has two children aged 7 and 14. Her husband is a peasant and both of her children go to school. Each week, Jane makes approximately 100 Sudanese pounds in profits.

Jane is joined in her small group by Grace M., Sarah I., Marsilina K., and Agnes N.. Grace M. has a business selling charcoal and wants to buy a generator. Sarah I. has applied for this loan in order to import more beer for her bar. Marsilina K. operates a business selling local brew from home; however, she would like to begin selling clothes and would use this loan to buy inventory. Agnes N. currently runs a hotel and is requesting a loan to build a lodge.

loans.use: To buy a photo-copying machine

loans.name: Emiliano

texts.es:
Emiliano is a responsible father and loving son. From the time he was a boy, he learned the honorable work of farming and raising livestock, activities which were passed down from his parents and which today bring him satisfaction. This diligent man regularly participates in the agricultural fairs that exist in his region. Thanks to his valuable knowledge of the livestock trade, he has been able to obtain good results from his sales. This enterprising gentleman’s wish is to invest more capital in young animals. Emiliano hopes to continue his dedication to his work, believing that by improving his stock and feed, his lambs will bring better prices. For this reason, he is turning to you for the support that would permit him to continue developing his business.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

Emiliano es un responsable padre e hijo amoroso, desde niño aprendió la noble labor de la agricultura y producción de ganado, actividades que heredó de sus padres y que ahora con satisfacción viene desempeñando. Este diligente hombre participa constantemente en las ferias agropecuarias que existe en su localidad, gracias a su valioso conocimiento de estas actividades pudo obtener buenos resultados de sus ventas. El deseo de esta emprendedor caballero es contar con mayor inversión de capital, dinero que le permite comprar y vender animales menores. Emiliano espera seguir dedicándose a esta labor, cree que mejorando la raza y alimentación de sus ovejitas y borregas mejorarán sus ingresos, es por ello que recurre a tu solidario corazón con la esperanza de recibir tu pronta respuesta.Vuestro aporte permitirá mantener en constante desarrollo a este ejemplar hombre.

loans.use: To buy a better breed of sheep and better feed so that he can continue raising and selling his livestock

loans.name: Olga Justina

texts.es:
Olga, at her 63 years of age, continues with her same vitality and even though she lives on her own she never gets depressed. She is a woman that dedicates herself to growing coffee, something she has done since she was a young girl. Her labor starts at the early hours of the day because her orchards are located far away and getting there takes a large part of the day. Even so, she likes growing coffee because it reminds of her of pleasant moments and most of all she likes her daily contact with nature. Some of the difficulties of the work come during the harvest and she has to have people to help her package her product and transport it to the city of Nazca where her children help her sell it. Her biggest motivation is her land; she wants to keep producing and does not want to abandon it. Olga wants to invest in the production of new coffee plantations and expand her land so that she can take more product to the city of Nazca and be recognized in the coffee market.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Olga a sus 63 años sigue con las misma vitalidad, y aunque vive sola nunca se deprime. Es una mujer dedicada al cultivo D. café, actividad que realiza desD. niña. Su labor es desD. muy tempranas horas, puesto que los terrenos D. cultivo que posee se encuentran el lugares muy alejados, a donD. tiene que trasladarse, lo cual le toma gran parte del día.Sin embargo, esta actividad le agrada, puesto que le recuerda momentos muy agradables, y sobre todo que el contacto con la naturaleza la reconforta día a día, algunas dificultades son cuando es el tiempo D. cosecha y tiene que contratar personas que la puedan ayudar, para luego empaquetar sus productos y llevarlos a la ciudad D. Nazca donD. sus hijos le ayudan a vender. Su mayor motivación, son sus tierras, desea seguir produciendo y no abandonarlas. Olga desea poder invertir en la producción D. nuevas plantaciones D. café, ampliar sus terrenos y así llevar mayor cantidad D. productos a la ciudad D. Nazca y ser reconocida en el mercado D. venta D. café.

loans.use: Expansion of her coffee plantations.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
Rosalia es una joven emprendedora de 19 años de edad. Produce y comercializa hortalizas junto a sus hermanos menores, también se dedica a la producción de leche de vaca (tanto las verduras como la leche son vendidas en la ciudad de La Paz). Sus padres son de la tercera edad y no pueden ayudarla, vive en la Comunidad de Palomar a dos horas y media de la Ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito sera destinado para comprar una vaca de mediana calidad
 
Es sul primer crédito con Impro, esta calificada para obtener un préstamo
texts.en:
Rosalia is an enterprising, young 19-year-old. She produces and sells vegetables alongside her younger siblings. She also works in milk production. The milk and vegetables alike are sold in the city of La Paz. Her parents are advanced in age and cannot assist her. She lives in the Palomar community, 2 1/2 hours from the city of La Paz. The loan proceeds will be used to purchase a medium grade cow. This is Rosalia's first loan with field partner IMPRO; she is qualified to be granted a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow.

loans.name: Saidamir

texts.en: K. Saidamir is married with two children. He is 32 years old and lives in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. Saidamir is an animated man full of enthusiasm. He works hard preparing and selling oil in his house. He has big plans and dreams to grow his business. Since he was very young, Saidamir learned about oil preparation from his uncle and that's why he decided to dedicate himself to this work. Initially he had only one oil-press. He expanded his business and now has two oil-presses. Her wife and his brother help him with the business. Saidamir wants to expand his business and buy additional foodstuff for preparing oil. With this purpose Saidamir requests an individual loan of 700 USD to be paid back over ten months. He is very motivated to grow his business and increase his income. With his efforts, and your important contribution, he can reach his goals.

loans.use: Purchasing of the necessary materials to prepare oil

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha S. sells kangas in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar. Kanga is a common local fabric designed with bright colors and any of a large variety of patterns. It is commonly used in Tanzania for clothing, baby slings, table cloths, and other household uses. Asha works from 7:00am to 6:00pm every day. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more kangas at bulk rates to resell in her shop.

Asha is 41 years old, divorced, and has four children, aged 5, 8, 12, and 13.

loans.use: To buy more kangas for her shop.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Doña Rosa, tiene 42 años de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Sabana Grande, tiene dos hijos de 6 y 14 años de edad, estudiantes de primaria, su esposo es agricultor, la Sra. Rosa vende horneados como: perrerreque, rosquillas, desde hace cinco años esta en las venta lo cual inicio con fondos propios, con estos préstamo que le ha otorgado Afodenic ha logrado mantenerse en el mercado de la competencia, este es su segunda solicitud la cual va invertir en materia prima para la elaboración de sus ricas rosquillas, y ofertar a proveedores como supermercados, para crecer. A largo plazo quiere construir otro horno para lograr mejor desempeño en la elaboración de sus productos, también desea ayudar a sus hijos que estudien.
texts.en:
Doña Rosa is 42-years-old and lives in a neighborhood called Sabana Grande in the capital of Managua. She has two children who are 6 and 14, who are in primary school. Her husband is a farmer. Señora Rosa has sold baked goods like perrerreque and rosquillas (types of pastries) for five years. She started with her own funds. With the loans that Afodenic has offered her, she has managed to support herself in the market with the competition. This is her second request, which she is going to invest in supplies to make her delicious rosquillas, which she will offer to providers like supermarkets so her business can grow. In the long term, she wants to build another oven to better make her products. She also hopes to help her children with their education.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies to make rosquillas (ring-shaped pastries)

loans.name: Sharaf

texts.en: Sharaf R. lives in the B. Gafurov region of Tajikistan. She is married with one child. She is engaged in a commercial service trading in household wares and perfumery. She works with the straight suppliers so she trades by low process. She is very polite and kind by nature and so has repeat customers who like her attention. Sharaf is now applying to Kiva for a business support loan of ten months to import new parcels.

loans.use: To import new parcels.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 44-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their four children. Mahmoud has owned a chicken restaurant for five years. He requests a loan of $500 USD from Al Majmoua in order to purchase supplies for his restaurant. This is the first time that Mahmoud has requested a loan.
Mahmoud’s clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t have start-up capital. Mahmoud decided to start his business because he always wanted to open a restaurant. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: Mahmoud will use the loan to purchase supplies for his restaurant.

loans.name: Néné

texts.fr: Néné M. est une femme de 55 ans mariée, mère de 6 enfants. Elle souhaiterait s’adonner au maraîchage, activité qu’elle pratique depuis quelques années déjà et qui lui réussit bien. Elle vend elle-même ses produits, patate pour la plupart du temps. Elle compte améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille avec les revenus générés.
texts.en:
Néné M. is a 55 year-old woman who is married and has 6 children. She hopes to devote herself to market gardening, a business she has already engaged in for several years and which has served her well. She sells her products, for the most part potatoes, herself. She intends to improve her family's living conditions with the income generated from this business.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To devote herself to market gardening and to sell her products herself

loans.name: Naheebullah

texts.en:
Naheebullah D. is 20 years old; he is single and he lives in Jalalabad Nangrahar province. He is the one responsible for his whole house, and also he is studying in the ninth class in the public school in Jalalabad city. In his spare time he sells yogurt in the bazaar, and now he wants to enlarge his animal farm.

Now he wants to take out an individual loan of 30,000 Afghanis for a term of 22 months to start his business and get them ready to sell them in the bazaar to make a good profit, repay the loan, and support his family to provide a better future. 

He is happy with all members of his family and he would like to thank Kiva and AFSG for a successful loan process in Jalalabad, Afghanistan. He wants to say a special thank you to lenders who are supporters of this process and wants to continue his partnership in the future.

loans.use: Buying animals for his land

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra es socia del Banco Comunal Trigales.
Alejandra es casada, tiene 46 años y 5 hijos, Alejandra viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región, 3 veces por semana en donde vende pescado congelado y fresco, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de sus hijos.
Alejandra necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pescado.
Los sueños de Alejandra son ampliar sus negocios y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Alejandra is a member of Banco Comunal Trigales.

Alejandra is married. She is 46 years old. She has 5 children. Alejandra travels to different markets in the region 3 times a week. She sells frozen and fresh fish, which she does with the help of her children.

Alejandra needs a loan of $325 (1000 PEN) which will be invested in purchasing fish.

Alejandra's dreams are to increase her business and provide her children with a good education.


Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Greetings from Josephine N. from Nyarugenge! Josephine is requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company so that she may expand her business of selling clothes.

She started this kind of business in 2004. She works 6 days a week from 7:30 am to 6:00 pm and earns a monthly profit of approximately US $330. She is hoping that this loan will enable her to increase her profit so that she may pay school fees for her children. Josephine is 37 years old; she is married with 2 children. Josephine is requesting a loan of 500,000 Rawandan Francs to be paid back over 8 months.

loans.use: Expand the business

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en: Alexander is married and has one child. For the last 13 years, he has made a living running a grocery store that offers a large variety of foods. It's a great place to shop because customers can buy everything they need in one place. He also has good prices and a discounts that help him to attract new clients and retain existing ones. Alexander has applied for a loan to increase his inventory of items to sell. His goal is to continue to expand his business.

loans.use: to increase his supplies of items to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es:
La señora Maria Luz, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen de las Mercedes”, vive en el Jr. Huallaga Nº 1415, Distrito Tarapoto, Provincia Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 47 años y es madre de 03 hijos, dos que aun dependen de ella.

Maria, nos cuenta que se inicio con S/. 50.00, se dedica a la venta de comidas a Pensionistas que requieren sus servicio durante todo e mes, entre los que tiene docentes, alumnos, familiares y personas particulares. Su comida tiene muy buena demanda ya que vive cerca de un colegio de la ciudad, y eso le da ventajas para sus ventas.
Actualmente continua con el mismo negocio, y mas adelante piensa ampliar su negocio con un restaurant bien acondicionado; para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y pensionistas. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, desea invertirlo comprando insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como arroz en kilos, azúcar; paquetes de aceites, pollos en javas y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Nos cuenta: Estoy bien y tranquila al realizar este trabajo, todavía tengo fuerzas para hacerlo y lo haré hasta donde Dios me lo permita, también agradezco a Manuela Ramos, por haberme apoyado en la meta que quería realizar, espero que sigan así ayudando a más mujeres.
texts.en:
Maria Luz is a member of the community bank "Virgen de las Mercedes". She lives in Jr. Huallaga No. 1415 in the District of Tarapoto of the Province of Mariscal Caceres in San Martin. She is married and is 47 years old and a mother of 3 children, two who are still at home.

Maria says that she started out with S/.50 and she sells prepared foods to retirees who require her services regularly. Among her clients are also students, family and other individuals. There is a great demand for her food, especially from the nearby school, the location being especially important for her sales. Currently she is still running the same business she started out with and in the future she hopes to expand the business into a well equipped restaurant. She wishes to provide better service to her clients and the retirees.

This loan of S/1000 will be invested in the purchase of ingredients for the daily preparation of her foods, such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, and chicken, as well as some utensils to better set up her business and provide better customer service.

Maria Luz says "I am doing well and feel happy carrying out my work. I am still strong enough to do it and I will continue working as long as I can. I am grateful to Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) to having supported me in accomplishing my goals. I hope they will continue to help more women."


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in ingredients for the preparation of her foods.

loans.name: Uche

texts.en: Uche is 30 years old and married with one child. She sells clothes. She is requesting a loan of N30,000 to purchase more clothes to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary O. is 55 years old. She is married and has given birth to seven children, two sons and five daughters. Some are currently in the junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Mary is a trader. She trades in food items such tilapia, salted fish, etc. She sells on a tabletop at the market square. She wants a loan to buy fish and other ingredients in bulk. Mary buys her goods from Kumasi. She has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy fish in bulk

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es:
Faustino tiene un vehiculo que trabaja como radio taxi, y para mejorar sus condiciones de vida en ingresos requiere el crédito para el pago de la afiliación al sindicato de la Terminal de buses.
Vive en la Zona de Alto Las Delicias de la Ciudad de La Paz en casa en anticrético
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, las ganas de trabajas le dan la oportunidad de acceder a este crédito.
texts.en:
Faustino owns a vehicle that he uses to provide taxi services. To improve his quality of life and income he requires a loan to pay for his affiliation fees to the Bus Terminal Union. He lives in the Alto Las Delicias Zone, in the city of La Paz, in a house on anticredito (a system by which the tenant pays a fixed sum considered a loan to the property owner which they receive back in full when the rental period is over). This is the first time that he is requesting a loan through Impro; his drive to work has given him the opportunity to be qualified for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for his affiliation fees to the Bus Terminal Union of La Paz.

loans.name: Santiago Berdugo

texts.es: Santiago Berdugo R. de 44 años de edad reside en  Ciudad Arce departamento de La Libertad. Santiago vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija Iris de 15 años de edad. Santiago se dedica a la venta ambulante de varios productos como medicina popular que no requiere prescripción médica, ropa de cama y hamacas; para vender su mercadería Santiago viaja a varios departamentos del país sin importar la distancia a la que se encuentren ya que el propósito de Santiago es generar buenos ingresos para la educación superior de su hija; es por eso que el solicita un crédito ya que desea adquirir mayor cantidad de medicina que le ayude a aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Santiago, age 44, resides in Ciudad Acre in the department of La Libertad. Santiago lives in his own house with his wife and 15 year old daughter, Iris. Santiago is engaged in the itinerant sale of several products such as popular medicines that don’t require a prescription, clothing, bed linen, and hammocks.

Santiago travels to several departments of the country without regard to the distance he encounters since his purpose is to generate good income for the higher education of his daughter. He is applying for a loan because he wishes to acquire a greater quantity of medicine that will help him increase his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of medicines to stock his inventory

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy N. is 37 years old and married with four children. Her husband is a businessman. She lives in Kirigu, Kikuyu, a semi-urban center with many businesses. Lucy has been a landlady for the past year, renting out housing to local workers. 

Lucy got to know about KADET through a friend who was already a member in a lending group; Lucy had never borrowed elsewhere before. This will be her first loan with KADET, and she wants to use the money (Kshs 20,000) to venture into a new business. She wants to start selling charcoal and later become a wholesaler, distributing to other small traders so as to increase her income base.

In the future, Lucy hopes to open and stock a general shop, in addition to constructing more rental houses on her extensive property.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To start up a new charcoal sales business

loans.name: Chroeb

texts.en: Mrs. Chroeb H. is 32 years old and she lives in Ank Kor Ky village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables to earn for living. In her plantation, she needs a loan to buy fertilizer and to hire laborers to work on the rice field. Her husband, Mr. Kong Sokha, is a construction worker. Her husband is on the the left of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and to hire laborers to work on the rice field.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is a 22 year old business lady who operates her boutique in Nairobi. She has been in this business for the last five years. She is requesting her first loan of Kes. 20,000 to add stock of clothes, curtains and mats. She hopes to expand her business and begin importing clothes directly. She describes herself as hardworking, cooperative and focussed.


About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add stock

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 48 years old, married and has been blessed with three children: Maricel, 30 years old and married; Joemar, 28 years old and a computer technician; and Mary Joy, who is 14. Josephine is married to Marcelino, a farmer, and the family lives in Sillawit, Cauayan City, a semi-rural area. 

For the last 14 years, Josephine has made a living managing a genral store where she sells basic commodities, cooked foods and snacks. She earns about PHP 800 a week, and has applied for a loan for PHP 25,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. She hopes to secure her loan quickly because, as she puts it, "you live your life just once, so you should do things that are meaningful and rewarding."

loans.use: To expand a small retail store

loans.name: Raulene

texts.en:
Raulene B. is from the village of Tabuan, Tukuran Zamboanga DelSur. She is 36 years old. Raulene is married and has 4 school aged children. To make a living, Raulene owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector and operates a specialized "sari-sari" retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling assorrted products in the local community. Raulene has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Raulene joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Raulene is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Raulene from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Germelina

texts.en: Germelina P. is from the village of Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years old, is married, and has three adult children. Germelina owns and operates a business harvesting and selling rice in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Germelina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer and pesticides for her rice field. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticides for her rice field

loans.name: Sunny

texts.en: Sunny A. I. is 64 years old and married with four children. Two of his children are graduates and the other children are undergraduates. His wife assists him in his business. He has a poultry farm where he raises birds to sell. He has been in this business for a long time. He hopes for a loan amount of 170,000 NGN to purchase more birds. This is the high season for his business, and he hopes to make more profits. He is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry birds

loans.name: Chhay

texts.en:
Chhay P., age 24, is a young, good mother, caring for her two kids. Neither of them is enrolled in school yet and are dependent on her. To earn a living, Chhay P. has a rental kiosk inside the local market where she sells fresh fish that she buys in bulk from her wholesale supplier.

She is married to Lean Seng, 22, who is a construction foreman. Chhay P.’s husband has been very busy at his construction business due to there being many customers who need him to build their house, but he is lacking materials to perform his service. That is why Chhay P. is applying for a loan of $900 to purchase more building materials. She will use some of the proceeds of the loan to improve her fish-selling business.

loans.use: To purchase more building material

loans.name: Claudia Yessenia

texts.es:
La señorita Claudia Yessenia M., ya ha tenido un crédito con FVP el cual pago puntual mente. 
Claudia Yessenia  y su mama la señora Norma Alejandra E., se dedican a la elaboración y venta de alimentos, es por eso que desean tener otro negocio, pero en este momento no cuentan con el dinero necesario para invertir en el nuevo proyecto. 
Solicita un préstamo para poder acondiciona un local para la venta de abarrotes, y planea pagarlo con las ganancias que obtendrá con este nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
Claudia has already had a loan with FVP and she paid it off punctually. Claudia and her mother, Mrs. Norma Alejandra E., have been dedicated to making and selling food. And now they want to open another business. But at this moment, they don't have the necessary money to invest in a new project.

Claudia is requesting a loan in order to prepare a shop space where she can sell groceries. She plans to repay the loan with earnings obtained from this new business.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO PREPARE A PLACE TO SELL GROCERIES

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: Alejandro de 45 años vive sólo en la tranquilidad de su casa propia ubicada  en  la  sierra del Perú.Desde hace 30 años siembra papa (tubérculo peruano), arveja, maíz y flores de gladiolos, en sus  tierras; sus actividades agrícolas las desarrolla junto a su joven sobrino Elmer quien le ayuda a sembrar, cultivar y cosechar, para luego comercializar los productos naturales en el mercado de la ciudad, con las ganancias que obtiene Alejandro cubre los gastos de su vivienda y los invierte en el cuidado de sus sembríos, además ayuda económicamente a su sobrino que siempre  esta pendiente de él; en el futuro tiene pensado adquirir mas terrenos productivos donde sembrar en mayor cantidad, sobretodo  arvejas y flores de gladiolos en sus diferentes colores, los cuales son muy cotizados en el mercado.Este es el noveno préstamo que tiene con MFP y le gusta trabajar con los integrantes de su  banco comunal, pagará puntualmente sus cuotas para acceder a más créditos que le permitan salir a delante.Además el dinero  lo invertirá en comprar semillas de arveja, de flores de gladiolos, e  insecticidas, fertilizantes y abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Alejandro is 45 years old and lives alone in his own house located in the mountains of Perú. For more than 30 years he has grown potatos, green peas, corn, and gladiolus flowers on his land. He works on his farm with his young nephew Elmer who helps him plant, grow, harvest, and later sell the products at the city market. With his profits Alejandro covers his living expenses and invests in caring for his plants. He also provides economic support to his nephew who always cares for him. In the future he hopes to acquire more land where he can grow green peas and gladiolus flowers in different colors. These flowers are sought after in the market. This is the ninth loan that Alejandro has applied for with MFP and he likes to work with the members of his community bank. He pledges to make his payments on time, so that he will be able to receive more loans in the future. He will invest the money from the loan to purchase green pea and gladiolus flower seeds, insecticides, fertilizers, and organic fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purcahse of fertilizers, insecticides, and seeds

loans.name: Let God Be God Group

texts.en: Let God Be God is a group of five borrowers, led by Garma G., who live and work near the Red Light market in Paynesville, Liberia. Red Light is the country's largest market, and is about ten kilometers from the capital, Monrovia. It is a bustling area full of shops, stalls, and vendors’ tables. Garma is 36 years old and is unmarried but has a partner. "My first man died," she says, "But I have a second man." Garma has three children: a three-year-old girl and two boys aged 12 and 16; her boys both attend school. Garma herself never went to school, but instead worked with her mother who operated a dry foodstuffs business similar to Garma's. Garma's parents have both passed away. Garma sells beans, peppers, mustard seed, and other dry foodstuffs from a table at the Red Light market. She says she's been at her current location for three years. This is her first loan from Kiva partner LEAP, and she plans to use her 5,000 Liberian dollar portion of the 24,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more inventory for her business. Garma hopes that her business will be even more successful. She says she looks forward to the day when her children can help her with the business, and hopes that they will be able to take care of her when she gets old. In the photo, Garma is the one holding the sign. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating micro-finance institution with thirteen branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy dry foodstuffs such as beans, peppers, and mustard seed

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
Erika, pertenece al Banco Comunal “María Auxiliadora”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín y Departamento San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 28 años y es madre de 02 hijos, los que aun depende de ella. La socia presenta estudios Superiores  de Auxiliar en Laboratorio Clínico que dado la competencia no puede ejercer su profesión. 

Erika, su seguridad y perseverancia le llevo a iniciar  su propio negocio de venta de refrigerios, ubicada en las afueras de su casa en un lugar muy bien acondicionado para atender a sus clientes. Lleva 06 años en el negocio y esta muy contenta con lo logrado ya que le va muy bien.

En la actualidad, cuenta con una clientela ya fidelizada, siendo sus principales clientes moradores del barrio y amigos conocidos, que saben de su buena sazón e higiene en la elaboración de sus productos, a quienes  ella los atiende con el carisma y amabilidad que le caracteriza. 

Con este crédito de S/. 1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará: insumos como harina, huevos, mantequilla, leche, panes, pollos, y otros para la preparación de kekes, empanadas, sanguches. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra de frutas de la región  para la preparación de sus jugos y refrescos. 

Esta preparada para todo y aun se siente con muchas fuerzas para continuar trabajando y seguir adelante. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contar con un seguro de vida de muy bajo costo que le asegura tranquilidad a su familia ante cualquier hecho inesperado, asimismo por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Erika is a member of the Maria Auxiliadora Communal Bank, which is in the District of Tarapoto, San Martín Province, Department of San Martín. She is 28 years old, married, and the mother of two dependent children. Erika completed her advanced education to become a clinical laboratory assistant, but she does not currently work in this profession.

Due to her perseverance and need for security, Erika started selling refreshments. Her business is located outside of her home, which is well-equipped for accommodating her customers. She has been in business for six years and is pleased with the progress she has made. The business is doing very well.

Today she has loyal clients, which primarily consist of neighborhood residents and friends who know her. Erika is known for her flavorful products and the cleanliness she demonstrates when preparing them. She attends to her customers with her kind and charismatic personality.

With this loan of 1200 soles, Erika will buy supplies such as flour, eggs, butter, milk, bread, chicken, and other items needed for preparing cupcakes, empanadas, and sandwiches. Some of the money will be used to buy regional fruits for preparing juices and soft drinks.

Erika is prepared for anything and feels very strongly about continuing her work and moving forward. Thanks to Manuela Ramos, she was able to secure low-cost life insurance to provide her family with peace of mind in case of any unexpected event. In addition, she is grateful for the assistance she has received in helping fulfill her goals and dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for preparing snacks

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Mrs. Chea S. is a widow woman and a humble citizen living in Siem Reap, a province of Cambodia. She has five single kids and one married kid. To help with feeding the family, one of her daughters works preparing rooms in a hotel.  

To earn a living, Chea S. owns a store inside the market where she sells a variety of wares to people who come to purchase anything in the market. Recently she has sold nearly all her inventory so she wants to resupply her store. Due to Chea S.'s lack of capital, she requested a loan to be used to increase the large number of items that she sells.

loans.use: To increase the large number of items she sells.

loans.name: Primera Esperanza 4 Group

texts.en:
Luz (or Light) is the coordinator of her group, Primera Esperanza (First Hope), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding Hato Mayor, an agricultural area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure with her long-term partner.

Luz is excited to be taking her ninth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling beauty supplies and clothing by purchasing makeup, creams, deodorants, pants and blue jeans to sell.

Luz will use the profits to purchase a computer to learn on and to save towards owning her own home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products and clothing to sell

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma A. is from the village of Tagoloan, Misamis oriental. She is 40 years old. Alma is married and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, Alma owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Alma has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $75 a month from these activities.

In 2010, Alma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alma is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells

loans.name: Ana Portia

texts.en:
Ana Portia M. is a 41-year-old married woman who lives in Hda Antipolo, Brgy Talaban, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living through her general store and fishing business.

Ana’s husband works as a fisherman to support their big family. They have six children who are between 1 and 22 years old. Some of their children are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Ana joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1998 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income through her general store and fishing business. Now she earns an average monthly income of 11,000 PHP from her business activities.

Ana is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of 19,500 PHP was used to fund the operation of her general store and fishing business. It had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now, for her 20th loan cycle, she is borrowing the amount of 19,500 PHP, which she intends to use on her general store and fishing business. Ana is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon--a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a community member who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional capital for her general store

loans.name: Antonia's Group

texts.es:
El grupito D. 6 mujeres trabajadoras que han emprendido el negocio D. compra y venta D. ropa tipica, seis años atras y para apliar su negocio y ven esa necesidad para tener màs ganancias  acuden a la Asociaciòn ASDIR para 
El crédito solicitado será utilizado para ampliación D. capital, D. la actividad a las que se dedican 		cada una D. las integrantes del grupo, por lo que se le considera que  la inversion será rentable,		debido a que generaran más ingresos para la familia D. cada interesada, y asi tener mejoras en sus vidas.
texts.en:
This group of six hard-working women has undertaken the business of buying and selling typical clothing. They started six years ago, and they now see the need to expand their business to get more earnings. That is why they come to the Asociación ASDIR. The requested loan is to be used to increase capital in the activity in which each member of the group is involved. Their view is that the investment will be profitable. It will generate more income for each member’s family. That way they will improve their lives.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ra's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ra C. is 41 years-old. She was selected by the four members of the group located in Chanlork village in Kandal province as the leader. Each member of this group loan will use it to support their individual purposes.

 Mrs. Ra C. is a vegetable seller who earns a small income to support the family. Since her business is going well she wants to expand it.  Therefore, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more vegetables to resell. 

Mrs. Ra C. is a widow with three children.  One works as a seamstress in a garment factory, another a Khmer trailer taxi driver and the youngest is a student at the local school.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables.

loans.name: Al-Harrkan Primary School, Kabala Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the AL-Harrkan primary school in Kabala, a town in northern Sierra Leone. Established in September 1999, the school has 16 paid teachers, 8 community supported teachers, and 513 pupils. Twelve of these teachers have applied for a loan of SLL 10,700,000 from SMT/Kiva lenders. This will be the first loan this group of teachers will be accessing a loan from Kiva lenders. 

School staff from this institution, like many other schools' staff within SMT’s operational areas, comes to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise not have been able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

Lansana S. (pictured back row on the left)  is the head teacher at the school and leader of this group. The 51-year-old is married with twelve children who are attending primary and secondary schools respectively. Lansana has been a teacher for over thirty years. With his share of this loan, he will pay school fees for his children and buy house equipment/furniture. 

(Also included in the photo is loan officer, Mary Conteh, who is pictured second row left.)

loans.use: pay school fees for his children and buy furniture

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia B. is a single woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: frozen foods and cosmetic products. She lives in Brgy. Andres, Bonifacio, Sagay City.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her frozen foods and cosmetic businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000.

Lilia is now borrowing PHP 25,000 so she can expand her frozen foods and cosmetics businesses. This will be her sixteenth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 25,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Lilia aspires to elevating her family’s living conditions and to ensuring their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To provide additional working capital

loans.name: Nyame Mmere Group

texts.en:
Agnes is a very resourceful woman. She is married to a farmer with nine children from age 6-30 years. She is now 55 years old. She loves selling cereals like maize, a business through which she makes a living for her family. Agnes has sold maize for the past year. She plans to invest the loan to purchase ten bags of maize. Agnes hopes to grow her stocks of maize from 10 bags to 40 bags to meet her growing demands. She anticipates an increased profit to take care of her children in school.

Agnes is currently the leader of a trust bank group called “Nyame Mmere” (translated as 'God’s Time') made up of 12 members. As the leader of the group, she ensures regular meeting attendance and repayment of loan installments.

loans.use: To purchase bags of maize

loans.name: Katuba Development Group-Mukono

texts.en:
K. Muzamiru is a 30-year-old go-getter. His go-getter attitude has been his dependable resource in his poultry business. He has been rearing and selling poultry for the last 4 years in Namaiba-Mukono. This business is fast becoming one of the most profitable businesses in the country, given the increasing chicken consumption levels, especially in urban areas. He began this business with savings from his teaching job. 

Finding an alternative source of income has helped him a lot, given the low remuneration that teachers get. In a week he is able to make more than 70,000 shillings on poultry sales alone. That means he makes more money in a month out of this business than he makes as a teacher. With this loan, this married father of 2 school-going children wants to buy more bags of chicken feed.

loans.use: The purchase of more bags of chicken feed.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: K. est une femme mariée, elle vit avec son époux dans le quartier de gbenyedzi qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de jus de fruist qu'elle achète au grand marché de Lomé. elle a commencé ce commerce il y a un an. son désir est d'agrandir ce commerce et pour ce faire elle demande un prêt à WAGES pour acheter une vingtaine de cartons de jus de fruits.
texts.en:
Ablavi K. is a married woman. She lives with her husband in the Gbenyedzi district on the periphery of the city of Lomé. Her line of business is selling fruit juice which she buys at the large market in Lomé. She started this business a year ago. She wants to expand her business and to do that, she is asking for a loan from WAGES to buy around twenty cartons of fruit juice.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cartons of fruit juice
