loans.name: Janepher

texts.en:
Janepher is a farmer and an active member of the Mosebeti Group in Kisii town, Western Kenya. She has a mixed farm which produces bananas, sugarcane, tea, coffee and maize. She sells her products to the local market. Janepher is 47 years old. She is married and has been blessed with 6 children who are all adults.

Janepher has requested this loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She hopes that her milk production will increase, as this would increase her income. Her biggest challenge is the unpredictable prices for her products. Janepher hopes to improve her farming activities in the future and apply for another loan after she completes this current one.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Che

texts.en:
Che I. was born in 1969. She is married to Che John and they are blessed with six children. She shares five rooms with her six children and her husband. She lives in Ntamuche Nkwen, a quarter in Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon.

Che I. has encountered difficulties in life ranging from the inability to meet her daily needs, and failure to attain a quality education. With this loan, she plans to use part to clear off unwanted weeds from her farm, buy piglets, and buy fertilizer to apply to the soil for a higher yield. She is convinced that the soil does not deceive anyone who works hard. She will use part of the capital to buy vegetable seeds which she will plant, nurture and harvest. She will sell the excess, while her family uses the surplus. The loan will help her community, because she will be able to provide vegetables which are very good for their health. They will not need to incur transport costs to buy it elsewhere in distant places. She will be able to take care of her children’s education. She will plough back her profit into her business and use part to care for her family. She will use a fraction of the profit to pay for her children's education and upgrade her standard of living. 

She prefers GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives, the follow up, that GHAPE does not ask for collateral securities, and the low cost of obtaining and paying back a loan. And that the payment is gradual.

About GHAPE:
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To clear weeds on farm, buy piglets, fertilizer, and vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Karla Estebana

texts.es:
Karla Estebana es una pequeña comerciante,  el cual trabaja mucho para apoyar  a su familia, casada, siendo su esposo conductor.
Su negocio es una pulpería y artesanía que logro poner hace nueve años con ahorros,  el cual ha sido su fuente económica para ayudar a sus hijos.
Hoy en día también vende productos de artesanía, logrando vender ya que como tiene competencia cerca, tiene que esforzarse para lograr tener mejores ventas.
Lleva cuatro ciclos de préstamo en donde ha invertido en productos básicos, logrando aumentar su inventario. Que gracias a los financiamiento ha venido creciendo lo que está contenta por poder invertir.
Comprara: granos básicos, lácteos, carne, golosinas. Así como artesanía que como meta es poder ir a vender al país vecino de Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Karla Estebana is small businesswoman. She works a lot to support her family. She is married and her husband is a driver. Her business is a grocery and crafts store which she was able to open after nine years of saving. It has been an income source to help her children. She sells artisanal products which she is able to sell because she is competent in that area. She makes an effort to obtain higher sales. She has had four loan cycles and has invested in basic products, increasing her inventory. Thanks to the financing, she has grown and she is happy to be able to invest. She will buy: basic grains, dairy, meat, and snacks. She also sells artisanal crafts. Her goal is to be able to sell in the neighboring country of Costa Rica.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy: basic grains, dairy, snacks and artisanal craftts to increase her sales.

loans.name: Adriana Del Carmen

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mujeres Unidas se reúne en la ciudadela San Alejo de la bellísima ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita, conocida por las hermosas playas que recorren todas sus costas y que son muy visitadas por los turistas nacionales e internacionales.

Son nueve ciclos los que la señora Adriana lleva en el Banco Comunal y esta muy contenta y agradecida con la Fundación Espoir porque gracias a ellos ha logrado salir adelante en su negocio y en su vida personal, ella es una persona muy activa y luchadora. Está casada y tiene tres hijos, dos de ellos son mayores de edad, el menor vive con ella, pero sus otros hijos viven también cerca en la misma ciudadela con sus familias.

Ella vende comida, tiene un pequeño restaurante en su casa, trabaja desde las 5 am hasta las 14h00, vende desayunos y almuerzos, prepara una gran variedad de platos para tener contentos a sus clientes ya que la competencia es dura y no puede dejar escapar a sus clientes, por eso siempre les da lo mejor acompañado de su gran humor.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar productos para la preparación de sus deliciosos platos y para comprar una mesa y 8 sillas.

Sus sueños son que su hijo sea un buen profesional y tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Mujeres Unidas"  (Women United) meets in the San Alejo neighborhood in the beautiful Manabí capital Portoviejo.  The city is known for its beautiful beaches that cover all of its coastal area and are visited by national and international tourists alike.  

This is Señora Adriana's ninth cycle with the communal bank and she is very happy and grateful to Fundación Espoir because, thanks to them, she has been able to get ahead in her business and her personal life.  She is a very active and hard-working person.  She is married and has three children, two of whom are older.  The youngest still lives with her, however, the older two live  with their families in the same neighborhood.  

Señora Adriana sells food for a living.  She has a small restaurant in her house and she works from 5:00 am until 2:00 in the afternoon serving breakfast and lunch.  She prepares a wide variety of dishes to please her customers as the competition is tough and she can't afford to lose her customers.  For this reason she always serves her customers cheerfully.
 
She will use this loan to buy ingredients to prepare her delicious dishes and also to buy a table and 8 chairs.  She dreams of seeing her son become a professional and to have a large restaurant.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for the foods she prepares and a table and 8 chairs for her restaurant

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon A. is 37 years old. He is from Nyalenda in Kisumu city. He is married to Hannah, who is a fishmonger, and they have four children between 8 and 15 years old. 

Simon has a motorcycle business that he has been running for the past three years. He is applying for his first loan from KADET  LTD. He needs to buy spare parts for his motorcycle to enable him to transport people well from one place to another. His monthly income is 15,000 Kenyan shillings. He hopes to make a lot of profit to enable him to get a rickshaw to add to his motorcycle business.

His hope is to have an established transport business and to see his business really grow.

loans.use: Buy motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Mendsaihan

texts.en:
Mendsaihan C. is 41 years old and lives with his wife and six children in Uvs province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. All of his children attend a local secondary school. 

Mendsaihan operates a firewood and coal sales business in his town. He started his business in 2007 by packing firewood and coal into bags and selling in the local community. He has built a stable operation. In addition, he also operates a vegetable planting and selling business to supplement his earnings. Moreover, he works in the construction field during the summer months, with help of his wife, to support his family. His business earnings have enabled him to provide for his entire family. He also has used his business profits to send his child for hospital treatment. 

Mendsaihan is a modest and honest man and says,  "I will work very hard everyday until my children will be grown up and become good people. " He is requesting a 300,000 MNT loan to purchase more coal for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more coal.

loans.name: Quick Action Group

texts.en:
These are members of the “Quick Action” group. They are small-scale businesswomen in the small town of Waterloo, near Freetwon. This will be their first loan from SMT/Kiva lenders.  With the help of this loan, these entrepreneurs will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and better profit. 

Wulamatu K. is the leader of this group. Wulamatu was born in the village of Foredugu. She is 44 years of age and married with six children who are all grown-up and living on their own. Wulamatu sells dishes, rubber bowls, buckets, etc. She has been a businesswoman for 30 years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above-mentioned items in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: To buys dishes, rubber bowls, buckets, etc. in large quantity to add to her business

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en:
Chheng S. has been spending his life cultivating crops. This is a skill he had learned from his grandparents when he was young. Chheng S. is now married and has four children who are all single. His wife frequently works with him in the farm fields. Growing crops is an annual activity with which he has had great success. Chheng S. is able to plant crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. 

Besides of farming business, Chheng S. is earning extra income by climbing the palm trees behind his house to extract palm juice. Palm tree-climbing jobs are very common for poor people who live in the commune. The containers which he always uses for storing palm juice have broken down or are getting old. He would like to purchase some new containers for storing palm juice use the rest of the loan for supplies for his farming business.

Chheng S. and his wife are pictured in this photo.

loans.use: To purchase some containers for storing palm juice and to purchase supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and other essential materials

loans.name: Johanna Virginia

texts.es:
Johanna Virginia R. R. tiene 24 años de edad, Es soltera vive con la madre en el Cantón Chillanes  Provincia de Bolívar. No tiene  hijos

Los miembros de la V.R.C. TRES DE NOVIEMBRE, Esta compuesta por 28 socios y esta a 90 minutos de  la oficina se encuentra dentro de los límites del Cantón Chillanes. Esta Ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de arroz, plátano, maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca. Esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Johanna Virginia se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de arroz, plátano, maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca. Compra sus productos en Mata de cacao y sus ventas se realizan en el Comercial  Matilde Esther y vende los  productos en Bucay.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de arroz, plátano, maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es  mejorar la calidad de vida.

Le gusta practicar el deporte.
texts.en:
Johanna Virginia R. R. is 24 years old.  She is single and lives with her mother in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.  She doesn't have any children.

The TRES DE NOVIEMBRE community bank has 28 members and is located 90 minutes from our office, in Chillanes canton.  The members of this group work in short-cycle agriculture, growing rice, bananas, corn, cacao, oranges and cassava.  They have been in this line of work for many years.

Johanna Virginia is a farmer who grows rice, bananas, corn, cacao, oranges and cassava.  She buys her products in Mata de Cacao and makes her sales in the Matilde Esther shopping center and in Bucay.

Johanna Virginia is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for her rice, banana, cacao, orange and cassava crops.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to improve her quality of life.

Johanna Virginia likes taking part in sports.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru: Шоев Чамшед проживает в районе Вахдат. Ему 33 года. Женат. Имеет 4 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Чамшед более 10 лет занимается торговлей на рынке. Он имеет собственную торговую точку, где продает фрукты. Вместе с ним работает его брат. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Jamshed S., 33, resides in Vakhdat with his four children and his wife, who is a homemaker. For the past ten years, Jamshed has been selling goods at the market. He owns a stall where he and his brother sell fruit. Jamshed is applying for a loan to increase turnover.

loans.use: to increase turnover

loans.name: Sahuaro Group

texts.es:
El grupo se ubica en el barrio san francisco de Copainala estado de Chiapas México.

            La señora María del Carmen Velasco García, es casada con el señor Adán López Hernández, tiene a  su  responsabilidad a una hija de nombre Laura Patricia de dieciocho años de edad que esta dando su servicio como instructora  de preescolar.

            Durante a estado solicitado el préstamo lo a invertido en la compra y venta de pollos para luego venderlo aliñado (destazado),  en donde lleva dos años y la va bien ya que con esto se ha estado apoyando con los ingresos de su hogar un que también cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que trabaja  en el campo.

          El motivo para realizar esta actividad es para ganar su propio dinero y así tener de donde depender en los gastos que se generan en su hogar, como tambien tener para pagar puntualmente el prestamp solicitado.


        Con lo que obtiene  de su ganancia lo invierte en la compra de refrescos en el. Cual tambien ha estado invirtiendo el préstamo solicitado y cometa que le va bien con estas dos actividades.

        Su más grande anhelo es lograr ahorrar para que con ello logre salir adelante cuando ya estén grandes de edad y así tenga de donde sostenerse de  lo que les  haga falta en los Díaz qué Dios le siga prestando vida y ver que su hija termine una carrera.

          El grupo se llama sahuaro la razón de nombre es porque hay una planta  con muchas espinas que se identifica con ese nombre y les pareció buen idea. Formaron el grupo cuatro señoras quien cada una tiene diferente actividad.


           Las integrantes del grupo son: 

        Zoraida López Velasco: invertirá el préstamo en la compra y venta de zapatos por cátalo, de la marca Andrea, pardo y terra.

         Maria estela López M.: invertirá el préstamo en la compra  cosmético, como son: labiales, desodorantes, cremas, entre otros.

           Maria del carmen Velasco García: invierte el préstamo en la compra y venta de pollos para luego venderlo en la misma localidad

         Juarda Sánchez Sánchez: invertirá el préstamo para comprar ingredientes para elaboración de tamales.
texts.en:
This group is located in the community of San Francisco de Copainala in the state of Chiapas in Mexico. 

Mrs. Maria del Carmen Velasco G. is married with Mr. Adan L. Hernandez. She has a daughter in her care and her name is Laura Patricia. She is 18 years old and she is a preschool teacher. 

This loan has been invested in the purchase of chickens to later sell as meat (butchered). She has two years in the business and it has been successful. She has been contributing to the household finances, although she also has her husband’s support. He is an agriculturist. 

The reason she took up a business is to earn her own money and to be able to provide for the expenses generated by the home. She also wants to make her loan payments on time. 

The earnings that she perceives are invested in the purchase of soft drinks. The loan she requested is also invested in this loan. She mentions that both businesses are doing well. 

Her major goal is to have enough money to support herself and her husband in their old age, to have a source of income form where to have whatever they need for whatever time God grants them. She also wants to see her daughter finish studying for a career. 

The group's name is Sahuara and they chose the name for a spiny plant by that name. They thought it was a good idea. Four women formed the group and they each have a different business. 

The members of the group are as follows: 

Zoraida L. Velasco: she will invest her loan in the business of buying and selling shoes through a catalogue, especially the Andrea, Pardo, and Terra brand names. 

Maria Estela L. M.: she will invest her loan in the purchase of cosmetics, such as lipsticks, deodorants, skin lotions, and others. 

Maria del Carmen Velasco G.: she will invest her loan in the purchase of chickens for later resale in the same community. 

Juarda S. S.: she will invest her loan in the purchase of ingredients to make tamales.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Koem's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of nine members located in Khsom village in Kandal province. 

Mrs. Koem S. K. was born in 1961 and is a village bank president. She was selected to be the village bank president by the other members. She and her husband, Mr. Ou S., are farmers who own a plot of land they use to grow rice to support the family. With this farming, they lack of some money to grow it. Thus, Mrs. Koem S. K. would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for growing crops.

This couple has six children: One is an electrician, two are seamstresses in the garment factory, and the other three are students and also support their parents' farming activity.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for growing crops

loans.name: Balentina

texts.es: La Sra. Balentina, D. 50 años D. edad Viuda hace mas D. 30 años, tiene 5 hijos, actualmente convive con su nueva pareja. Viven en casa propia en la zona Cuarto anillo, la Sra.  Balentina se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes hace 12 años en su mismo domicilio. La clienta  solicito el crédito  para el incremento D. su capital (compra D. Azucar, arroz, fideos, papel higiénicos u otros...), es una Sra. Muy trabajadora a pesar D. haber quedado viuda muy joven salió adelante, se siente feliz viendo a sus hijos realizados y buenas personas,  La clienta expreso su agradecimiento a la Institución por  la rapidez que fueron atendidos y el buen trato que se le dio.
texts.en:
Balentina, 50, has been a widow for over 30 years.  She has five children.  She currently lives with her new partner in her own house located in the Fourth Ring sector.  

Balentina has sold groceries for 12 years at home.  She asked for a loan to increase working capital (to purchase sugar, rice, noodles, toilet paper, and others).

She is a very hard working person.  Despite being widowed very young she managed to get ahead.  She feels happy seeing her children developed into good people.  She expressed her gratituD. to the institution for the speed with which she was taken care of and the good treatment she was given.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, noodles, toilet paper, and others.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 23-year-old married woman living with her husband and three young children. She is from Lebanon. She has been selling perfumes for 5 years. In 2009, she opened her own shop. In addition to selling perfumes, she added a small area to her shop where she offers chocolate designs. She cooperates with her husband who works as a bread distributor for the family income. She obtained her first Kiva loan and was an excellent client with payments on time. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1500 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to increase her inventory. In the future, she would like to expand her business into other areas. She feels positive about her business prospects for the coming year.

loans.use: to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Alisher

texts.en:
Alisher is married and a father of two children. He is engaged in the business of animal husbandry. He has been in this business for a year, and the money invested in his business was earned in the Russia Federation.

After buying young cattle, he feeds them during two or three months and when they gain weight and become larger he sells them at a reasonable price. All of the money which he earns he provides for his family’s needs. Alisher’s purpose is to develop his farm and therefore he is seeking a loan of 1,500 Somoni to buy young cattle for his business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Batmakan's Group

texts.en:
Batmakan C., 41, is the leader of this group. Being a resident of the northern town of Karabalta, Batmakan raised three children, the oldest of whom is 18 years old. In 1996 after the privatization of land, Batmakan, along with thousands of farmers like her, used her last savings on the purchase of her first head of livestock. 

Reselling cattle was just a beginning. Soon she used the daily milk yield to produce sour cream, butter, and cheese. A homemade product raises demand in local area residents, who are pleased with accessible prices and good quality. For the distribution of milk, Batmakan uses her husband’s help, because he is employed in the transportation of food products. Her children make a small contribution to the family business by providing their minor help after school. 

A monthly income of about $214 helped the couple purchase an automobile and several cows. Now Batmakan sometimes buys ready milk products and resells them in a local market. In order to accomplish this she has applied for this loan. Batmakan has deep hopes for her children’s future. She wants them to be well-educated and live in Bishkek - the capital of Kyrgyzstan. 

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Micro-finance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Micro-finance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase milk products

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha es madre de familia de 47  años de edad. Vive en casa propia junto a su esposo y dos hijos menores. Residen en  el caserío Las Juntas del distrito de Illimo, el cual se ubica a 25 minutos de la ciudad de Lambayeque en el norte de Perú. 

Martha se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales, los cuales cría en corrales ubicados en la parte exterior de su domicilio. Alimenta sus animales con pastos naturales, polvillo, maíz, purina, etc. y los comercializa quincenalmente en el Mercado Moshoqueque o Mercado Modelo de Lambayeque. Solicita un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para invertirlo en la compra de más alimento para sus animales. Con esta inversión, sus animales podrán lograr un mejor tamaño y peso y Martha podrá venderlos para un mejor precio en los mercados locales. Con sus ingresos, Martha ayuda a su esposo solventar sus gastos familiares. Martha ha tenido otro crédito con Edpyme Alternativa y demostró responsabilidad en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Martha is a mother and is 47 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband and two children. They in the small town of Las Juntas in the district of Illimo, which is located 25 minutes from the city of Lambayeque, in the north of Peru.

Martha raises and sells livestock, which she keeps in corrals located in her yard. She feeds her animals natural grasses, corn, commercial feed, etc. and sells them every two weeks in the Moshoqueque Market or the Modelo Market in Lambayeque. 

She is requesting a loan of PEN 1,000.00 to buy more feed for her animals. With this investment, her animals will be able to achieve a better size and weight, and Martha will be able to sell them for a better price in the local markets. 

With her income, Martha helps her husband with the family expenses. Martha has had other loans with Edpyme Alternativa and she has demonstrated responsibility with her payments.

loans.use: to buy more feed for the animals she raises

loans.name: Asifiwe Group

texts.fr: Bahati est entrepreneur, Leader du groupe d’affaire « Asifiwe »,  âgée de 32 ans, mariée, mère de 7 enfants. Son mari est un Directeur Adjoint d’une école primaire Chidasa. La cliente est vendeuse d’huile de palme au marché sectoriel Nyabushongo.  Il ya 10 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Elle démarra son business avec  50$ reçu d’une commission d’affaire dans laquelle, elle a été facilitatrice. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec  1 fus d'huile de palme à marchander.  En plus, elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise, scolariser ses enfants et créer un mini quincaillerie.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire «  Asifiwe» est majoritairement féminins.
texts.en:
Bahati is an entrepreneur and the leader of the business group "Asifiwe". She is 32 years old, married, and the mother of seven children. Her husband is the assistant director of the Chidasa primary school. 

Bahati, the client, sells palm oil at the Nyabushongo sector market. She has been in this business for ten years. She started it with $50 received from being a facilitator. This new loan must serve her for one cask of palm oil to sell. In addition, her ambition is to expand her enterprise, to educate her children, and to create a mini hardware store.  

Bahati thanks Hekima for its work in favor of the poor who are excluded from traditional banks. It is appropriate to note that the business group "Asifiwe" is composed mostly of women.

loans.use: to buy one cask of palm oil

loans.name: Mastula

texts.en:
Mastula is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has two children.  None of her children is currently in school.  Mastula has a business of a small retail shop, which she has had for less than one year.         

To help expand her business, Mastula has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities for resale and also to buy a fridge.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Mastula hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  In the future, Mastula hopes to buy a fridge.   Mastula is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her improve in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities for resale and buy a fridge.

loans.name: Clodemer

texts.en:
Clodemer is a responsible father with 2 school-aged children.  He is 41 years old and has had a food selling business for almost 3 years. 

Clodemer sells food like cheese burgers to the people in his community.  Each month he earns about PHP 4,000 in this kind of business.

He is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase raw ingredients to prepare his cheese burgers.

In the future, Clodemer hopes to strengthen this kind of business in order to earn more income and support the needs of his family especially for the education of their children.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients in preparing cheese burgers for sale

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
This is Rosita, 49, resident of Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Eduardo, a painter. She has three children; the oldest is in high school and the other two are in grade school.  She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business.

Rosita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Rosita earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. They also operate a passenger motorcycle used in transportation around the community.  Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 1000 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory and for the maintenance of their motorcycle unit. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Rosita hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery products and inventory items needed in her variety store

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
For the past 20 years Luisa, 46 years old and married, has had a retail shop where she sells a variety of products. She earns approximately PHP 4,000 monthly. Luisa is requesting a loan of Php 11,000 to purchase a variety of products that she can display in her store to attract more customers. She will buy noodles, canned goods, coffee, bread and sugar to sell.

In the future, Luisa hopes that her business will improve so that she can better provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy noodles, canned goods, coffee, bread and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Sarkhan

texts.en: Sarkhan is only 20, but he already has deep knowledge of his business and runs his own store. He is single and lives with his parents. He sells plates, glasses, and other kinds of dishes and tableware. The store he runs is in a very good location in Saatli central market. His monthly profit is about 200 USD. Sarkhan would like to increase his inventory and monthly profit. For this reason, he applied for a 1,000 AZN loan.

loans.use: purchase more inventory of dishes

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.es: Erlinda, de 56 años, está casada con Jesús. Ambos tienen 9 hijos, pero solo viven con 2 de ellos: Eden y César. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Unión Palomar (selva central peruana). Está pareja de esposos, a pesar de su avanzada edad, siguen unidos, y sobre todo trabajando mucho, para sacar a delante a sus dos últimos hijos. Hace 16 años que se dedican a la agricultura, sus principales cultivos constan de café, palta y plátanos. Erlinda nos cuenta que ambos coordinan para poder vender sus sembríos, mientras que ella lleva a vender al mercado central de La Merced, los plátanos que cada 15 días cosecha, su esposo Jesús, comercializa, su grano de café en la cooperativa de Alto Palomar. Todo el esfuerzo que realizaron en estos años, lograron que ahora, obtengan más de 3 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas, que le producen el sustento económico para su familia. Los planes de esta pareja es incrementar la calidad y cantidad de sus cultivos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “La unión hace la fuerza del palomar” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde está segura que logrará sus objetivos con su apoyo y de los integrantes de su asociación. Razón por la que se compromete en pagar de manera puntual sus cuotas. Erlinda de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de herramientas para podar la maleza que crece entre sus cultivos, para ello contratará peones; asimismo comprará varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales para nutrir sus sembríos de café.
texts.en:
Erlinda, 56, is married to Jesús.  They have nine children together but only two still live with them: Edén and César.  They live together as a family in their own house located in Unión Popular (Peruvian Central Jungle).  This couple, despite their advanced age, continues together and, above all, working very hard to raise their last two children.  

They’ve been farming for the last 16 years; their main crops are coffee, avocados and bananas.  Erlinda tells us that they both coordinate to sell their entire crops. While she goes to La Merced Central Market to sell bananas that are harvested every two weeks her husband, Jesús, sells the coffee beans at the Alto Palomar Cooperative.  All the effort they’ve expended over the years has led to their now having more than 3 hectares of farmland that produce their family’s support.  The couple’s plan is to increase both the quality and the quantity of their crops.

She belongs to the “La Unión Hace la Fuerza” (Unity Makes Strength) communal bank and this is the second MFP loan where she’s sure she’ll meet her goals with help from her association’s members.  Because of this, she commits to make her installment payments punctually.

If Erlinda were to receive your support, she will use the requested money to buy tools to remove the weeds that grow among her plants and to do so she’ll hire farmhands.  She will also buy several sacks of natural fertilizer to nourish her coffee plants.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer and to hire farm hands.

loans.name: Sreyee

texts.en:
Sreyee, 23 years old, is a tailor. She is living with her parent, and her income is $6 per day. Her parent is responsible for every expenses in the family; she only supports them with $50 per month. 

She would like to request a loan of $700 to buy fabric for making clothes to sell. This loan will help her be able to buy fabric and a sewing machine so that she can do her career well. In the future, she expects to have a tailoring shop by herself, so that she can support her parent well.

loans.use: To buy fabric for making clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ancizar

texts.es:
Ancizar trabaja de domingo a domingo desde las 8:00 de la mañana hasta las 8:00 de la noche y aunque su jornada laboral es larga, este emprendedor es consciente de que así logrará salir adelante y ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. 

Su negocio es una tienda en la que además de ofrecer productos de la canasta familiar también ofrece productos propios de ferretería. 

Actualmente este emprendedor necesita de un préstamo para comprar mayor variedad de productos y así mejorar su oferta para sus clientes e incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Ancizar works Sunday to Sunday from 8:00 in the morning until 8:00 at night and even though his work day is long, this entrepreneur is aware of what he needs to do to get ahead and give his family a better quality of life.  He runs a store for a living and, in addition to offering household products, he also sells hardware.  Currently, he needs a loan to buy a greater variety of products so he can improve what he offers to his customers and increase his income.

loans.use: purchase household products and hardware to stock his store.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La Señora Julia de 43 años es casada y tiene 02 hijos de 15 y 13 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de comida (anticuchos, tripitas) de forma ambulatoria, negocio que viene realizando hace 3 años,  además tiene un auto que lo alquila para el servicio de transporte (TAXI). El crédito solicitado es para invertirlo en un nuevo negocio de ventas de tortas, lo cual necesita los productos necesarios para la elaboración de las tortas, además de comprar una vitrina  para exhibir sus tortas. Su gran sueño es tener una bodega que ofrezca los principales productos de primera necesidad (arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, pollo, verduras entre otros), además el tener una casa propia.
Esta agradecido por el crédito brindado ya que podrá cumplir con sus metas trazadas.
texts.en:
Señora Julia is 43 years old and married, with two children aged 15 and 13.  She works selling food (grilled meat on skewers, tripe) as a street vendor, and has been doing this for the last three years.  She also has a car that she rents out as a taxi.

The requested loan is for her to invest in a new business selling cakes; she needs the products necessary for making the cakes, and also needs to buy a display case for showing them.

Her big dream is to have a convenience store where she can offer for sale everyday products (rice, sugar, noodles, milk, chicken, and vegetables among other things), and also to have her own home.

She is grateful for the loan that's being provided, as she will be able to meet the targets she has set for herself.

loans.use: to buy a display case that she needs to start up her new business selling cakes.

loans.name: Angela Celinda

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santa Ana, conocida por sus bellos paisajes y por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce, que son muy visitados por muchos turistas, cada 15 días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Luz.

En este lugar vive la señora Celinda. Tiene 59 años de edad y hace varios años su esposo falleció pero de esa relación tiene tres hijos, dos ya son mayores de edad y solo la menor vive con ella. Es maestra en un colegio de la localidad.

Doña Celinda para ayudarse con los gastos del hogar y para los estudios de su hija tiene una pequeña granja de pollos en su casa, compra los pollos en algunos laboratorios cuando están pequeños,  los cría y luego después de tres meses los entrega para la venta en algunas tiendas de la localidad y también vende en su casa en pie o por libras. Trabaja en su granja de tres a cuatro horas en la tarde con la ayuda de una persona a la cual le paga un sueldo. Ella tiene su negocio ya por 8 años y se ha mantenido a  pesar de que a veces no le ha ido muy bien pero con constancia a logrado salir adelante.

Este crédito lo va  a emplear en comprar más pollos, alimentos y medicinas para los mismos. Esta desde el inicio del Banco, es  la presidenta del mismo y le gusta por los beneficios que recibe de la institución.
 
Sus sueños son tener una granja con mayor tecnología y mucho mas grande.
texts.en:
The members of the “Nueva Luz” (New Light) communal bank meet every two weeks in the city of Santa Ana known for its beautiful scenery and for its beautiful fresh water resorts that are visited by many tourists.

Celinda, 59, lives here.  Her husband passed away several years ago but she has three children.  Two are adults and only her youngest daughter lives with her.  She is a teacher at a local school.

In order to help herself meet household expenses and cover her daughter’s educational costs, she has a small chicken farm at home.  She buys the chicks from some laboratories and raises them.  After three months she sells them to some of the local stores and also door to door either whole or by the pound.  She works her farm three or four hours in the afternoon with help from an employee she pays a salary to.  She’s had the business for 8 years already and she’s managed to stay in business even though sometimes she hasn’t done too well but she’s nevertheless managed to get ahead with perseverance.

She will use this loan to buy more chicks, feed and medicine for them.  She’s been in the communal bank since its beginning.  She is its President and she likes it because of the benefits she gets from the institution.  Her dream is to have a much larger, more technological, farm.

loans.use: to buy chicks, feed and medicine for them.

loans.name: Los Palmares 4 & 5 Group

texts.es:
Ana y su grupo Los Palmares 4 & 5, se encuentra ubicado en la ciudad D. Santo Domingo, en una comunidad D. pocos recursos localizada al norte D. la capital D. la República Dominicana, ellos se dedicar a la venta D. diferentes artículos como: Ropas, cosméticos, calzados, salones D. belleza, tienda D. comestibles, entre otros.

Ana es madre D. 2 hijos, los cuales aun comparten junto a ella y su pareja (padre D. sus hijos) en su humilD. vivienda. Su reto mas difícil ha sido tener su propia casa, por lo cual se ha dedicado a trabajar y así poder lograr sus sueños, D. vivir tranquilos y seguros en una vivienda propia.

Ana está muy emocionada D. recibir su segundo préstamo en Esperanza Internacional, su préstamo anterior fue invertido para iniciar su negocio D. ventas D. productos D. limpieza, actualmente tiene una mayor clientela y piensa comprar una caja D. cada producto, para limpieza D. baños, pisos, jabón, detergente para lavar ropa y blanqueador. Sus beneficios serán ahorrados para construir su casa y estudiar; también para ayudar con algunos gastos D. la casa. Ana y todos los demás miembros del grupo, les dan las gracias por su apoyo!!!
texts.en:
Ana and her group, Los Palmares 4 & 5, are located in the city of Santo Domingo, in a community with little resources located to the north of the capital of the Dominican Republic. They make a living selling different items like: clothing, cosmetics, footwear, beauty salons, food stores, among others.

Ana is the mother of two children whom, together with her and her partner (father of her children), still share a humble home. Her biggest challenge has been to obtain her own home, due to which she has spent her time working and by doing so be able to achieve her dreams and live safely and peacefully in her own home.

Ana is thrilled to receive her second loan from Esperanza Internacional. Her previous loan was invested to start her cleaning products business. Currently she has many customers and is thinking about buying a box of each product for cleaning bathrooms, floors, soap, detergent to wash clothes, and bleach. Her profits will be saved to construct her house and to study; also to help with some household expenses. Ana and all the rest of the members of the group thank you for your support!

loans.use: to buy cleaning products, detergent, bleach, soap, etc.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 37 years old. She is married to Jonathan, and they have two children. She has been in farming for the last three years, with a monthly profit of 15,000 Kenyan shillings.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a client registered with KADET LTD, and she is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD to buy coffee seeds.

She will save the anticipated profits and use them to pay school fees for her children. In the future, she hopes to grow her business, and be economically stable.

loans.use: to buy coffee seeds.

loans.name: Florefes

texts.en: Florefes is a married woman with two children.  She is 52 years old, and resides in Tinacla-an, Clarin Misamis Occidental in the Philippines.  For the past four years, Florefes has owned and operated a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living.  Each month, she earns 10,000.00 doing this type of business.  She requested a loan of 10,000.00 to purchase products to resell.  Florefes has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year.  In the future, Florefes wants to build a house and to help her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase products to resell.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda is 52 years old and is married. She is a very responsible mother who seeks to meet the needs of her family. Gilda has a retail store where she sells a variety of products in their community. Aside from the retail store, she also manages their land with the help of her spouse. 

Gilda is asking for a loan of  9,000 PHP to purchase additional products such as drinks, snack foods, noodles and spices for her store. She wishes that in the future her business will expand to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy drinks, snack foods, noodles and spices for her store

loans.name: Star D Group

texts.en:
Greetings from the Star D group from Western Kenya! Sylvia is the facilitator of the Star D group. This group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Sylvia takes care of one child at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to have good production and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Sylvia had a very good maize yield harvesting 10 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Sylvia was only able to harvest six bags of maize on that land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Sylvia and her group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs such as fertilizer and seed is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which also includes training, credit, and insurance. 

With the income from maize sales, Sylvia will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing. 

In 2012, the members of Star D group will each plant between one half and one acre of maize.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 23 years old, single and lives with two family members who all work.

Ali is a plumber. In 2005, he opened his workshop. His business offers a service for installing and maintaining systems used for potable drinking water, sewage, and drainage in plumbing systems. He has sufficient experience in this field and has a deep understanding of local consumer and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He decided to apply for a $2400 loan in order to expand his workshop by renting the shop next to him. He is optimistic about his business development and hopes that the coming years will continue to bring positive business growth.

loans.use: to expand his workshop by renting the shop next to him.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 31 years old and lives in Buchanan, Liberia. She is married and has three children between the ages of five and fifteen who are in school.

For the past twenty years Esther has been selling fresh and dried fish in the local market. She likes her business because selling fish brings in money quickly.

Esther is requesting a loan of 20,000 LRD to purchase fresh cassava and butter nose fish for her business. She plans to expand it and help her friends sell fish, taking some percentage of the profit.

loans.use: to purchase fresh cassava and butter nose fish.

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en: Chantal is 27 years old and married to a farmer. They have four children, three of whom go to school. She has spent 3 years selling different items in her store. With the loan, she will add more items to her store, such as rice, soaps, sugar and cooking oil to sell. She wants to use the profits to make savings. She would like to own a large shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy more rice, soaps and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer is a 34-year-old married woman with two children, both of whom are in school. For the past three years, she has run a fish-selling business in Bor, South Sudan. 

Amer is requesting a loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use the extra income from her loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is a mother of three and a progressive farmer from Kisii. She has been doing mixed farming for the last four years! She is developing a passion for dairy farming. Her main sources of income are eggs and tea produced on her farm. 

Like any serious dairy farmer, Carolyne takes her animals' health very seriously: She makes regular income from selling milk, an activity she really enjoys! However, she says the major challenge to farmers in her area is the lack of a good road network. This makes transportation quite an uphill task and very expensive.  

Carolyne is seeking a loan to purchase a quality dairy cow.  This cow produces more than 13 liters of milk daily: Milk sold from this cow will provide Carolyne with a significant amount of income on a daily basis, enough to clear her loan repayments on time. 

Carolyne has a clear business plan. Juhudi Kilimo has been very encouraging and supportive to such progressive farmers. We want her farm to be an example to other farmers who have potential but are constrained by funds.

The extra income that she will generate from the cow will go towards satisfying her child’s education requirements.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es: Doña Maria Santos realizó sus estudios con éxito y satisfacción de primaria gracias al apoyo económico de sus padres y tiene una edad de 42. Ella se casó a temprana edad, muy pronto procreo tres hijos, la menor tiene 14 años y no estudia; pero colabora con los quehaceres del hogar y los dos varones uno de 16 y el otro de 19 años al igual que su hermana no estudian y colaboran en el campo junto a su padre. Su fuente de ingresos es la siembra de café siendo sus padres quienes le heredaran el terreno que en familia trabajan el cual está ubicado a cincuenta metros de distancia desde su casa de habitacion. Su experiencia en esta actividad es mucha pero en familia llevan a cabo el desarrollo de la siembra y cultivo de café desde hace 6 años. Su meta es brindar a sus cultivos de café y la propiedad una buena asistencia técnica ya que son tres manzanas del tipo 90 que tienen cultivado pues dependen única mente de este rubro. Doña Maria Santos solicita crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, alto 100, abono 12-46-0, abono 12-24-12 entre otros para asistir y cuidar de sus plantaciones de café por lo que espera ser apoyada para salir adelante.

loans.use: Para compra de insumos agrícolas para asistir sus cultivos de café en esta nueva temporada

loans.name: Docus

texts.en: Docus is married with four children and two of whom go to school.  She also takes care of additional family members . She has a business of operating a food stall. She has been in this business for 2 years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy tomatoes,onions,oranges,cassava,sweet potatoes,pineapples.  She works from home and sells to all categories of people on retail basis seven days a week.  She is aspiring to buy iron sheets to roof her rental houses.  She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because she wanted additional capital for her business. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and   piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family

loans.use: To buy tomatoes,onions,oranges,cassava,sweet potatoes,pineapples

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 46 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Evangeline has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for nine years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, canned good, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future Evangeline would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Dulce Karina

texts.en:
Dulce lives in Monclava Coahuila. She is a single mother with a beautiful daughter. She began her business when faced with the need to pay for her daughter\\\\\\\'s expenses since the little one is 2 years old and still needs diapers and food. Dulce knows that in the future her child will need to go to school so she works hard so that all her little one\\\\\\\'s needs are met. She has been selling the beauty products \\\\\\\"JAFRA\\\\\\\" for more than a year, and her clientele is growing each day. Dulce needs your help to receive a $200.00 USD loan in order to buy merchandise and prepare herself to meet with the high demand estimated for this Christmas. Dulce needs your support and generosity.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Dulce vive en Monclava Coahuila, es madre soltera y tiene una hermosa niña. Inició su negocio ante la necesidad de solventar los gastos de su hija ya que la pequeña tiene 2 años de edad y hasta el momento necesita de pañales y comida. Dulce sabe que en el futuro la niña necesitara estudiar por lo que trabaja muy duro para que a su pequeña nada le falte. Tiene mas de un año vendiendo productos de belleza “JAFRA” y hasta ahora sus clientes se están incrementando día con día.

Dulce necesita tu apoyo para obtener un préstamo de $200 USD para comprar mercancía y prepararse para enfrentar la alta demanda que se aproxima para estas fechas navideñas. Dulce requiere de tu ayuda y generosidad.

loans.use: Purache Merchandise

loans.name: Ivailo

texts.en: Ivailo G. is 25 years old. He is single and lives in Blagoevgrad. He graduated from a construction school. After graduation he started a small construction business five years ago. Ivailo makes internal repairs – plastering, flooring and painting.  Ivailo has two employees. Now Ivailo G. applies for this $ 1200 loan to buy some construction equipment for his business.

loans.use: To buy some construction equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy five sacks of maize and vegetables

loans.name: Korng

texts.en:
Mrs. Korng S. is 55 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and their 5 children. She sells rice and earns about $5/day in revenues. Her husband works as a construction foreman and earns $10/day.

This loan will be used to buy more rice for Mrs. Korng S.'s inventory. With the additional rice, she and her husband hope to continue supporting their five children until they can find better jobs.

loans.use: Buy more rice for her inventory

loans.name: Amadu

texts.en: Amadu started his small hardware business three years ago.  With his previous loans, he was able to increase his turnover by including padlocks, ropes and nails.  Amadu is fifty years old and married with five children.  He has had to spend all his profits on the children’s school fees and this has reduced the capacity of the business.  He needs a loan of $200 to increase his stock and thus his profit.

loans.use: expand his inventory for his hardware store

loans.name: Sara

texts.en: Sara (her husband is pictured) is a mother of three children. Sara is 39 years old. She lives in Khachmaz town. Sara and her husband buy the hazels from the villages and sell them wholesale. Now they need a loan of $1200 to buy hazels for getting more income.

loans.use: To buy hazels

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Kate A., 39 years old, is married and has 8 children. She owns a poultry farm and is a member of LAPO in Uromi, Edo state of Nigeria. She has been in the poultry business for four years, and now needs a loan of US$700 to buy feedstock and more chicks for rearing.

loans.use: Purchase of chicks for rearing

loans.name: Abravi

texts.fr:
Married and the mother of three children, two of whom are in school, Abravi HOUMADO, age 30, has been in this business for three years already. Using the profits from her work, she ensures that household expenses are covered. She would like to use this loan to buy 25 new travel bags in order to meet customer demands and to earn more.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Mariée et mère de 03 enfants dont deux fréquentent madame Abravi HOUMADO est âgée de 30 ans et exerce ce commerce bientôt 03 ans. Par les profits de son activité elle assure les dépenses du foyer. Elle souhaite par ce crédit acheter 25 nouveaux sacs afin de satisfaire la demande de la clientèle et de gagner plus.

loans.use: To buy  25 travel bags to meet customer needs

loans.name: Namuyingi Ii D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Resty N.. She is currently in the business of cooking food and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Resty is 38 years old and is married to a school bursar. She has seven children, ranging from 5 to 18 years in age. Her children attend school. Each week, Resty makes approximately UGX 35000 in profits. With the extra profits she will make with the help of a loan, she hopes to be able to meet her basic needs Resty has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before, to the amount of UGX 200000, in order to buy a refrigerator. The loan was paid back on time.

Resty is joined in her small group by Miriam N., Janat N., Labetha M., and Jane B.. Miriam N. has a business selling clothes and wants to start a clothing shop. Janat N. is currently operating a hotel business and wants a loan to increase her capital. Labetha M. operates a business selling maize and wants to boost up her business. Jane B. is currently in the business of brewing local beer and is requesting a loan to buy a brewing machine.

loans.use: to invest in her food business

loans.name: Salom

texts.en:
S. Salom is 45 years old. He is married with three children. Salom has been a cattleman for 7 years. He buys, raises and sells cattle in the local animal market. Currently he has 4 cows for a turnover of approximately $1000. The business is successful generating a considerable amount of income for the family. It also helps improve the living conditions of the family.

Salom is requesting $300 for the term of 9 months. The loan will be used to purchase one cow. He thanks everyone that's supporting him. He has a positive credit history and he promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase one cow.

loans.name: Judith's Muungano South Group

texts.en:
Judith is 29 years old and is a single woman. Judith is a tailor. She started in 1999. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Jetsina, who also has a tailoring business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol has two children, one 3 years old and one 4 years old. She decided to begin her business in order to ensure the future and economic well-being of her children. The earnings of her husband were not sufficient, and so she began the business with some savings that she had. She began selling jewelry and later beauty products. She did well with this activity, and so she decided to rent a location where she currently has her business.

Now she is asking for a loan of $575 that she will repay in 6 months in order to remodel her business and air condition a sales area that will permit her to give better service to her clients. With your help, she will be able to make this a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Marisol tiene 2 hijos de 3 y 4 años, ella decidió emprender su negocio para asegurar el futuro y bienestar económico de sus hijos, ya que con el sueldo de su esposo no era suficiente por lo que inicia el negocio con algunos ahorros que tenia, empezó vendiendo joyerías y después productos de belleza, le fue bien con esta actividad así que decidido rentar un local donde actualmente tiene s su negocio.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $575 que pagara en 6 meses para remodelar su local y acondicionar un área de ventas que le permita dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Con tu poyo esto podrá hacerse realidad

loans.use: To remodel a business

loans.name: Edoh

texts.fr:
Madame Edoh A. was born on November 30, 1962 in Lomé. She is a married with four children. She has sold fabrics in the large market in Lomé since 2001. She buys the fabrics in the big market warehouses and displays them for sale at a profit.

This first loan that she is requesting through Kiva Field Partner, WAGES, will allow her to buy 25 rolls of high-quality fabric. With the income from this enterprise she will thus be able to help her husband with the household expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva volunteer.

Madame A. Edoh est née le 30 novembre 1962 à Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Depuis 2001 elle est revendeuse de tissus au grand marché de Lomé. Elle achète les tissus dans les grands magasins du marché et les expose afin de pouvoir vendre et gagner aussi un bénéfice.

Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite auprès de WAGES lui permettra d’acheter 25 rouleaux de tissus de qualité supérieure. Ainsi avec le revenu de cette activité, elle pourra aider son mari dans les dépenses de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy 25 rolls of fabric

loans.name: Rasela

texts.en:
Rasela T., 26, is married with 1 child. She has many years of experience in the Banana Plantation business. She sells to the general public and to villagers 2 days per week.

Rasela has had previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD). SPBD loans are Rasela’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She is the mother of one child, but her husband is unemployed. He is not supporting her by running a business. Therefore, this business is very important to the family.

loans.use: The loan will be used to purchase pesticides

loans.name: Celerina

texts.es:
Celerina started this business to support her family. Because her husband was unemployed for some time, they did not see another way to continue forward. One of Celerina's friends invited her to go to a meeting where she learned to cook medical products, and eventually the two started selling the products because the initial investment was small. Celerina took the opportunity because it interested her and provided her with a good income. At that time, she did not have an income, so she worked as her friend's saleswoman. Little by little she attracted new clients and sold many products, but her earnings were not that high because she was only the saleswoman. Later, Celerina became an independent seller, and today she has many clients and high earnings.

Celerina needs a $400 loan which she will repay in 6 months to purchase products. She is hopeful that with Kiva's support she will obtain them.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva volunteer.

Celerina se decidió a iniciar este negocio por la necesidad económica en su familia. Ya que por un tiempo su esposo estuvo desempleado, y no veían la manera de poder salir adelante, entonces una de sus amigas la invito a que fueran a una reunión de para que conociera los productos medicinales y si le interesaba para que formara parte del grupo de ventas, ya que la inversión era mínima. Entonces ella decidió asistir y le intereso la forma de trabajo y que le iba a dejar buenas ganancias para poder solventar los gastos. En ese momento ella no contaba con ingresos, entonces le dijo a su amiga que por mientras le podía ayudar como su vendedora, entonces su amiga acepto y por unos meses le ayuda a vender productos. Poco a poco pues se fue haciendo de clientes y de buenas ventas, auque pues para ella la ganancia era menos por que era vendedora de su amiga. Entonces posteriormente ella entro directa como vendedora independiente, hasta hoy en día tiene muchos clientes y buenas ganancias.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $400 que pagara en 6 meses, para la compra de productos, tiene todas las esperanzas que con el apoyo de Kiva lo obtendrá.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Jery Cristina

texts.es:
La señorita Jery Cristina, de profesión Ingeniero Agroindustrial, es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Trabajando II “, vive en la región y Provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y lencería por catálogos, también vende productos naturales. El negocio lo realiza en su lugar de trabajo, ella trabaja en una institución de la ciudad, los clientes son sus compañeros de trabajo y amigos.  

Con el préstamo de S/. 800, el cual pagará en 4 meses invertirá en la compra de productos naturales de la marca Tian-Shin, productos de belleza de las marcas Unique, Natura. Jery aprovecha las ofertas para tener una mayor ganancia y dar facilidades a sus clientes.

Tiene 26 años y es soltera. Le gusta lo que hace y complementa su trabajo con esta actividad. Está contenta con los resultados obtenidos porque le permitió solventar sus gastos en la universidad. Su meta es formar una pequeña empresa de Productos Agroindustriales y de esta manera poner en practica su carrera.
texts.en:
Ms. Jery Cristina is an Agroindustrial Engineer, and a partner in the Mujeres Trabajando II communal bank. She lives int the San Martin region and province of the Tarapoto district. She works selling cosmetics and lingerie through cateloges, along with natural products. She runs her business from the place that she works, which is in a business in the city. Her clients are her friends and the people that she works with. With an 800 sol loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of Tian-Shin natural products, and Unique and Natura beauty products. Jery takes advantage of sales to increase her profit and to offer specials to her customers. She is single and 26 years old. She enjoys what she does, and adds to her work income through her side business. She is please with the success that she has had, because it allows her to pay her tuitions bills for college. Her goal is to form a small Agroindustiral products company, and to be able to put her degree to use.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of natural producst and beauty products

loans.name: Oktay

texts.en: Oktay was born in 1954. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Fuzuli region in Azerbaijan and settled in Baku city. He has been in the auto repair  business for 14 years. Now he needs a loan of US$ 1200 to buy spare parts for improving his business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Grace P.. She is currently in the business of selling beer at a bar and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Grace is 60 years old and is married to a husband who is a builder. She has 2 children, aged 15 and 20 and her children go to school. Each week, Grace makes approximately 100 Sudanese pounds in profit and with the extra profit from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

Grace is joined in her small group by Grace D., Celementina I., Edward B., and Vitorina I.. Grace D. has a business selling local brew and wants to expand her business. Celementina I. is currently operating a business selling fruit such as guavas, oranges, etc. and wants a loan to expand her business. Edward B. operates a business selling beer and wants to expand the business. Vitorina I. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes and is requesting a loan to expand the business.

loans.use: expand their small businesses

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the "Sol Radiante" (Brilliant Sun) Village Bank. She is 32 years old, married, and has four children. She and her family are artisans who make beautiful weavings using looms. She owns four looms, which she, her husband, and their children use. They sell the weavings in the city of Cuzco, and sometimes in the city of Ayacucho. Victoria needs a loan of 1250 soles to buy wool, dye, and firewood. Victoria dreams of improving her business, of building her house, and of having a store.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Sol Radiante. Victoria es casada, tiene 32 años y 4 hijos, Victoria junto a su familia son artesanos y realizan bellos tejidos en telares, tiene 4 telares en los que trabajan ella, su esposo y sus hijos, sus ventas los realiza en la ciudad del cuzco y en algunas oportunidades en la ciudad de Ayacucho. Victoria necesita un préstamo de 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de lana, tinte y leña. Victoria sueña con mejorar su negocio, construir su casa y tener una tienda.

loans.use: Buy wool, dye, and firewood

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella E. is 36 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Stella sells drinks and foodstuffs. She also needs a generator to assist her when there is no electricity supply. She needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more drinks, provisions, and foodstuffs and also a generator. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks, foodstuffs, provisions and a generator

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es: Bernardo tiene 41 años, vive con su esposa y sus hijos. Él trabaja en las labores agrícolas desde hace muchos años, lo que le ha permitido seguir adelante durante todos estos años, pues no solo se ha dedicado a la agricultura, sino también a la crianza de animales; como vacas, toros y ovejas y en menor proporción, cuyes. Lo que produce en sus tierras de cultivo, una parta la vende y la otra la guarda en su almacén para su consumo propio para los momentos de necesidad.  El amor por su familia es lo que lo motiva a esforzarse ante el calor o frío intenso del campo cuando prepara la tierra para la siembra o cuando se prepara para la cosecha. Es la segunda vez que Bernardo tiene un crédito con  MFP, como integrante de su banco comunal está  satisfecho por el que cada día aprenden, además de ser un espacio interesante de socialización y apoyo mutuo. La cantidad que solicita es para la compra de bolsas de abono, cada una cuesta 200 soles, en promedio le servirá para la campaña de siembra que se aproxima.
texts.en:
Bernardo is 41 years old and lives with his wife and children. He has worked in agriculture for many years, which has allowed him to make progress during these years. In addition to working in agriculture he has also worked raising animals, including cows, bulls, sheep, and to a lesser extent guinea pigs. Of what he grows in his fields he sells one part, and saves the other part in his storeroom for personal consumption during moments of need. His love for his family is what motivates him to endure the extreme heat or cold of the countryside when he is preparing his land for sowing seeds, or when he is preparing for the harvest. This is the second time that Bernardo has sought a loan with MFP. He is pleased to be a member of his local community bank because everyday the members are learning, and it also provides an interesting space for socialising and mutual support. The loan is to buy bags of fertilizer, costing 200 soles each, which will serve him well during the sowing season now approaching.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for his crops

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes es socia del Banco Comunal Estrella.
Mercedes es casada, tiene 42 años y 3 hijos, Mercedes vende verduras, frutas, carne, actividad que realiza de manera ambulatoria, para lo cual cuenta con un triciclo, por las mañanas se ubica en el mercado de San Juan luego vende de casa en casa.
Mercedes necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de frutas y verduras.
Los sueños de Mercedes son tener una tienda en su casa y compra un carro para transportar sus productos.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a member of the Estrella (Star) communal bank. Mercedes is 42 years old, married and has 3 kids. Mercedes sells fruits, vegetables and meat. She travels around selling on a tricycle. In the mornings, she travels to the market of San Juan and then afterwards she sells house to house. Mercedes needs a loan of 1200 soles that will be invested in the purchase of fruits and vegetables. Mercedes dreams of having a shop in her house and buying a car to transport her products.

Translated from Spanish by Julie Lutz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Zareena M.rafiq Group

texts.en:
Zareena baji has been a citizen of a city named Vehari, Pakistan for the past 15 years. Zareena baji is married to a man whose name is M. R., and he is a mason. Zareena baji is a housewife but she is involved in a clothes-sewing business also. She knows that her husband’s income is insufficient, and she does this work to share the financial burden of her husband and to meet the family's expenses. Zareena baji is applying for a loan to buy mason's tools for her husband’s business.

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Nagina baji wants a loan to buy meat to sell. Rukhsana baji wants a loan to buy goats for her animal-selling business. Shafiqan baji wants a loan to buy scrap for her scrap business. Sakina baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy mason's tools

loans.name: Qatun Llaqta Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal  Qatun Llaqta que significa Pueblo GranD. que inicia el quinto ciclo con 16 socias, las socias son del distrito D. Socos que se ubica a 40 minutos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho. 

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. abarrotes en general, comida, Animales menores, realizan artesanías en telar y la agricultura

Como es el caso D. Modesta que es casada, tiene 48 años y 3 hijos, Modesta tiene una tienda D. abarrotes en general, además Modesta es artesana, realiza tejidos en telar como alfombras, tapices.

Por otro lado Mariluz es conviviente, tiene 24 años y 2 hijos, Mariluz venD. comida D. manera ambulatoria en el parque D. su distrito, además Mariluz venD. verduras en los diferentes pueblos. 

Mientras que Aurora es casada, tiene 36 años y 3 hijos, Aurora tiene una tienda en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, además Aurora se dedica a la agricultura y crianza D. ganado vacuno.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600soles, 900 soles  haciendo un total D. 9,950 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. leña, arroz, sal, fideo, aceite, leche, quesos, trigo, cebada, maiz y animales menores.

Los sueños D. las socias son que sus hijos sean profesionales, tener casa propia, aumentar sus ventas, mejorar sus negocios.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Qatun Llaqta" which means "Big Town", has begun it's 5th cycle with 16 associates. The associates are from the district of Socos which is located 40 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. Each of the associates has a different business. The businesses fall under groceries, food, small animals, farming and handicrafts. For example: Modesta is 48 years old, married, has 3 children and owns a general store. She is also an artist and weaves carpets and rugs. Mariluz is 24 years old, has a partner and has 2 children. She sells food in the park in her district and also sells vegetables in different towns. Aurora is 36 years old, married, has 3 children and owns a store where she sells groceries. She also works in agriculture and raises cattle. The associates need several loans in the amounts of 300 soles, 600 soles and 900 soles for a total of 9,950 soles (3 soles = $1USD, approx.) in loans from the Communal Bank. Their loans would be used to buy firewood, rice, salt, noodles, oil, milk, cheese, wheat, barley, corn and small animals. The associates wish to one day own their own houses, increase their sales and for their children to become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood, rice, salt, noodles, oil, milk, cheese, wheat, barley, corn and small animals.

loans.name: Mahmadrasul

texts.en:
B. Mahmadrasul is 45 years old. He is married with four children. He has his own grocery store where he sells different kinds of foodstuffs like macaroni, cookies, soft drinks, juices, tea, detergents and many others. He started this business 14 years ago with a small inventory of foodstuffs and, over time, he expanded his business and now his business has become very successful.

Today, Mahmadrasul is requesting a loan of $2600 to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur.
