One of his dreams is that his children progress by means of their studies, for which he is doing the best he can. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.     

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and for it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after Tajikistan’s independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit:  www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs to increase the range of his goods

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy T., 28, lives with her husband, a carpenter, and their four children in Panaon, Mis Occ.  Life is hard for the family as her husband's income cannot meet the family's needs, so Nancy is venturing into hog-raising and is requesting a loan from Paglaum as  start up capital.  With it she will buy two pigs and some seedlings for her vegetable garden. She hopes her business will be successful.

loans.use: To buy two pigs and some seedlings.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma S. is from the town of Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 36 years old. Gemma is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Gemma raises livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. 

Gemma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP (US$125), which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be taken out by Gemma from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. The loan will be a big help in providing the necessities of her family.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serve the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Kariati Group

texts.en:
Tatu has been a charcoal seller and a food vendor in the Msamvu neighborhood of Morogoro for 4 years. She belongs to Kariati, a group loan. She currently earns an average monthly profit of  approximately  $80 US. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.  

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more charcoal and food items to add to her current inventory. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to expand her business.

Tatu is 38 years old, widowed, and has three children ages 17, 9 and 2. She also cares for two additional dependents. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Mwajab, Naomi and Mariam. Each woman also has her own small business in Morogoro.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and food items to add to her current inventory.

loans.name: Fight For Shameness Group

texts.en:
This is Isatu K., Sallay K. and Betty K.. They named their group Fight for Shameness. They are local entrepreneurs based in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. This is not the first loan these women have received from SMT/Kiva. Previous loans have made a significant impact on the lives of these borrowers. They were able to feed their children, send them to school and meet most of their daily financial challenges from the proceeds they make from their businesses. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they have now applied again for a new loan to further strengthen their businesses.

Isatu K. (right) is the leader of this group. Isatu was born in Boya Romendey, in northern Sierra Leone. She is now 45 and married with four children. Two of her children are in secondary schools and two are in primary schools. Her husband in an architect and both of them work hand in hand in running the home. Isatu sells both dried and fresh fish. She has been in this business for many years. Occasionally, Isatu also sells cakes.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Svetlana Lisseth

texts.es: La joven Svetlana Rodríguez tiene la edad de 33 años, tiene una niña de 10 años de edad que estudia, reside en el barrio Hialeah en la capital de Managua. Su negocio es la venta de ropa, zapato y golosinas tiene nueve años de trabajar en las ventas. Inicio solo vendiendo ropa por encargo con ahorro que su esposo dio. Con este crédito es su séptimo ciclo el cual lo quiere para comprar ropa, zapatos y poder ofertar la variedad de sus productos. Ella viaja a Guatemala a comprar la ropa  ya que es mas barata y la puede dar buen precio. Da las gracias Afodenic por el apoyo con los préstamos, plazos y los beneficios alcanzados.
texts.en:
Svetlana Rodríguez, 33, has a ten year old daughter who goes to school. She lives in the Hialeah neighborhood in the capital city of Managua. She sells clothes, shoes, and sweets. She has been doing this for nine years. With savings that her husband gave her, she started out only selling clothes by order . This loan is her seventh loan cycle. She wants to buy clothes and shoes to be able to offer a variety of products. She travels to Guatemala to buy the clothes because it is cheaper, and she can then give a good price. She is grateful to Afodenic for the support of the loans, installments, and the gained benefits.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes and shoes

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en: Grace S. is the leader of Hope Group 2 in Kigombya. She is a hard working lady with various businesses. As a poultry farmer, Grace raises both layers and broiler chickens for eggs and meat respectively, and is involved in the sale of poultry feed for other poultry farmers. She is also a farmer, and her chickens’ husks help to fertilize her plantations for high quality yields. Except for her farming enterprise, which she has had for a very long time, her businesses have only been in operation for 3 years. Since she has learned to manage her businesses, she does not regret not having had previous loans to increase her capital. Grace currently needs a loan to help buy more feed for her poultry farm, and for resale.

loans.use: Buying more feed for poultry, and for resale

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita T. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 61 years old. Carmelita is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Carmelita owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops and livestocks. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables, and raising pigs for sale. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Carmelita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase feeds for her raised pigs, and construction materials for house repair. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Carmelita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en: Leticia sells used plastic. She works from 8am to 6pm, seven days-a-week. She hopes to borrow N150, 000 to purchase more used plastic to sell. She is 39 years-old and married with no children. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more used plastic to sell

loans.name: Julia Santos

texts.es: Don Julia de 57 años de edad casada con residencia en el paraje Coxom del canton Patzarajmac del Municipio de Totonicapan su actividad  economica es la elaboración de blusas manuales de diferentes colores y estilo dicha comunida la actividad principan es el bordado, ya que se tiene ese don de enseñar y dicho producto son encargados por las persona de diferentes lugares por el estilo y el material que se utiliza en el mercado una blusa con un costo de Q 2,500.00 pero el tiempo que se lleva en la elaboracion  doña Julia necesita de un credito, que le servira para la compra de hilo, tela, diseño y moldes ya que dicha actividad le estar enseñando a una de sus ñietas

loans.use: Ampliacion de Capital

loans.name: Mrs. Rurs Pork Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank loan which consists of fifteen people is located in Angk village in Kandal province. Mrs. Rurs P. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns 0,5-hectar to cultivate rice to earn for living. Her husband, Mr. Chhin Sipha, also helps her in the plantation. Although this couple tries to work hard, they still earn less income to support the family so Mrs. Rurs P. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding and she hopes to increase her income after she sells the cow. Mrs. Rurs P. is 35 years old and the mother of five children two of whom are working in a garment factory while other two are attending the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is on the age of four years old. 

Thirteen members in this village bank loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding and she hopes to increase her income after she sells the cow.

loans.name: Nary Clavelita

texts.es:
La Sra. Nary Clavelita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Paz II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 20 años y es madre, de una pequeña niña, que aun depende de ella. 

Recientemente, viene dedicándose a la Venta  de Repuestos de Motos, su negocio se encuentra ubicada en un local muy bien acondicionado, en su misma casa, para atender a sus clientes. Se inicio con el primer préstamo que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, le ha brindado.  Posteriormente, continúo superándose y hoy en la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio, ya más implementado y poco a poco ha ido ganado clientes y haciéndose mas conocida.
Con este préstamo de S/.700.00, comprara cadenas de motos, pistones, arrastres, rodajes, empaquetaduras y ponchos.

Hoy, es una mujer independiente, y ella es la que administra y toma las decisiones en su negocio.
Nary Clavelita dice: Que a su edad, el pertenecer a un grupo de mujeres le ha ayudado a conocer mejor sus derechos y juntas hacer que estas sean respetadas.
texts.en:
Nary Clavelita belongs to the community bank “La Paz II” in the district of Tarapoto, province and department of San Martín. She is twenty years old and has a live-in partner. She is the mother of a little girl who depends on her. Recently she has been selling parts for motorbikes. Her business is located in her home, in a space well-equipped to attend her customers. She began the business with a loan Movimiento Manuela Ramos provided her. Subsequently, she continued bettering herself, and, to this days, works in the same business. Now her business is more established and little by little she has gained more customers and made herself more well-known. She will use this loan of 700 soles to buy bike chains, pistons, gears, gaskets, and other parts. She is an independent woman who administers and makes the decisions for her business. Nary Clavelita says: at her age, being part of a group of woman has helped her learn her rights better and together ensure that these rights are respected.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying bike parts

loans.name: Villa Paraiso Group

texts.es: Es un grupo antiguo responsables en sus pagos, donD. se conocen bien. Su grupo se llama "VILLA PARAISO", el Banco D. Emprendimiento esta en su 9º Ciclo, la  mesa directiva esta conformada por socias responsable y unidos entre ellos, como presidenta esta  la señora Eulogia, ella es lider D. su grupo, muy responsable, se dedica a la fabricacion D. balones D. futbol, tiene 1 hijo, su esposo es comerciante D. balones; el credito lo utilizara para  aumento D. capital. Como tesorero esta Deybi  quien es fundador del grupo, muy responsable tiene 1 hijo trabaja con taxi y tiene internet en su casa el credito lo utiliza para mantenimiento D. su auto y D. sus computadoras. Como secretaria esta la socia Mirian, quien es una socia responsable ,venD. refrigerios y masitas ambulando por el barrio tiene 2 hijos su esposo es comerciante D. gorras el credito lo usa para aumento D. capital.
texts.en:
This is a long-standing group, called "VILLA PARAISO", which is in its 9th loan cycle with the Banco D. Emprendimiento. They have always been very responsible with their repayments and the group members know each other well. The board is maD. up of responsible, united members. Their president is Eulogia and she is a responsible group leader. She manufactures footballs, has one son, and her husband sells the footballs. She will use these funds to increase her operating capital. Deybi is the group treasurer and the founder of the group. He is very responsible, has one son, is a taxi driver and runs an Internet service in his home; he will use the funds for car and computer maintenance. Miriam is the group secretary. She is a very responsible member and she sells refreshments and little cakes around her neighborhood. She has two children and her husband sells caps. She will use the funds to increase working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital increase.

loans.name: Dorjpalam

texts.en:
Dorjpalam, 51, lives with his wife and two of his three children in the Gobi-Altai province of Mongolia.  He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent.  His oldest son, 27, works and lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia and his two younger children, 24 and 18, both attend university.  With the help of his wife, Dorjpalam operates a grocery and dairy retail business in their town.  They started it in 2003 by renting a stall at a local market.  With years of hard work and success they build their own shop where they conduct business.  Dorjpalam and his wife have a lot of business experience.  He says, “All I want to do is help my children to become good people.” Dorjpalam is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~$1400 USD) loan to purchase more dairy and grocery products for his shop.
------------------
About XacBank
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

loans.use: Purchase more dairy and grocery products for his shop.

loans.name: Keao

texts.en: Keao M., 47, is married with two teenage children,  who attend school. He has a job as a local barber and rents a small workshop, located along the road, to provide this service. Most of his clients are men who live in the commune. He normally generates an average of $4 profit a day and uses his income to meet all his family’s needs. Keao M. is applying for a loan from Kiva’s partner HKL which he will use to buy different kinds of cooking ingredients for his wife to sell. This will allow him to accumulate more income to ensure that his family attains a better standard of living.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of cooking ingredients for his wife to sell

loans.name: Pilataxi Pilataxi

texts.es:
M. Pilataxi de 54 años de edad, vive en una casa de cementos con dos servicios básicos, su vivienda esta ubicada en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, M. comenzó hace 2 años trabajando en el mercado de la Pedro Pablo Gomes en Guayaquil vendiendo algunas frutas pero por haber muchos comerciantes lo expulsaron de ese lugar, con esto el decidió ser independiente y puso una pequeña tienda en su casa.

Ahora Manual trabaja desde las 06h00 hasta las 22h00, tiene en su negocio azúcar, arroz, aceite, etc. Su esposa le ayuda en la tienda mientras que M. sale a hacer fletes en la camioneta para tener otro ingreso extra. Tienen 4 hijos uno de 29 años, otro de 27 años, otro de 25 años y el último de 11 años que estudia en una escuela Fiscal.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar  productos de primera necesidad para su tienda, en el futuro quiere tener una mejor estructura en su local y tener estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
M. Pilataxi, 54, lives in a cement house that has two basic services in the outskirts of Guayaquil. Two years ago M. started selling fruits in the Pedro Pablo Gomes market in Guayaquil. But, for lack of sufficient merchants, he was expelled from that site. He then decided to work independently and he set up a small store in his home. Now, M. works from 6am until 10pm. He stocks sugar, rice, oil, etc. His wife helps him tend to the store while he goes out to work as a delivery man to earn extra income. They have four children: a 29-year-old, a 27-year-old, a 25-year-old, and an 11-year-old, who is a public school student. He plans to use the funds to buy basic need items for his store; in the future he would like to have an improved structure to his store and to have economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sugar, Oil

loans.name: Baye Assane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Baye Assane S. est un jeune tailleur de 34 ans, dynamique et très ambitieux, qui habite dans la localité de Ouakam.Il est membre depuis 4 ans a la caisse de l’U-IMCEC a Ouakam et a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit. C’est avec l’appui de son oncle qu’il a reçu une formation dans ce domaine. Et par la suite il s’est battu dans l’espoir de se créer une bonne place dans ce secteur. Ce qui l’intéresse le plus dans cette activité c’est le respect que sa clientèle formule envers lui et en contrepartie la satisfaction qu’il leur procure. Il sollicite un crédit de 50 000 frs dans le but de réfectionner son atelier de couture et de le rendre plus attractif.
Toujours  dans son optique de participer activement a la lutte contre la pauvreté   l’U-IMCEC avec l’appui positif des prêteurs   réussit   à soutenir  les populations  a exercer des  activités  lucratives génératrices de revenus, ce  qui favorise un développement  socio économique   apprécié
texts.en:
Mr Baye Assane S. is a dynamic and very ambitious young tailor, aged 34, who lives in the city of Ouakam. Four years ago he became a member of the Ouakam branch of the microfinance institution U-IMCEC and was already granted a loan. He learnt the dressmaking craft thanks to the support of his uncle, and then struggled to earn his place in this sector. What he appreciates most in his work is the respect that his customers have for him. In return, he gives them satisfaction with his products. He applies for a loan of 50,000 CFA francs to renovate his workshop and make it more attractive.

Always looking to actively participate in the fight against poverty, U-IMCEC – with the positive support of lenders – succeeds in supporting people in revenue-generating activities which promote valuable socioeconomic development.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To renovate his workshop

loans.name: Savang

texts.en:
Mrs. Savang R. (pictured here), 32, and her husband, Mr. Saroeung Soem, 37, were married in 1993 and have two children: one son and one daughter. Both of them are in school. They live with their parents on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Savang has been a silk weaver for 12 years, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh market. Her husband has been a farmer for over two years. She is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase fertilizer, pesticides and seeds to maintain her husband’s farm.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticides and seeds

loans.name: Belkis Del Carmen

texts.es:
En el departamento de Chinandega, Belkis es una dama muy trabajadora que se ha caracterizado por ser muy disciplinada y ha sabido  mantener su núcleo familiar compuesto por sus dos hijos ya que ella es madre soltera y en la casa realiza el papel de padre y madre a la vez.
La señora Belkis está solicitando el crédito para ser invertido en la compra de materiales de construcción con el propósito de utilizarlos para mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda ya que anhela darle a sus hijos las comodidades en su casa. Entre los materiales que comprara se encuentran laminas de zinc y clavos. Ella espera que su crédito sea otorgado para llevar a cabo la obra de construcción y así beneficiar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Belkis lives in Chinandega department. She has been noted for being very disciplined and hard-working. She has kept her family, composed of her two children, together by herself. She is a single mother and must be both mother and father in her home. Belkis is asking for funding to buy building materials to make some home improvements. She wants to provide her children with increased comfort in their home. Among the materials she wants to get are zinc metal sheeting and nails. She hopes the loan will be approved so that she can undertake this construction project thereby benefitting her children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.en:
Nieves G. is from the village of Kibawe, Bukidnon. She is 40 years old. Nieves is married and has seven adult-aged children. To make a living, Nieves owns and operates a business selling used clothing (or ukay ukay), and sometimes she also sells specialty homemade food products like banana chips in the local community. Nieves has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $100 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Nieves joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nieves has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Nieves is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to further improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr:
Monsieur Abdoulaye G. est né en 1977. Il s’est investi dans le commerce depuis qu’il a terminé l’école coranique. C’est après le décès de son père, il y’a 10 ans, que son oncle lui laisse la boutique que gérer son père de son vivant.
Cet homme marié depuis 2 ans est à son deuxième prêt toujours pour la bonne marche de sa boutique à laquelle il voit son frère l’épauler au niveau de sa gestion. Il demande un montant de 300 000 FCFA pour renforcer la boutique en riz, huile, sucre et thé qui constituent les aspects les plus importants dans la vente.
texts.en:
Mr. Abdoulaye G. was born in 1977. He put a lot of himself into business since he finished his Koranic schooling. It was after the death of his father 10 years ago that his uncle left him the shop that his father managed when he was alive. This man, who has been married for 2 years, is on his second loan to run his shop, with which his brother is helping. He is asking for 300,000 FCFA to build up his shop with rice, oil, sugar and tea, which are the most important items he sells.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to stock up on items for his shop

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen M. is from the village of Kimanait, Pangantucan Bukidnon. She is 56 years old. Carmen is single and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Carmen owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Carmen has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Carmen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. She opted to request a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Carmen from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: J. Repaso's Group

texts.en: Josa R. is from the village of Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old. Josa is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC, a Kiva partner. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is J. R.'s Group. Josa is married. To make a living, Josa owns and operates a "sari-sari" (variety) store. The main source of income for her business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Josa has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2008, Josa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josa has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Josa is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 10th loan taken out by Josa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Tacajalve Group

texts.es: Este grupo de señoras,  del paraje Xecorral, de la aldea Tacajalvé, del municipio de San Francisco el Alto  del departamento de Totonicapán, S. personas que se conocen muy bien, desde hace 20 años han trabajado siempre juntas, en el cual lo  doña: Santos Maria T., es la presidenta, estas siete personas se dedican especialmente a la Comercio Venta de llantas para vehículos, venta de ropa nueva, venta de concentrado para animales, Artesanía Elaboración de Perrajes, Elaboración de Camisas  y a la crianza de animales tales como: Cerdos Ovejas y Vacas, las persona que vende. Ropa tiene sus  puntos de venta en,  San Francisco el Alto y el caso de la venta de llantas fco. el Alto, Toto, en el caso de las verduras y frutas y en el caso de la Ropa típica y Faldas, lo venden en la Retalhuleu, Mazatenango, Coatepeque y También en San Francisco el Alto y en algunos casos las personas lo recogen en la casa de una de ellas,  para venderlos  por docena en diferentes lugares , las personas  necesitan ampliar sus Capital de Trabajo, por lo que se acercaron a las oficinas de la asociación ASDIR de Pologuá , para poderles financiar, su actividad económica y así poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y de sus familias
texts.en:
This group of members from the small village of Tacajalvé, in the town of San Francisco el Alto, Department of Totonicapán, know each other very well, having worked with each other continuously for the past twenty years. Their president is Santos María T.. These seven people earn their living selling tires, new clothing, animal feed, hand-made perrajes [shawls] and shirts, and raising animals like pigs, sheep, and cows. The members who sell clothing or tires sell in San Francisco el Alto. Those who sell fruits and vegetables or everyday clothing and skirts sell in Retalhuleu, Mazatenango, Coatepeque as well as San Francisco el Alto. In some cases they pick up their items at someone's house and sell them by the dozen at a variety of locations. Because they need to expand their working capital, the members approached the ASDIR Association office in Pologuá seeking financing for their businesses so they can improve their families' quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
"Farming is my passion," says Romeo M., who is from the village of Nabbotuan, Solana, Cagayan. He is 54 years old, married and has one adult child. Romeo owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. Romeo has been involved in his business for over 50 years and earns approximately 9,0000 PHP during harvest season. His income is really a great help in supporting his family's needs.

In 2005, Romeo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Romeo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. Romeo is requesting a new loan, his 5th, of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Fabio Guillermo

texts.es: Fabio Guillermo tiene 49 años, su actividad económica es la brindar el servicio de carpintería. Pues esta es la primera experiencia que obtiene con créditos, el se encuentra muy feliz de tener esta oportunidad. Hace más de 30 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que siempre está pendiente de lo que sus 2 hijos necesitan. Inicio por cuenta propia ya que no tenía un trabajo estable y tenía que proporcionarle a su familia lo necesario para sufragar los gastos del hogar. El financiamiento es para la compra de herramientas, madera, clavos, pega, maque entre otras. Sueña con agrandar su taller que es único rubro que tiene.
texts.en:
Fabio Guillermo is 49 years old and he makes a living offering his services as a carpenter. This is his first experience getting a loan and he is very happy to have the opportunity. He has been dedicated to carpentry for more than 30 years and is always aware of the needs of his two children. He took the initiative to get the loan since he did not have a steady job, but needed to cover his family’s household expenses. The funding is for the purchase of tools, wood, nails, glue, lacquer, etcetera. Dreaming of expanding his workshop is the one thing he has.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Saeeda's Group

texts.en:
Saeeda lives in the third largest city of Pakistan, named Multan. She runs her boutique business out of her home because the rent of shops is too high in Multan. She has a helper who collects orders for her from different areas of Multan, and she makes the finished products for him to deliver on time. Her timely delivery of orders has given her a good reputation with her customers.

Saeeda wants to expand her business, and for this reason she has applied for a loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). She will buy some embroidery materials and unstitched clothes for her boutique and display these to attract more customers.

She is hopeful that this will have a positive impact on her business and her income will increase sufficiently to overcome her family’s financial problems.

loans.use: To purchase the required items for her boutique.

loans.name: Patricia Yersina

texts.es:
La señora Patricia Yersina A. A. tiene 26 años D. edad y vive en el Barrio El Tejar D. la ciudad D. Tarija. Patricia es casada pero no tiene hijos y vive en casa D. suspadres.  
                                       
Patricia se dedica a la atención D. un punto D. llamadas, actividad que viene realizando desD. hace 2años.   
                                                                                                                                                                Patricia nos dice que se presento la oportunidad D. comprar dos cabinas D. teléfono es por eso que el crédito será destinado para la compra D. dichas cabinas D. esa forma tener mejores ingresos personales para ella y toda sufamilia.   
                                                                                                                                                                                    Patricia nos cuenta que su mayor sueño es poder darles toda la comodidad que pueda a sus padres para que sean felices. También nos dice que el próximo crédito que obtenga será destinado a mejorar las condiciones D. su casa.
texts.en:
Señora Patricia Yersina A. A. is 26 years old and lives in the neighbourhood of El Tejar in the town of Tarija. She is married, has no children, and lives with her parents. Patricia runs a phone centre, a job she’s been doing for two years. She has been given the opportunity to buy two phone booths, and she would use the loan for this purpose, giving her more income for her and her family. Patricia’s greatest wish is to be able to make her parents happy by providing them with as many comforts as she can. Her next loan will be used to make some improvements to their house.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy telephone booths

loans.name: Hyvonne

texts.en:
Hyvonne is a married woman with one child who attends school. Her husband is a businessman, and he contributes to his family's needs. She rents a house with electricity and piped water.

She has been operating her business of distributing fresh water to her neighbors and restaurant operators for the past two years, and sells from home. With the Kshs 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase a 6000-litre water tank. The major challenge she faces in her business is seasonality. Hyvonne hopes to open another water project someday. She decided to work with Yehu because of its low interest rates and its transparency and accountability. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: Elsa, es una mujer bastante trabajadora tiene 30 años y vive con su pareja Nilton de 30 años con quien tiene 2 hijos que son su adoración, todos viven en su casa propia. Desde hace 10 años trabaja en la agricultura, tuvo a sus padres, quienes la capacitaron en esta labor, es por ello que ahora junto a su esposo, le enseñan todas las técnicas agrícolas a sus hijos, quienes de vez en cuando le ayudan en pequeños labores en el campo, cultivando café, plátano y palta. Disfruta mucho las diferentes labores que practica en la chacra, y cuando quiere agilizar su trabajo contrata operarios, de esa manera puede descansar tranquila y sentir seguridad de que obtendrá una buena producción. Elsa, es muy precavida, ya que está convencida de que una excelente cosecha depende de las atenciones, por eso considera que su labor en la agricultura es bastante rentable, porque le permite adquirir bienes, educar a sus hijos y puede cubrir diferentes gastos cotidianos. Para su futuro, piensa comprar más terrenos productivos y plantar mayor cantidad de café. Este es la tercera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y esta segura de trabajar de manera activa como hasta ahora, pues le gusta laborar co su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que recibirá, comprará varios sacos de abono, que esparcirá sobre sus plantaciones de café.
texts.en:
Elsa is a very hardworking woman who is 30 years old and lives with her partner Nilton, who is also 30 years old and with whom she has 2 children, who are her adoration. They live together in their own house. She has been working in agriculture for 10 years. Her parents taught her this work and that is why now she and her husband are teaching all of the agricultural techniques to their children, who occasionally help them with small jobs in the field, cultivating coffee, plantains, and avocadoes. She enjoys very much the different kinds of work she does in the fields and when she needs to make her work go more quickly she hires workers. In this way she can rest assured, knowing that she will have good production. Elsa is very prudent because she is convinced that a good harvest depends on being attentive. She considers her work in agriculture to be quite profitable, because it allows her to buy land, educate her children, and to cover a variety of daily expenses. For the future she plans to buy some more land that is productive and to plant a larger amount of coffee. This is the third time she has had a loan with MFP and she is sure to continue working hard like she has up to this point because she likes working with her communal bank. With the loan she will receive she will buy several sacks of fertilizer, which she will use on her coffee plants.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Ankhzaya

texts.en: Mrs Ankhzaya is 25 years old. She lives with her husband and 3-year-old daughter in a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent in the Mongolian capital city Ulaanbaatar. Until 2008, Ankhzaya worked in a printing factory. Then she decided to open her own printing company. The company does all kinds of printing such as name cards, invitations, and certificates, as well as printing on items such as frames or cups. She is requesting this loan because she wants to increase her profit. She wants to buy a new printer and some printing materials such as color cartridges, different quality papers, frames, and glasses. Ankhzaya’s goal is to build her own house.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies.

loans.name: Aida

texts.es:
Aida es una mujer trabajadora, docente y pequeña comerciante de cosméticos, pues ha logrado obtener otros ingresos mediante a sus ventas, durante su trayecto de vida, lleva trabajando como docente veintiún años, y cinco años en ventas. 
Aun con deseo de trabajar  a pesar que esta avanzada de edad, 
Lo  que ha venido a mejorar sus necesidades personales con sus ganancias lo que ha sido de ayuda para su familia.
Lleva seis créditos en Afodenic que han sido para el bienestar de su pequeño negocio ya que atreves de estos préstamo logro aumentar más productos.
Con este financiamiento comprara: perfumes, pinturas, maquillajes, vanidad, crema de cuerpo y ropa interior de dama. Logrando a si mejores colocaciones.
texts.en:
Aida is a hard working, teacher and small businesswoman who sells cosmetics. She's managed to create another income through her sales during this part of her life. She's been teaching for 21 years and has been selling for five years. She still has a desire to work, even though she is older now. Her sales have allowed her to improve her quality of life and that of her family. She's had six loans through Afodenic, which have helped with her small business' well being by allowing her to acquire more products. She will use the money from this loan to buy perfumes, makeup, vanity items, body creams, and ladies' undergarments. This will allow her better positioning.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Zainab Muhammad Murad's Group

texts.en:
Zainab M. M. lives in a small city called Vehari that is located in Punjab, Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. Zainab is a housewife who stays at home and does her household work. Her husband is M. M., a milkman by profession. He has a buffalo from which he gets milk and sells it to different milk shops so as to generate income for the family. Zainab also helps her husband by taking care of his buffalo and milking it as well. M.’s buffalo gives him almost 8-10 kg. of milk per day, and he sells 1 kg. of milk for 45 PKRs. In this way he earns approximately 450 PKRs every day.

Zainab has applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan her husband will buy another buffalo for his dairy. Zainab is hopeful that with the additional buffalo her husband’s income will double in size and increase his customer base as well.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo

loans.name: Michel

texts.en:
Michel M. is 22 years old, married and has a toddler. She is from the village of Poblacion, a part of Quezon municipality, Bukidnon province on the islands of Mindanao. Michel raises pigs to sell. She has been in business for over two years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010 Michel joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. She is requesting a loan, her first, of 5000 PHP that will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business.

About HSPFI:

Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc., or HSPFI, is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Martha K.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is pleased to present to you teachers of the National Penticostal Primary School. This school was founded on September 19, 1994 by the National Penticostal Mission to educate the children of the community. National Penticostal Primary school is staffed with nine able teachers and 380 pupils.  

This is the first loan that this school has applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. Martha K. S. is their leader and headmaster at the school. The 51-year-old Martha was born in Mabanta village, an outskirt of Makeni city. She has been in the teaching profession for 37 years now. She is married to a teacher and they have three children. Two of the children are in college and one is an adult. Mrs. S. has requested this loan in order to pay college fees for her children. 

School staff from this institution, like many other schools staff within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise have not been able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or to invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

loans.use: To pay college fees for her children

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a new consignment of drugs

loans.name: Ikayo

texts.en:
Ikayo N., 44, is a livestock trader. He is married to Mavania, 40, who is a farmer. Together they have five children aged two, seven, 10, 12 and 14. He lives at Enkaroni in Kajiado and sells his livestock in the nearby Bissil market. He has been running his livestock trading business for two years, and his monthly profit is 10,000 KES. Bissil is a very busy market with a large population, so Ikayo’s livestock are bought at good prices and he uses the profit to take care of his family and save for his children’s education.

Ikayo learned about KADET through the World Vision area development program. He has applied for a loan, which he intends to use to buy livestock for trading. If the loan boosts the business, Ikayo intends to start selling meat wholesale, which will give him more profit.

Ikayo wants to become a big businessman is describes himself as very enterprising.

loans.use: To buy livestock for trading

loans.name: Dan Mery

texts.en:
Dan Mery N. is a married woman who lives in Barangay Malatbo, Ginatilan, Cebu. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures: hog raising and food vending. Her husband Glenn N., who is 31 years old, works as a driver to earn his living. They have 4 children who are between 2 mos. and 5 years old. 

Dan Mery joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 6 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Dan Mery has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 20,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 7th loan, she is borrowing PHP 21,000, which she intends to use to pay for more additional capital for the business so that she can continue to save up for the future to have more income for the family. Dan Mery N. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business.

loans.name: C5528 Abanyamurava Group

texts.en:
Josephine, a 30-year-old married mother of five children between the ages of 2 and 12, is the leader of the group called Abanyamurava. This group consists of nine members: two men and seven women.

Josephine, with five years of experience selling milk, conducts her business between 7 a.m and 6 p.m. daily. Hoping to earn more profits which will allow her to save money for the future, feed her family and pay school fees for her children, she has requested a loan to purchase a large quantity of milk.

loans.use: To purchase more milk

loans.name: Gloria Marlene

texts.es:
Doña Gloria de 43 años de edad  vive con sus dos hijos y su esposo el cual le ayuda con los gastos familiares, habitan en Nueva Guinea de la Policia 1 c. al sur 1/2 c. al este, ella  labora como docente de primaria  desde hace 20 años en la Escuela Mauricio Cajina ubicada en  la zona urbana de Nueva Guinea, segun referencias es  responsable con sus compromisos y lo ha demostrado ser en sus creditos anteriores. 

Solicita su octavo crèdito a AFODENIC para construir una habitaciòn y mejorar sus condiciones de su vivienda para que sus hijos gocen de un hogar agradable, 

Su mayor sueño en la vida es que su linda familia permanezca unida y en las cosas de Dios.
texts.en:
Gloria is 43 years old.  She lives with her two children and her husband who helps with their family expenses.  They live in Nueva Guinea de la Policia, 1 c. al sur, 1/2 c. al este.  

Gloria has worked as an elementary school teacher for 20 years in Mauricio Cajina Elementary School which is located in the urban area of Nueva Guinea.  According to her references she is responsible in her obligations and she has shown this with her previous loans.

Gloria is requesting her eighth loan through AFODENIC to build a room and improve the conditions in her house so that her children can live in a pleasant home.

Her biggest dream in life is for her beautiful family to remain united and committed to God.

loans.use: To build a room

loans.name: Sarangerel

texts.en:
Sarangerel N. is 32 years old and lives with her husband and child in a house in the Songino-Hairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

Her child, age 4, attends kindergarten, while her husband is a taxi driver to supplement his family income. 

Sarangerel operates a hair salon in a rented space, partnering with two friends. She began her business in 2005 and it has grown steadily over the years due to her loyal customers. 

For the future, she plans to continue to grow her business so that she can open her own hair salon. 

Sarangerel is an honest and modest person and is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan in order to replace her old equipment and tools for her hair salon.

loans.use: To replace her old hair salon equipment

loans.name: Vaneza

texts.es: Vaneza tiene 21 años, vive con sus padres en la propiedad que tienen. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a realizar bordados y prendas típicas, que son características de su zona, en este caso son los fustanes, las prendas que realiza y hecha de tela con variados bordados y colores. Este trabajo lo realiza con su maquina, que le ayuda hacer finos acabados. Es así que después de una jornada semanal de producción distribuyen al por mayor a los comerciantes, asimismo realiza el servicio de costura, actividad por el cual recibe considerables ganancias que la favorece en su economía y la anima a planear el futuro de su negocio implementando con mejores equipos y herramientas. Es su crédito número 3  con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos y agradece  a todas las personas que serán gestoras del crédito que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de una maquina de coser nueva.
texts.en: Vaneza is 21 years old and she lives with her parents on the property they own. For the past 2 years she has been making cross-stitch crafts and traditional garments that are common in the region, especially skirts. The articles of clothing she crafts are made in various colors and patterns. She works with the help of a machine that crafts the fine designs. Following a week's worth of production she distributes her crafts in wholesale to merchants. She also provides sewing services, a business that affords her a considerable income. This helps her personal finances and it encourages her to plan to improve her business in the future with better tools and equipment. This is her third loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is very happy to know she has this financial support. She has always demonstrated to be responsible with her payments. She is thankful to all those individuals who will contribute to the loan she requests. It will be very useful in the progress of her business. The loan she requests will be invested in the purchase of a new sewing machine.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic P. lives in the village of Talisayan, Misamis Oriental. She is 33 years old, married and has five school-aged children. She makes a living by running a sari-sari (or variety) store where she sells products people use daily such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snacks and toothpaste. She has been in this business for more than three years and earns about 12,000 PHP a month from her work.

Earlier this year, Marivic joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She is applying for her first loan, for 5,000 PHP, to buy additional products to sell to her customers. She plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to continue expanding her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: La señora Maribel cuenta con 30 años de edad, es originaria de la localidad de los Viveros ubicado en el estado de Michoacán, Mari como le gusta que le digan es casada con el Señor Andrés quien es jornalero ellos tienen una niña de nombre Andrea la cual tiene un año de edad, ellos dos se dedican al cultivo y venta de flores de diferentes tipos, la cual su temporada alta es el mes de noviembre- diciembre, comenta Mari que ella aprendió esta actividad gracias a su padre desde que ella tenía 12 años de edad , ella decidió emprender esta actividad porque deja muy buenas ganancias, aunque se le tiene que invertir demasiado cuidado, tiempo y sobre todo dinero, ellos venden la flor en la Ciudad de México en los tianguis. Está pidiendo su préstamo a Fundación Realidad para la compra de papel, abono e insecticidas para el vivero de flores.   Comenta que su desafío es en este momento es que se le logre la flor que tiene y poderla vender toda  ya que se le invierte mucho dinero y tiempo. Doña Mari asegura que le beneficiara el préstamo ya que podrá darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hija ya que es uno de los motivos para salir adelante y podrá pagar su préstamo cómodamente y no andar presionada por falta de dinero. La meta que tiene para su negocio es remodelar su vivero ya que el plástico que tiene esta desgastado por las inclemencias del clima, otra meta es plantar árboles de aguacate en el terreno que le dieron sus papas, ella dice “más adelante quiero dedicarme al 100%  al cultivo de aguacate ya que la flor de noche buena los fertilizantes y abonos son muy tóxicos y poco a poco nos están afectando a nuestra salud a mi esposo y a mí”. Dice que con las ganancias que saque de la venta de noche buena una parte del dinero la ahorrara para el próximo año para la compra de fertilizantes y lo que ocupe para el desarrollo de la flores, otra parte la va a destinar para terminar su casa.
texts.en:
Sra. Maribel is 30 years old and a native of the town of Viveros in the State of Michoacán. She likes being married to Sr. Andrés, who works as a day laborer. They have a one year old daughter named Andrea. Both of them grow and sell flowers of various types. Their high season is during the months of November and December. Mari says she learned how to grow flowers from her father, who taught her when she was 12 years old. She decided to pursue this activity because it generates a very good income, even though it requires a great deal of effort, time, and money. Mari sells her flowers at the local markets in Mexico City. She is requesting a loan from Fundación Realidad in order to buy paper, compost, and insecticides for her flower nursery. Her challenge at the moment is having enough time and money to invest in her current crop of flowers so that she will have enough to sell.

Doña Mari says the loan will be a great benefit because she can give her daughter a better quality of life. Another reason why she wants to stay ahead is so that she can pay her loan back and not fall behind due to a lack of money. One goal she has for her business is to remodel her nursery since it is made of plastic and has deteriorated as a result of bad weather. Another goal is to plant avocado trees on the land given to her by her parents. Mari says, “Later on I want to devote 100% of my time to growing avocados because the fertilizers and composts we use for growing poinsettias are highly toxic and gradually affecting my health as well as that of my husband.” Her profits from the sale of poinsettias have been good, so she will set aside some of the money to buy fertilizers for next year’s crop of flowers. Another portion will be used to finish the construction of her home.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for growing flowers

loans.name: Jose Gregorio

texts.es: El señor José Gregorio está pidiendo un crédito para poder comprar cedro, caoba, herramientas y otros materiales para su trabajo el cual es la principal fuente de ingresos para su familia. El tiene 10 años con este negocio, ha sido de gran provecho para su familia, ya que es por medio del servicio que el brinda es que ha podido mantener a su familia. Este oficio lo aprendió de su papa, actualmente el ya no puede trabajar y le ofreció el negocio a Gregorio.  El sueño de él es agrandar su taller con maquinarias más modernas.
texts.en: José Gregorio is requesting a loan to buy cedar, mahogany, tools and other materials for his work, which is the main source of income for his family. He has operated this business for 10 years, and it has been very beneficial to his family, since through the service he provides he has been able to support his family. He learned this profession from his father, who now cannot work anymore and offered the business to Gregorio.  Gregorio's dream is to expand his workshop with more modern equipment.

loans.use: to buy cedar, mahogany, tools and other materials

loans.name: Abasali

texts.en:
Abasali M. lives in the village Dzveli Kveshi, Kartli Region. He is 52 years old. Abasali is married and lives with his wife, 25-year-old son and 103-year-old mother. Abasali’s family is actively involved in agriculture. In particular, they own a plot of land, cultivate it and grow potatoes and maize. The harvested grain and potatoes are sold to local wholesalers. 

With the requested amount, Abasali plans to cultivate land and sow potatoes and maize. The profit will be used for Abasali’s son's aducation, as well as purchasing additional plots of land to expand the family business. Abasali hopes he will have a good harvest season and will be able to purchase home furniture as well, in addition to the above-mentioned.

loans.use: to pay for cultivation of the land.

loans.name: Fredesvinda Felicitas

texts.es:
Fredesvinda tiene 48 años D. edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos. ResiD. en una zona urbana marginal del distrito D. Pacasmayo, perteneciente al departamento D. la Libertad, ubicado a 4 horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital del departamento D. Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes y productos D. primera necesidad en un puesto ubicado en el mercado D. su localidad desD. hace más D. 15 años.  Los ingresos que percibe D. su negocio le sirve para solventar los gastos D. su familia y darle mejor calidad D. vida. Fredesvinda desea surtir su puesto con mas abarrotes para después venderlos y obtener mayores ingresos.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo D. 1500 nuevos soles D. Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Fredesvinda is 48 years old, married and has 3 children.  She lives in a marginal urban zone in the district of Pacasmayo, which belongs to the department of La Libertad, located 4 hours from the city of Chiclayo which is the capital of the department of Lambayeque. 

For more than 15 years she has sold groceries and other basic necessities in a stall located in the market in her town. The income that she receives from her business helps to cover the costs of her family and give them a better quality of life. Fredesvinda wants to stock her stall with more groceries to later sell them and get greater income. This is why she has asked for a loan of 1500 nuevo soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to stock her stall with more groceries

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard, aged 32 years, is a married man with two children living in his own house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He owns a video library and a barber shop that he has operated for the last four years. He acquired his initial capital from his mother and he accumulated savings with which he bought land. His dream is to educate his children and acquire enough land to set up an animal farm. Richard wants a loan to buy a computer for CD burning, a UPS and phone accessories.

loans.use: To buy a computer for CD burning, a UPS and phone accessories.

loans.name: Burambira Development Group A

texts.en:
Gad T., 43, is an enterprising business man with foresight.  He firmly believes in the future prospects of his general merchandise retail shop, which is located in Burambira in the Kihihi District.  The shop has been in business for over a decade and he believes it is destined for even more long-term success. 

Gad, a the father of four children, gleefully remarks that the success of the shop is due to the hard work ethic he has nurtured and embraced.  The store was launched with savings from his agricultural sales business.  The shop's weekly sales is approximately 180,000 shillings.  He will use the loan to purchase more retail commodities to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more retail commodities to resell.

loans.name: Savorn

texts.en:
Savorn is 59 years old.  She resides in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Savorn sells fish, earning an income of USD 3.33 per day to help cover her family's expenses. Her husband is a recycler, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 60 on food and USD 28 on other necessary expenses.

 Savorn is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a motorbike for her family's use. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy a motorbike

loans.name: Olinda Maria

texts.es: Olinda vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla en el barrio Carrizal con su esposo y tiene 4 hijos en las edades de 33 a 35 años, todos ellos  trabajadores independientes, que han aprendido la actividad de empredimiento de su madre, quien se ha dedicado desde hace 20 años a la venta de almuerzos especialmente de sancochos costeños, preparados con verduras y con una, dos o tres clases de carnes. Ella iniciò este negocio despues de  haber tenido una tienda donde desperdiciaban la verdura,  el hueso y la costilla de res pegada a este. Desde ese momento empezó a hacer sopas y a venderlas , ayudada por sus hijos, pues en la tienda diariamente tenia mas de 50 compradores. Una vez posicionada  la venta de almuerzos arrendó su tienda con toda su infraestructura y decidió quedarse con este último, debido a todo el trabajo que representan estos dos negocios al mismo tiempo.  En la actualidad Olinda está solicitando su primer financiamiento a la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo  pues quiere fortalecer su negocio de comidas y por eso ampliara su capital de trabajo mediante un credikiva, con el cual comprará en mayor volumen,  viveres, bebidas, arroz, granos y en general insumos para la preparaciòn de sus comidas, pues sabe que al comprar en efecivo y en mayor cuantia obtendra muy buenos descuentos y esto le generará ingresos superiores a los actuales y continuará incrementando su margen de utilidad que en la actualidad es no menor de un 20%.
texts.en:
Olinda lives in the neighborhood of Carrizal in the city of Barranquilla with her husband and four children who are between the ages of 33 and 35. All of her children work independently and have learned to be just as enterprising as their mother. For the past 20 years, Olinda has been selling lunches, especially coastal stews that are prepared with vegetables and up to three types of meat. She started this business after managing a store where she threw out vegetables, bones, and beef ribs. At that moment, she began making soups and selling them with the help of her children. Olinda sold them every day from her store and would have more than 50 customers. As soon as she was in a position to start selling lunches, Olinda put her entire store up for lease and decided to stick with her new venture. All of the work she has accomplished is represented by these two businesses.

Olinda is currently requesting her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo because she wants to strengthen her food business and increase her operating capital with Kiva funds. She will buy in bulk provisions, drinks, rice, grain, and general supplies for preparing her dishes. Olinda knows that buying in large amounts is more effective because she can obtain very good discounts, generate better earnings, and continue improving her profit margin which is currently at a minimum of 20%.

loans.use: to purchase provisions, drinks, rice, grain, and general supplies in bulk for preparing her dishes.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with nine children. 

Monica has a shop that sells bananas & coconuts. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy coconuts & bananas.

Monica has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Monica hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts & bananas.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles, a 39-year-old resident of the town of Masidi in the Hoima region of Uganda, is married and has two children, both of whom are currently in school. For the past three years, Charles has operated a business making saucepans. He also has a small retail shop that sells essential commodities like sugar.

To help expand his business, Charles has requested a loan of 1000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to purchase iron for making saucepans. With the help of the loan, he hopes to generate greater profits and pay the school fees for his children. In the future, Charles hopes to own a factory that makes saucepans.

loans.use: to purchase iron for making saucepans.

loans.name: Tusakimu Ltc Group

texts.en: 27-year-old Silivester joined the motorcycle transportation business five years ago. The self-assured and congenial father of two says he joined this business to make some income for himself so that he could provide for his family. Before that, he was mostly involved in odd jobs like working in washing bays around Lugazi town. This business, despite its drawbacks, has enabled quite a number of young Ugandans to make ends meet. Many young people have now extricated themselves out of their narrow circumstances. This business, however, has of recent come under some criticism from firebrand politicians who claim the commercial motorbike riders are the sole cause of traffic jams in the metropolis of Kampala. It’s ironic however, because most rank and file people rely on these motorcycles to beat the frustrating traffic gridlock in towns and cities. Weekly he says his income totals up to Ugandan shillings 100,000 and he says with this Kiva loan he is going to  purchase better spare parts and tires for his motorcycle.

loans.use: to  purchase better spare parts and tires for his motorcycle

loans.name: Teodulo

texts.es:
Teodulo es un padre de familia de 49 años de edad, vive con sus hijos en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de La Matanza que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona desarrolla la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesanía.

Teodulo desde hace 5 años se dedica a la comercialización de plátanos al por mayor y menor en los diferentes mercados de la zona, es conocido por los comerciantes y el producto que ofrece, con la venta de la fruta podrá solventar sus obligaciones familiares.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de plátanos para seguir vendiéndolo a sus clientes y con sus ingresos podrá cubrir su crédito y mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia.  Teodulo es un padre de familia responsable y trabajador que lo único que quiere es que sus hijos tengan un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Teodulo is the father of a family, 49 year old, and he lives with his children in a house which is his own property. It is not equipped with the basic services and it is located in the rural region of the district of La Matanza, belonging to the department of Piura. This region is known for its agricultural, farming, and artisan works.

Teodulo has been selling bananas in wholesale and in retail to the different markets in the region for the past 5 years. He is known by the merchants for the products that he offers. With the sale of fruits he is able to meet his family's obligations.

He has requested from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) a loan in the amount of 2000 nuevos soles to purchase a larger quantity of bananas to resell to his clients. With the profits he will be able to repay his loan and he will improve the quality of life for his family. Teodulo is a responsible family man. He is a hardworking man and the only thing that he wants is for his children to have a better future.

loans.use: to purchase bananas in larger quantities for resale.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is married and has six children. She is 51 years old and lives in the Banigan, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Gloria has a piggery business to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. She has requested a loan  of 5000 to purchase more pigs for her pig raising .

Gloria has been a member of PMPC for over a year. In the future, Gloria hopes to expand her business and have a garden to plant crops.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs for her pig raising

loans.name: Liz Danisa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “JOSE CARLOS MARIATEGUI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Liz Danisa; ella tiene 33 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropas interiores como medias y polos y también la socia vende ojotas que son como unos zapatos pero más tradicionales que usan las personas que viven en el campo, la socia trae la mercadería de lugares como Juliaca,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de ropas interiores y venta de ojetas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería de ropas interiores y ojotas al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of José Carlos Mariátegui Communal Bank, located in the District of Urubamba within the Province of Urubamba and the Department of Cusco.

Liz Danisa is 33 years old, has a live-in partner, and three children. She alternates her daily activities with her underwear clothing business where she sells socks and polo shirts. She also sells ‘ojotas’ which are traditional shoes worn by people in rural areas. Liz Danisa brings merchandise from places like Juliaca. She works from 8am to 7pm and uses this business as a means of getting her children ahead. She wants to expand and improve her business selling underwear and ojotas and is requesting the loan for the purchase of wholesale underwear and ojotas.

She is happy for the loan and promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: to buy wholesale underwear and 'ojotas'.

loans.name: Wilder

texts.es: Wilder tiene 27 años de edad, vive solo en una casa arrendada. Tiene 3 años de experiencia brindando el servicio de construcción civil, incursionó en este trabajo, porque años anteriores trabajó como ayudante en esta área y ahora es independiente. Con empeño y dedicación ha logrado mejorar la calidad de su trabajo y eso le ha permitido aumentar la cantidad de clientes, quienes solicitan de sus servicios. En todo este tiempo ha estado implementandose de herramientas necesarias para su trabajo, pero conforme vienen las exigencias de sus clientes, le es necesario tener otro tipo de herramientas para mejorar su servicio y pueda optimizar el tiempo que emplea al realizar un trabajo encomendado. Es la primera vez que esta solicitando un crédito con MFP, se entero de los créditos por medio de una recomendación de un familiar en la cual no dudo en pedir información sobre las condiciones de crédito de las cuales se convenció que es una forma efectiva de concretar un proyecto. Hoy se compromete en ser puntual en sus pagos y demostrar un buen record crediticio. Con este dinero hará la compra de andamios (tablones para armar en baceado de techos de cemento), que es indispensable para el trabajo de construcción.
texts.en:
Wilder is 27 years old and lives alone in a rented house. He has three years of experience providing construction services. Wilder pursued this profession because he previously worked as an assistant for a few years in this trade and now he is independent. Through effort and dedication, he improved the quality of his work which has allowed him to increase the number of customers who request his services. This entire time he has made use of the tools that are necessary for his work. However, as he receives more demands from his customers, Wilder realizes that he needs other types of equipment in order to improve his service and be more efficient with the time he has to work on assigned jobs.

This is the first time he has requested a loan from MFP. The loans were recommended by a relative so Wilder did not hesitate to ask for information about the loan terms. He was convinced that this would be an effective way to complete his project. Today he promises to be prompt with his loan payments and maintain a good credit record. The money will be used to buy scaffolding (temporary platforms used for balancing on top of a cement roof), which is an indispensable tool for him to use in his construction work.

loans.use: to purchase scaffolding.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES UNIDAS”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de San Jeronimo en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra.
