Ines, la socia tiene 64 años de edad, la socia es soltera y tiene 6 hijos, la socia se dedica  a la atención de su tienda de abarrotes, ala socia también se encarga de elaborar chicha blanca y vende en la misma tienda en un rinconcito sobre una mesa, la socia trabaja desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche, la socia vende su chicha blanca a manera de refresco a media mañana y parte de la tarde, la socia requiere el crédito para invertir en la compra de arroz, azúcar, harinas, leche y otros productos para la implementación de sus tienda de abarrotes, la socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, leche en cajas, arroz, azúcar, harinas, fideos entre otros.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ines belongs to the United Women Community Bank. The bank is located in the town of San Jeronimo in Cusco Province. 

She is 64 years old and is single with six children. She works running her small general store. She also makes chicha blanca, a traditional corn-based drink, and sells it in the corner of her store. She works from six in the morning until ten in the evening. She sells her chicha blanca from mid-morning through the afternoon. She will use the loan to purchase rice, sugar, flour, milk, noodles, and other products for her store.

She is grateful for the support offered and pledges to be disciplined in making her payments.

loans.use: purchase staple products like rice, boxed milk, sugar, flour, and noodles for her store

loans.name: Badiya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe "Badiya" est créé le 25 Mars 2001. Le nom signifie Parentée parce que la plupart des membres habitent le même secteur de quartier. L'activité principale des membres est le commerce.
Mme Mame Diarra est la responsable du groupe, elle est debout à droite de la photo avec la main levée et un foulard sur la tête. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle a 15 autres personne en charge.
Mme Mame Diarra est commerçante depuis plus de 10 ans, et elle vend des chaussures, du savon, des tissus teintés, des sacs à main...
Avec ce prêt, cette dame compte élargir son activité afin de satisfaire l'ensemble de sa clientèle.
Les bénéfices sont destinés à prendre bien en charge sa famille, augmenter son épargne et préparer l'avenir de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The 'Badiya' group was created on March 25th, 2001.  The group's name means 'Connections' because most of its members live in the same neighborhood.  The main business activity of the group's members is commerce.

Mame Diarra is the leader of the group.  She is standing on the right of the photo with her hand raised and is wearing a headscarf.  She is married and has three children.  She is responsible for 15 other people.

Mame Diasse has been a retailer for more than ten years.  She sells shoes, soap, dyed fabrics, purses (handbags)...  With her loan, this lady plans to expand her business so that she can satisfy her customers.  Her profits will be used to take good care of her family, increase her savings and prepare for her children's future.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products to sell

loans.name: Celeste

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, provincia de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 8 filhos dos quais todos maiores de idade. Não teve oportunidade de estudar devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais 4 netos que vivem com ela. 

Nunca saiu da sua terra natal, é agricultora numa bananalândia ha mais de 9 anos e tem um salario de 2.100.00mt, por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigas que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu quarto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material construção (ferro, chapas, cimento, pedra, e outros.) para dar continuidade a sua obra.Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 10.000.00mt, e 10.000.00mt,ambos para a sua obra.
Pretende solicitar mais valor para concluir a sua casa e oferecer conforto a sua familia, irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
She was born in the district of Namaacha, province of Maputo, southern Mozambique. She is single and has eight children, all of them adults. She didn't have the opportunity to study for lack of financial conditions. She lives with her family in a house she owns. She also supports four grandchildren who live with her.
She has never left her homeland. She has worked as a farmer for Bananalândia (a banana producer company) for over nine years and earns a salary of 2.100mt a month. She uses it to pay for home expenses and saves part of it in her bank account.
She has never had loans in other banks. She first heard of Hluvuku through friends who are also clients of this institution. This is her fourth loan with Hluvuku. It is for 10.000mt, which she intends to use to purchase construction supplies (iron, metal sheets, cement, stone, etc.) so that she can keep building. The first loans were for 10.000mt and 10.000mt, both to build her house.
She intends to request more money in order to finish up her house and offer more comfort to her family. She will request other loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (iron, metal sheets, cement, stone, etc.).

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 27 year-old man.   He is an internet service provider.  He wants to expand his work and purchase more routers to include more customers in his service. He needs to take a loan of $2,000 from FATEN.  When Mohammad gets the loan, he will be able to purchase more routers and include more customers in his service.  This will enable him to improve his income positively and live in better conditions. Mohammad is photographed in FATEN branch.

loans.use: To purchase more routers.

loans.name: Sarantuya

texts.en: Sarantuya is 41 years old and lives with her mother and daughter in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar dictrict, the capital of Mongolia. Her mother helps with her business and her daughter is a student. She has a part-time job in a local company, and she runs a grocery shop business. Now that winter is approaching, she saw a business opportunity to sell firewood in her shop. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "I am the only one in my family with the income, so I have to work [as] hard as possible in order to support them." She is requesting 2,500,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) to buy firewood and some products for her small shop.

loans.use: To buy firewood and some products for her small shop.

loans.name: Yitza Margarita

texts.es: Yitza Margarita ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. Siempre le ha gustado luchar para sacar a su familia adelante, ella tiene un hijo bajo su cargo. Vende sus productos de manera ambulante sus clientes le solicitan variedad en sus productos. Cuenta con una clientela establecida, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá solventar sus necesidades de su casa. Ella se ha dado cuenta que su negocio va creciendo favorablemente en el transcurso de los días. Desea seguir ampliando su negocio con la compra de más mercadería. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de polvos, cremas, tratamientos, ropa interior, lápiz labial y pintura de uñas.
texts.en: Yitza Margarita's business is selling cosmetics.  She has always enjoyed working hard to get her family ahead in life.  She has one son in her care.  Yitza sells her products as an itinerant vendor.  Her customers request variety in her products.  She has an established customer base and will use the income she makes to cover her household needs.  She has realized that her business is growing favorably.  She would like to continue expanding her business by purchasing more merchandise.  She is requesting this loan to buy powders, creams, treatments, underwear, lipsticks and nail polish.

loans.use: to buy powders, creams, treatments, underwear, lipsticks and nail polish

loans.name: Zylal

texts.ru: Зылал 59 лет, вдова и имеет одного сына.  В поисках источника существования для своей семьи, в 1998 года, Зылал начала свой бизнес в откорме и перепродаже скота.  На сегодняшний день хозяйство, начатое с суммы в 19,000 сом (KGS), приносит около 13,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных  и мясных продуктов.   В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Зылал обратилась в компанию «Бай - Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков. Доходы от кредита Зылал планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья домашнего скота.
texts.en: Zylal is 59 years old, a widow and has one son.  In search of a source of survival for her family, Zylal started her own business of fattening up and reselling livestock in 1998.  Today her business, which was started with a sum of 19,000 som (KGS), brings in about 13,000 som (KGS) per month from the sales of dairy and meat products.  In order to further increase her livestock quantity, Zylal requested a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase bulls.  She plans to invest the profits from this loan into further increasing livestock headcount.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is a married woman with two children. Juvy is 34 years old and she resides in Viray Molicay, Ozamis City, Philippines. 

To earn a living, Juvy plants and harvests bananas for sale.  Sh has been in this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 7,000 PHP. 

She has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Juvy has been a member of GDMPC for almost two years. In the future, she hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Joseline

texts.en: Joseline is 25 years old and married with one child. She and her husband work together in a business selling cattle and goats, which they have been running for the period of one year. She has requested the loan to buy more cattle and goats to sell. With the profits from the business, she plans to renovate the house. She would like to expand the business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more cattle to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 31 years old, married to George, and they have two children.

She has been operating a beauty shop selling hand and body lotions, hair treatment chemicals, and make-up for the last two years from which she earns a monthly income of Kes 10,000. She is applying for her first loan with KADET Ltd of Kes 15,000 to buy beauty products; lotions, hair treatment chemicals and make-up. With the anticipated profits she will save for future expansion. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

Her hopes and dreams are to open up a large beauty shop outlet and to employ people in her business.

loans.use: To buy hand and body lotions, hair chemicals, and make-up for resale.

loans.name: Sokheng's Group

texts.en:
Sokheng, a citizen from Bovel district of Battambang province, is 47 years old and married. She is a mother of four children. She earns a living via rice farming and her paid working job. 

This is the first loan for Sokheng with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Now, she leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, to pay for labor costs, and to buy seedlings. She hopes that she can gain a good yield, better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, to pay for labor costs, and to buy seedlings.

loans.name: Maria Leocadia

texts.es: Doña Maria tiene 56 años de edad, ella no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar ya que sus padres no tenían los recursos económicos necesarios para apoyarle. Se casó a temprana edad y junto a su esposo procreo 7 hijos. Sus hijos mayores están casados solo le acompaña 2, una de 16 años quien le apoya en la casa en los diferentes quehaceres y en el campo cuando es tiempo de corte de café y el varón de 20 quien se involucra junto a su padre en el campo para llevar a cabo las diferentes actividades a realizar. Su padre le heredo el terreno que en familia trabajan teniendo una experiencia de trabajar en lo propio de doce años. El terreno está a una distancia aproximada de un kilómetro y medio al cual se trasladan caminando ya que no cuentan con un medio de transporte diferente. Su meta en esta temporada que su propiedad sea productiva, provechosa y de los frutos esperados por el esfuerzo, sacrificio y dedicación evitando mediante la compra de abono, foliares, alto 100, plaguicidas entre otros la contaminación y deterioro de la plantación por lo cual espera ser apoyada por los diferentes inversionistas en KIVA y COMIXMUL para poder salir adelante.

loans.use: para compra de insumos agricolas para asistir sus cultivos de café y dar la protección que requieren

loans.name: Fouzia

texts.en:
Fouzia  is 37-years old married woman, mother of a children. She is living happily with her family in the area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan.
Her husband owns a marble factory in the market and for investment in the his factory his wife Fouzia applied for the loan amount.Her husband invests his savings and profit in his current business but now he does not have enough amounts to establish his business.
For this purpose he wants financially help from Kiva, so that is why his wife Fouzia contacted with the field partner BRAC Pakistan, who is the medium among the Kiva and the borrowers.
Fouzia is much delighted and thankful to the Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To invest in her husband's marble factory.

loans.name: Petko

texts.en: Petko T. is 46 years old. He has high school education. Many years he has worked as a driver in different taxi companies in Silistra town. His wife - Adelina Todorova, is an interpreter in Kamashit Company – Silistra. They have a son that lives and studies in Sofia. In 1992 Petko T. set up his own company “Pierita”, bought a car on leasing and started his own business. Now the company works with two cars and with its activity provides for the living of the family.

loans.use: Basic repair of automobiles

loans.name: Salum

texts.en:
Salum operates a metal scraper business. The main materials he deals with are aluminium and iron scrapers. He collects these used metals from his suppliers in different streets. His suppliers collect scrapers for these metals, clean and store them in established stores.

Salum, on a weekly basis, hires a car and goes to his suppliers' stores and collects the scraper materials. He sells these scrapers to industries that recycle these metals.

Business was not good for the past six months due to electricity problem facing the country, but recently the power supply has returned to normal. More scrapers are needed by the industries. Salum needs a working capital to buy more scrapers from his suppliers. He needs USD1000 to strengthen his working capital.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Ruth Esmeralda

texts.en:
Hello, my name is Ruth Esmeralda, and I am a businessperson. My business is located on the plaza in my city. I have several years' experience dedicating myself to this type of activity, which generates income to pay for my family's expenses and also commitments with my suppliers. Thanks to this business, my children are getting ahead, since my husband died and I am on my own. My future plan is to have a more secure location.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Hola mi nombre es Ruth Esmeralda, soy comerciante, tengo un negocio ubicado en la plaza de mi ciudad, cuento con varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingreso para los gasts de mi familia y demas compromisos con los proveedores, gracias a este negocio he sacado adelante a mis hijos, ya que mi esposo se murio y quede sola. mis planes futuros es poder tener un local mas seguro.

loans.use: To buy men's pants, boys' shirts, underclothes, mosquito nets, and ladies' blouses.

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru:
Dilbar I. is 29 years old, single and has a secondary-school education. For the last 15 years, she has supported herself with the help of her mother by selling food products. Because her father is disabled, she and her mother are the family's sole means of support.

Dilbar has been receiving credit from MLF MicroInvest since 2002. Back then her business was worth only $80. After receiving credit, she increased her selection of food products and raised the net worth of her business by $1,400. She would like to continue to expand, and has come to us for a new loan of $1,150 to improve her place of business and open up a second shop in a new location.

Translated from Russian by Sabina H., Kiva Volunteer.

Исоходжаева Дилбар – 29лет. Не замужем, образование среднее. Занимается реализацией продуктов питания, уже 15лет. Мать тоже торгует на базаре. Поскольку отец инвалид, она помогает своей матери в обеспечении семьи. С 2002 года она кредитуется в «Микронвест». Тогда ее активы составляли 80$. После получения кредита она расширила ассортимент и увеличила товарооборот на 1400$. В будущем планирует улучшить место деятельности и открыть еще одну торговую точку.

loans.use: Improve current business and open another location

loans.name: Justa Betty

texts.es:
Betty studied beauty a few years ago and before doing this she sold household items form a small room which she fitted out to become a beauty salon in the 1990s. This is her vocation so she decided to go ahead with the shop, even though it was very different from what she was doing before. She has 4 kids, one of them is at university and the others are at school. In order to meet household costs Betty relies on her husband who is a motorbike-taxi driver for a security firm.

She started her beauty salon in 1994 with only 2 mirrors and plastic chairs, but thanks to the hard work her and her family put in, it grew and became notable in the community and with her clients. She decided that she would not give up until she had a complete beauty salon. She now needs a loan of $500 which she will repay in 6 months so that she can enlarge her salon, buying tools so that she can work effectively, and beauty creams for deep down cleaning for her clients that need it.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Betty estudió cosmetología hace varios años y mucho antes de dedicarse a esta actividad trabajaba en la venta de abarrotes en el espacio que ahora acondicionó para su salón de belleza allá por lo años 90´, su vocación por esta actividad hizo que sin meditarlo una y otra vez se decidiera a dar un giro total a la labor que había estado desempañando en ese entonces.Ella es madre de 4 hijos, uno de ellos estudia en la universidad y los demás están en el colegio y para solventar los gastos de su hogar, Betty, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que presta servicios de mototaxi a su comunidad y su vez en una empresa de seguridad.Comenzó por el año 94 en forma precaria sus servicios en el salón de belleza, con tan sólo dos espejos y unas sillas de plástico, conforme el esfuerzo y empeño constante se manifestaban en la familia el negocio cobraba más notoriedad y dinamismo y fue creciendo paulatinamente llegando a ocupar un puesto muy especial en cada uno de sus clientes y ella manifiesta que su esfuerzo y dedicación no se detendrán hasta tener un centro de estética completo.Actualmente necesita un capital de 500 dólares financiados en 6 meses para ampliar su salón de belleza, comprar herramientas para desarrollar su trabajo eficazmente y cremas de belleza para una limpieza integral para las clientas que lo requieran.

loans.use: To buy beauty products to make her small shop one of the best stocked/La compra  de accesorios y productos de belleza harán de su humilde local uno de los más y mejores implementados.

loans.name: Salman

texts.en: Salman (his brother is pictured) has been in this business for five years. He was born in 1962, is married, and has three children. He lives in the Khacmaz region, in the Yeni-Hayat settlement. He needs a loan of $825 to buy fertilizer and pesticides for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina has a small business selling grocery items at one of the busy markets in Kamenka-Dneprovskaya, Ukraine. Her business was initially started by Irina’s mother who passed it on to Irina and helped her get established on her own. This has been a good business for Irina to be in as there is always demand for food products. Irina is divorced and is raising a thirteen-year-old daughter.

Irina has requested a loan of $1000 to help open a new sales location that will be more comfortable and will hopefully lead to higher sales and profits. Irina has been a good loan client with Nadiya Ukraine in the past. We are happy for this opportunity to help Irina improve her business and invest in its future.

loans.use: Open new sales location

loans.name: Mamntambo

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 49 year-old Mamntambo M.. She is married with two children, ages 12 and 15, and has one other dependent, who is her nephew. In 2003 Mamntambo established a maize business. Mamntambo has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a loan of $175 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA: SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of maize in bulk.

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en: Mr. Ernest O. is 34 years old and married with 3 children. He lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. He has been in the business of selling pharmaceutical drugs since 1997. He needs the loan amount of $275 to purchase more drugs for sale.

loans.use: To purchase more drugs for sale

loans.name: Moun

texts.en: Mrs. Moun M., 39, works weaving  palm leaf and makes on average $2 a day. Her husband supplements the household work as a logger, earning around $2 a day. They have six children and 4 of them are students and the other two are too young to attend school. This couple needs to use this loan to purchase wood to strengthen their house. (She is pictured with her child and the firewood which is collected by her husband)

loans.use: This couple needs to use this loan to purchase wood to strengthen their house.

loans.name: Mirjana

texts.en:
Mirjana was born in 1986 and she is not married. Her additional monthly income is KM 300, 00.

Her previous loan was for 1200, 00KM. Mirjana wants to use the current loan of KM 1200, 00 to buy additional equipment for her computer. She wants to improve her writing of graduation and seminar papers and to expand her bookkeeping and other computer-related work.

loans.use: For buying additional equipment for the computer.

loans.name: Yem

texts.en: Mrs. Yem S. is farmer and soup seller in Rong Village in Kampong Speu Province. Her soup selling business is facing some problems because the prices of ingredients have increased. Additionally, on her plantation, Mrs. Yem S. has insufficient animals to plough her rice field. She has therefore asked for a loan to buy cows to work in the field. Mrs. Yem S. is 40 and married with four children, all of whom are attending school. Her husband, Mr. Man Chin, is a subsistence farmer. Her husband is on the left of the picture.

loans.use: to buy cows to work in the field in order to cultivate a rice plantation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of beauty products to retail in her community.

loans.name: Mit

texts.en:
Mit S. L., 24, sells beef in the local food market, while her husband, Rem Than, raises and sells cattle. They live in Kampong Cham with their young child who attends the local school.

Together her family makes about US $10 of income each day, and they believe that there is a high customer demand and room for their businesses to expand. Mit S. L. has asked for a loan of US $1000 to purchase more cows to expand her husband’s business and increase her family’s income. She believes this investment will help her family in the long-term as well, and it can improve her standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase more cows to resell

loans.name: Thi Hong's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs N. Thi Hong (ID Number 13010043), 43 years old, sells confectionery and fruits at home. Her husband works as a carpenter, thus her family's daily income is stable at 150,000VND (about 10USD). Mrs. Hong joined the Fund so as to expand her inventory for her business. To her, it is very convenient to repay on an installment basis, so this time she would like to borrow 3,186,000VND to invest in her business. Her group also consists of:
  • Mrs. V. Thi Ty (ID Number 13010044), borrows 3,186,000VND to sell general goods.
  • Mrs. C. Thi Hoan (ID Number 13010045), borrows 3,186,000VND to sell general goods.
  • Mrs. Luu Thi Thom (ID Number 13010046), borrows 3,186,000VND to sell construction supplies.
  • Mrs. V. Thi Hang (ID Number 13010047), borrows 2,006,000VND to raise livestock.
  • Mrs. V. Thi Bac (ID Number 13010048), borrows 3,186,000VND to raise livestock and do business.
  • The total amount requested is 1,100.00USD.

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

    Chị Nguyễn thi Hồng năm nay 43 tuổi MS 13010043, hiện tại chị Hồng kinh doanh bánh kẹo, hoa quả tại nhà. Còn chồng chị làm nghề thợ mộc. Nên mức thu nhập cũng khá ổn định từ 150.000 VND/ ngày. Chị tham gia vay vốn của chương trình để thêm vốn vào hoạt động kinh doanh của gia đình, đồng thời Chị thấy hình thức vay trả rất thuận tiện, nên lần này Chị đăng ký vay ở mức 3.186.000 VND lấy vốn kinh doanh,các thành viên trong nhóm Chị :

  • chi Vũ thị Tý MS 13010044 đăng ký vay mức 3.186.000VND để buôn bán
  • chị C. thị Hoàn MS 13010045 vay mức 3.186.000 VND để đi chợ
  • chị L. thị Thơm MS13010046 vay mức 3.186.000 VND để kinh doanh vật liệu xây dựng
  • chị Vũ thị Hằng MS 13010047 vay mức 2.006.000 VND để chăn nuôi
  • chị Vũ thị Bắc MS 13010048 vay mức 3.186.000 VND về chăn nuôi và kinh doanh

loans.use: Selling fruits and retailing

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 42 años, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos.   Se dedica a la negocio de venta la de abarrotes, con el motivo de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar, hace 10 años abrió esta tienda en su casa, la cual se convirtió en una actividad importante para su familia.El estar íntegramente en su tienda le ayuda a poder relacionarse con sus vecinos y clientes  quienes concurren a su bodega frecuentemente, siendo esto lo que le agrada, además que está pendientes de sus  hijos, sin embargo los precios elevados de los productos está perjudicando  su negocio y desea tener la capacidad de enfrentar estos altos costos.
Maria tiene en sus hijos, el mejor motor de su negocio, ya que desea ofrecerles una adecuada educación de calidad para su porvenir.
Ahora, desea invertir en la compra de mercadería que aumente la cantidad de productos que satisfagan las necesidades de sus clientes y los suyos propios.
texts.en:
Maria is 42 years old and leaves with her husband and 3 children. She has a grocery store to help her husband to pay for household expenses, she opened the store 10 years ago and it turned out to be a very important activity for her family. Working at the store helps her connect with her neighbors and clients who go to her store frequently, while she also takes care of her children, but the high prices had decreased her profits and wants to be able to deal with high costs. Maria’s greatest motivation is her children, because she wants to offer them a good education for their future. Now she wants to invest buying products to increase their number and selection to satisfy her clients and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the number and selection of products to satisfy her clients

loans.name: Farrux

texts.en:
Farrux X. is a 44-year-old barber. He is married and has four children. He started his business in 1985 when he saved some money and opened his barber's shop. During long years of work, he has gained a reputation as an experienced and well-known barber in his region.

He has very flexible prices which attracts clients to his shop. During a day, Farrux has at least 20-25 clients, which brings him good income and makes him able to cover his family's needs. But to expand his business, he needs more funds and for this purpose he has applied for 1200 USD. He says that he has not done any repairs since he first opened his barber shop. Let's do our best to help him.

loans.use: To repair his barber shop

loans.name: Amonjon

texts.en: Amonjon rents a heavy truck and he buys consumer and grocery products from one city and sells them in another city wholesale. But the main way he earns money is by transporting goods for clients. He isn’t married yet and lives with his parents. and so he supports his family. He wants to take loan to buy more goods for sale and with more profit he wishes to purchase his own truck.

loans.use: To expand his business and purchase a truck.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Delfina P. L. mi actividad principal es el servicio de cortes de pelo, peinados, cortes de uñas para damas, tambien vendo productos para cabello como ser shampoo, acondicionador, gel, tintes, gotas de todo tipo de producto para cabello de dama, mi negocio se llama Salon de Belleza MIXE, este negocio me permite generar ingresos monetarios para cubrir con los gastos de mi hogar, tengo pocos años de dedicarme a este negocio, creo que he sido buena administradora, pero en estos momentos necesito comprar materiales como ser tijeras, maquinas electricas de cortar pelo, aceite, jabones, etc, por eso es que estoy solicitando un credito para poder dar una mejor atencion a mis clientes. soy madre de 4 hijos.
texts.en:
Hi! My name is Delfina P. L. and I am a hairdresser. I cut and style hair, do ladies' manicures as well as sell hair products such as shampoo, conditioner, gel, hair colour, all sorts of hair products for ladies. My business is called MIXE Beauty Salon. The income from my salon allows me to pay my household expenses. Although I have not been in this business very long, I believe I've managed my salon well. I now need to buy tools such as scissors, electric razors, oil, soap, etc. and this is why I am asking you for a loan, so that I can give my clients better service. I am the mother of 4 children.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products.

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en: Mrs. Sorn S., 39, raises pigs to sell, and lives in Pursat Province. She can sell the pigs for slaughter in four or five months. Her husband is employed as a driver from Phnom Penh. She has four children, all of whom live in the family home. To increase the income for the family, S. would like to request a loan to purchase more piglets to raise and she would use the remaining money to purchase groceries for sale.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets to raise and purchase groceries for sale

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama A. is forty years old and lives with her family in Agogo. She is married and the mother with four children. Currently, three are in school, and the first born, is working with a construction firm. She has been a food vendor for ten years in the Agogo community school. She sells ‘ampesi’ and rice with stew. This food is purchased mostly by the school children during their break time. Ampesi is cooked and enjoyed with any kind of stew. In addition to this, she also prepares pastries and supplies them to the shops at the community market. 

Ama wants the loan to buy more bags of raw materials like rice, meat, charcoal, flour, margarine and others supplies. She is convinced that there will be a price hike and would like this loan to help her increase her stock. She would then have sufficient supplies to prepare food for her customers. This would enable her to save more towards her childrens education. Ama says she would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy food stuffs like yam, plantain, bags of rice, meat, fish, spices, charcoal, flour, margarine etc.

loans.name: Reyna Maria

texts.es: Reyna María Martínez R. tiene 32 años, está casada, y tiene tres hijos. El propósito para su negocio es que su negocio se mantenga activo. La actividad económica a la que Doña Reyna se dedica es el destace de cerdo. Doña Reyna inició este negocio hace cuatro años, y comenzó con dinero propio, además poseía la responsabilidad de mantener a su familia. Por lo que recorría las diferentes comarcas en busca del mejor cerdo para ofrecer a sus clientes calidad. Doña Reyna nunca ha dejado de soñar y como uno de sus sueños serían de obtener otra fuente de ingresos para mantener a su familia. El financiamiento de Doña Reyna es de C$ 4.000 córdobas a un plazo de 12 meses.
texts.en:
Reyna María Martínez R. is a 32-year-old married mother with three children. Her goal is to keep her business active. Ms. Reyna butchers pork for a living. She started this business 4 years ago with her own money. She was also responsible for supporting her family, which is why she traveled to several regions in search of the best pork so that she could offer her customers high quality products. Ms. Reyna has never stopped dreaming, and one of those dreams is to acquire another source of income to support her family. Ms. Reyna is requesting a loan for C$ 4,000.00 Nicaraguan Cordobas, which will be repaid in 12 monthly installments.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Marian

texts.en: Marian sells provisions, drinks and foodstuffs. She hopes to get a loan for the amount of N80,000 to purchase more provisions, drinks and foodstuffs to sell. She is 39 years old and married with 5 children. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions, drinks and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Camila Lyli

texts.es: Doña Camila, reside en el barrio Villa Venezuela, tiene 56 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos mayores y casados, su negocio  es la venta de ropa, electrodomésticos y perfumes, lleva muchos años en este comercio el cual inicio a mucho esfuerzo vendiendo en los departamento a kilómetros de su hogar para poder alimentar a su familia. La señora Camila tiene siete ciclo trabajando en Afodenic que ha beneficiado a su familia a su desempeño, al comercio, y prosperacion, con este crédito quiere comprar ropa, perfumes y unos electrodoméstico que son encargo, ella vende al contado y al crédito dando oportunidad como se la brindan a ella a sus clientes. Sus planes a futuro es crecer en ventas como en la captación de clientes para apoyar siempre a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Camila lives in the Villa Venezuela neighborhood, is 56 years old, and has three grown and married children. Her business is the sale of clothing, home electronics and perfumes. She has been in this business for many years, and started with much effort selling in departments kilometers away from home in order to be able to sustain her family. Camila has worked with Afodenic through seven loan cycles, and it has benefited her family, her personal performance, her business, and her prosperity. With this loan, she hopes to buy clothing, perfumes and some home electronics which are in demand. She sells for both cash and credit, giving her customers the same opportunities she is given. Her plan for the future is to increase sales and bring in new customers to keep supporting her children.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing, perfumes and other products to offer her customers

loans.name: Qudratullo

texts.ru: Давлатшоев Кудратулло житель Кумсангирского района . Женат и имеет двоих детей. Возраст 33 года.Занимается земледелием и семью обеспечивает благодоря этому бизнесу. Он сеет злаки , которые потом реализует на рынке. Этим бизнесом он заниается уже 9 лет. Кредит планирует получить для того,чтобы закупить семена и удобрения для посева.
texts.en:
Qudratullo D. is a resident of the Qumsangir region. He is married and has two children. He is 33 years old. Qudratullo is a farmer and provides for his family thanks to this business. He plants cereals which he then sells at the market. He has been in this business for 9 years now. He plans to get a loan in order to purchase seeds and fertilizer for planting.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds and feritilizer

loans.name: Cruz Delia

texts.es:
La señora Cruz L. se siente muy satisfecha de haber iniciado a reconstruir su casa de habitación ya que estaba en malas condiciones y al haber iniciado ha ido por procesos y hoy en día requiere poner un techo nuevo antes de que el invierno entre y caigan las lluvias.

Por este motivo es que la señora Cruz ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción y así salir adelanten en el desarrollo de su familia que tanto ama.
texts.en:
Ms. Cruz L. is very happy to have again started rebuilding her home that has been in bad shape. They have been doing it in bits and now need a new roof before winter comes and the rains start to fall. This is why Ms. Cruz has come to Ceprodel to ask for a loan. She wants to buy construction materials and continue helping her family, who she loves so much, to advance.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de materiales de construcción

loans.name: Mukaddam

texts.ru: Мукдам Исобоева 1971 года рождения , замужем имеет 4 детей.  Окончила 9 классов , родители  были против того что бы она училась в университете. Через некоторое время вышла замуж. Семья росла, она вынуждена была выйти на рынок.  В Микроинвест обратилась из-за не хватки собственных средств на  расширение бизнеса. Торгует на рынке детской одеждой около 7 лет. Она планирует расширить свой ассортимент товара.
texts.en:
Mukaddam I. was born in 1971; she is married and has 4 children. She finished 9 grades; her parents were opposed to her studying at university. After some time she got married. Her family grew and she was forced to go to work at the market. Mukaddam turned to MicroInvest because she did not have enough personal resources to expand her business. She has been selling children’s clothing at the market for about 7 years. She plans to expand her product assortment.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase product assortment

loans.name: Babatunde

texts.en: Babatunde is 31 years old and married with a child. He has a shop where he sells building materials like paints, etc. He is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more building materials to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials to sell.

loans.name: Gloria Dolores

texts.es: La Señora Gloria Dolores Berríos Juárez tiene la edad de 61 años, es una mujer casada. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica es la venta de comida. Hace mas de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio, Gloria inicio este negocio por la necesidad de proporciónale a sus hijos la alimento diario, ella comenzó estableciendo una pequeña mesa en las afueras de su vivienda, y comenzó ofreciendo al publico gallo pinto, huevos, tajadas entre otras cosas Gloria no tenia el capital suficiente para ofrecer mas comida a sus clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de productos como arroz, aceite, verduras, queso, frijoles y huevos. El deseo de Gloria es mejorar su vivienda y manager activo su negocio.
texts.en:
Gloria Dolores Berríos Juárez, 61, is married and has two children. For over ten years she has been selling food. Gloria started this business because she needed to feed her children. She started by setting up a small table outside of her home. She started selling gallo pinto (red beans and rice), beans, eggs, and tajadas (fried plantain slices) among other things. Gloria did not have enough money to offer her customers more food than that. The loan she is asking for is for working capital to buy products like rice, oil, vegetables, cheese, beans, and eggs. Gloria’s wish is to improve her home and keep her business active.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a native of Tambo Real, a rural community located in the Zurite district of Anta, approximately an hour and a half from the city of Cusco. She is thirty-three years old and married with two children.  Martha raises livestock and sells milk in her town and local markets. She also raises guinea pigs, which are a common dish in Perú.

Martha plans to use the loan for two purposes. First, she will use the loan to pay for her husband to receive medical treatment for a problem he has with his eyesight. She hopes to be able to buy new glasses for him as well. She will also continue to invest in her livestock, as milk sales provide a reliable source of income. 

Martha is a member of the Real Solidarity Bank, made up of fourteen members who are in their second loan cycle with Arariwa.  They are collectively committed to repaying the loan on time, and are also collaborating in a group savings account that serves as emergency funds for their members should anyone default.

loans.use: For medical treatment and as capital for milk business

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Sinceridad Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Sinceridad. Tiene 3 integrantes por lo que cada una de ellas realiza diferentes actividades económicas. En el caso de Lilliam Isidora Pérez R. es casada tiene 58 años y 4 hijos a su cargo. Su actividad económica es la venta de ropa de manera ambulante. A pesar de edad es una de las mujeres más emprendedoras y dinámicas del grupo.  Su otro socia Aida del Rosario Pérez R. tiene 53 años. Su actividad económica es una tienda de ropa. Ella dio inicio a su negocio con mucho sacrificio y debido a su muy buena administración ha logrado salir adelante con su negocio pues es una mujer muy responsable. Rosa Miriam Pérez R. tiene 56 años. Ellas se han unido con el fin de salir adelante, a pesar de las edades son personas, muy luchadoras y trabajadoras. Por lo que el motivo del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa. El sueño de las 3 socias es ayudar a sus familias y además que sus hijos aprendan de sus negocios para que esto les ayude a salir adelante para el día de mañana.
texts.en:
The group "Solidario Sinceridad" (Solidarity and Sincerity) has three members, each of whom is involved in different economic activities. Lilliam Isidora Pérez L. is married, 58 years old, and has four children in her care. She sells clothing door-to-door. In spite of her age, she is one of the most entrepreneurial and dynamic women in the group. Another group member is Aida del Rosario Pérez R., who is 53 years old. She has a clothing store. She sacrificed a lot to start this business, and because of her good management she has been successful, and she is a very responsible woman. Rosa Miriam Pérez R. is 56 years old. These women have united with the goal of succeeding. In spite of their ages, they are hard-working, determined women. The purpose of their loan is for capital to buy clothing. The dream of these three women is to help their families, and also for their children to learn about business because this will help them succeed in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes O. is from the city of Dipolog. She is married, 31 years old, and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Agnes owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling cosmetic products in the local community. Agnes has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Agnes joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,500 PHP from PMPC. Agnes is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP. She wants her family to have their own appliances, and this loan will be used for a full payment on their installed TV and refrigerator. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Agnes from PMPC.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to fully pay for an installed TV and refrigerator

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 50 year old man who lives in Beirut, capital of Lebanon with his wife and their five children. Ali has been selling accessories for four years. He sells perfumes, home decoration, home products, toys etc.... He requested a loan of 1500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop. This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan. 
Ali is special in his work because of his good reputation. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When Ali first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. He decided on doing his business because he likes his work. In the future, he plans on expanding his work.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Gabriela Leonor

texts.es:
Gabriela es una socia  colaboradora y dinámica, tiene 22 años de edad, vive con sus padres, y se dedica a la venta de jugos, caldo de gallina y Juanes (arroz envuelto en hojas) ella trabaja junto a su mamá en este negocio, desde hace dos años, es parte del Banco Comunal “Nuestra Señora de la Esperanza” desde hace un año.  Empezó con un préstamo de 300 soles que invirtió en la compra de gaseosas, platos, manteles y vasos.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1200 soles comprará productos al por mayor como arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, fideos, etc para su negocio. La meta de Gabriela es poder ampliar e implementar su negocio y seguir apoyando a sus padres.

loans.use: comprará productos al por mayor: arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, fideos, etc

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: K., 49, is a married man and the father of three teenage children. One of his daughters is working in garment factory, while other two are students. K. currently works in construction; he is also hired by people to build their house. His wife stays at home to be responsible for a daily routine. She also cultivates a rice crop. K. is taking out his loan to buy a cow which enable him allow to his wife for using on the farm field. K.'s wife is shown in the picture above.

loans.use: To buy a cow which enable him allow to his wife for using on the farm field

loans.name: Merry Chill

texts.en:
Merry Chill C. lives in the village of Estaka. She is 32 years old, married, has four school-aged children and makes a living providing motor cab services to people who live in her area. She has been in this business for more than one year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from her work.

In 2006, Merry Chill joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid eight previous loans from PMPC, and has requested a new loan of 11,000 PHP to repair her vehicle. She plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to pay for the education of her children. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair her cab

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet E.'s main source of income comes from selling herbal food supplements in her community. She is 44 years old, married and has three school-age children. They are from the village of Bagontaas, Valencia City. Juliet has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Juliet joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Juliet is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Freddie

texts.en:
59-year-old Freddie works hard for his family. He is a rice farmer and loves spending time at his farm. He makes sure his land is in good condition so his crops are able to grow healthy.

In need of additional capital, Freddie joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to obtain its financial services. He applied for a loan of Php 12,000 which he will use to buy certified seeds, fertilizers and other inputs needed at his farm. Receiving this loan will be truly helpful to Freddie’s farming.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema is a 41 year married with seven children aged 15 and 19 years.  None of her children goes to school because she couldn’t raise school fees. She resides and owns a four roomed house where she is staying with six people. Rehema takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity and no piped water and gets three meals a day.  She incurs transport costs to and from buying her fresh food staffs like sacks of bananas, sweet potatoes cassava, onions and tomatoes. Rehema has a stall selling fresh foods in Nakulabye. She works in a semi urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala  She works seven days a week .She receives an average of 20 customers a day and sells to all categories of people both on retail and wholesale  Her greatest monthly expenses include feeding the family, school fees for her children and monthly market dues. Her major business challenges are seasonality and rainy season which hinders her to reach her customers. She has been in this business for ten years and with MCDT for five years servicing her tenth loan, working with the same group mates. Dorothy joined MCDT because it was near her home and was working with poor women. She wants to use this loan to buy more bunches of banana sacks of cassava boxes of tomatoes ,onions . She wants to see her business   grower bigger and start selling on whole sale only.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of bananas,cassavaand toamatoes

loans.name: Luz Y Vida Group

texts.es: El grupo "Luz y vida" esta representada por la señora María Elvira y conformada por 21 miembros que ingresan a un primer ciclo dentro de la institución demostrando en sus reuniones previas mucho compañerismo y ganas de trabajar para salir adelante. Cada una de las socias se dedican a diferentes actividades comerciales como la venta de comida, pan, empanadas, abarrotes en tiendas comerciales, repuestos para motos, refrescos, hamacas y también a prestar servicios como portería, transporte en moto taxis y empleos en general. Las socias están concientes que lo que realmente hace la diferenta entre un negocio y otro es el trato que se brinda a los clientes para que se hagan fieles a los productos ofrecidos por las socias es por esto que no tienen mucha competencia en su mercado laboral. El destino del nuevo financiamiento es para la adquisición de mercadería, insumos y herramientas que les ayude a generar mejores ingresos para poder darles a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida. En cuanto a su experiencia las socias cuentan con experiencia en instituciones similares a la fundación Agrocapital por lo que tienen la capacidad para administrar los fondos otorgados para hacer crecer sus negocios y mejorar cada día mas sus ingresos ya que de ello depende el bienestar de sus familias.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Elvira represents the “Luz y vida” group which has 21 members. They are beginning the first loan cycle with the institution and have shown a lot of friendship and desire to work and get ahead in their prior meetings. Each one of the group members works at a different sales job such as selling food, bread, snacks, groceries in stores, spare parts for motorbikes, soft drinks, hammocks, and also in services such as doorman, transportation by motorbike taxis and general jobs. The group members are aware of what really makes the difference between one business and another, the treatment given to the customers so that they become faithful to the products offered by the group members. This is why they don’t have much competition in their job market. The purpose of the new financing is to acquire goods, supplies and tools that will help them generate better incomes in order to be able to give their families a better quality of life. As for experience, the group members have experience at institutions similar to the Agrocapital foundation. Therefore, they have the capacity to administer the funds granted to them, to grow their businesses and improve their income more each day since the well-being of their families depends on it.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Produce and sell coconut oil; stockpile corn

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine V., 24, is a rice farmer. Her husband works in a bakery and was assigned to delivery. The income she makes from her farm is really helpful in ensuring the supply of food for their family. She really would like to grow her harvest but needs a small amount of money to buy all the farming necessities like fertilizers and farm supplies. She would like to apply for a loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos from Community Economic Ventures, Inc., a Kiva partner. The loan will mean growing her harvest.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
Juana A. es propietaria de su propio negocio de pulpería atendido por ella misma en el mercado central de Chinandega donde a diario vende sus productos con el propósito de obtener sus ingresos para el sustento de su hogar.
La señora Juana A. está solicitando el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de los productos tales como arroz, frijoles, productos descartables como vasos, platos, cubiertos, entre otros. Ella espera que se le brinde el crédito y así continuar abasteciendo a sus clientes en su localidad.
texts.en:
Juana A. owns a grocery store, that she tends to daily herself, in Chinandega's central market where she sells her products to earn income for her family's support. Juana A. is requesting funding to buy stock items like: rice, beans, disposable items like drinking glasses, plates, cutlery, etc. She hopes that the loan will be granted so that she can continue to supply her locality's customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Imane

texts.en: Imane has worked as a home-based hairdresser for the past 15 years. She receives clients at her home, where she has prepared a special room for this purpose and she is well known in her area. She has 2 kids and she cooperates with her husband in the household and in raising her children. Today, Imane is requesting a loan of $1,200 to improve the decor of her salon and buy specially designed barber chairs that will be more comfortable for the clients.

loans.use: To improve the decor of her salon and buy specially designed barber chairs

loans.name: Jesus Is Lord Group

texts.en:
This group of entrepreneurs calls their group 'Jesus is Lord Group'. Hawa K. is the group’s leader. She is 30 years old and was born in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a businessman and they have three children – two in secondary school and one in primary school. 

Hawa sells fried cakes and ginger beer (a local drink). She has been a businesswoman for 15 years. With this loan, she will buy groundnuts, rice, and palm oil to start a new business.

loans.use: Buy groundnuts, rice, and palm oil to start a new business

loans.name: Susan Muthoni

texts.en:
Susan is 42 years old. She operates a small shop at Uthiru trading center where she sells things such as salt, cooking oil, washing detergent, boxes of matches, etc. This is her primary business and she has been running it for three years. Her customers are mainly neighbors from around the area of Kinoo.

Susan was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by an existing member and this is her second loan with KADET. She has not borrowed from other financial institutions. Her business is still very young and small, so Susan hopes that with this loan she will be able to add more stock and grow it substantially.

loans.use: To buy stock such as bread, cooking oil, washing detergent etc.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es: Cecilia tiene 41 años de edad, es separada de su primer esposo actualmente tiene otro esposo quien participa del crédito actual y con el que tiene sus hijos. Cecilia es enfermera y trabaja en diferentes lugares actualmente está en un centro de salud, por otra parte su esposo es quien se dedica al servicios de soldadura ya que el lleva mas de 10 años en el rubro y es bien conocido por la zona del parque industrial de la ciudad. La competencia es bastante alta ya que la zona donde esta el negocio de el esposo es buena y caracterizada por tener este tipo de servicio. Este crédito tuvo tres destinos: 1) cancelación de su saldo anterior. 2) regularización de tramite de inmueble,3) capital de operación para el esposo de la Cecilia. Cecilia en anteriores créditos si tuvo problemas graves de índole familiar por lo que se  atraso en una cuota las demás están puntuales por  lo que se la considera una persona responsable y puntual en sus pagos. Se hace notar que cuando se fue a tomar la foto solo se encontró al esposo de Cecilia, por lo que solo se le tomo la foto a él, Cecilia se encontraba trabajando en un lugar alejado.
texts.en:
Cecelia is 41 years old and has separated from her first husband. She now has another husband who participates in a current loan and with whom she also has children. Cecelia is a nurse who works in different places. She is currently at a health center, while her husband has been providing welding services for over ten years. His business is well-known and located in an industrial area of the city. Competition in his business is quite high but he continues to do well because he is known for providing this type of service. Cecelia’s loan will be used for three purposes: 1. Pay off the balance of her previous loan. 2. Apply to have her property legally registered. 3. Provide operating capital to her husband’s welding business. Cecelia had some serious problems with her previous loans due to family circumstances. Cecilia got behind on one payment, but was punctual with her other payments, and she is generally considered to be a responsible and punctual client. It should be noted that when we went to take her photograph, we only met Cecelia’s husband. We took his picture since Cecelia was working at a remote location. (Cecilia is pictured in the smaller photo in the upper right hand corner.)

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay off previous loan, registration fees, and operating capital for her husband's welding business

loans.name: Joel Misael

texts.es:
La persona solicitante del crédito se dedica especialmente al  Comercio "Compra y venta			
de ropa tales como; playeras, pantalones camisas.  El vive en el Paraje La Cumbre San Antonio Pasajoc, del municipio de Momostenango, cuenta con 2 hijas son menores de edad, y el es el unico que trabaja de la familia, para poder mantener a su familia tiende a viajar mas de 500 kilometros de donde reside, ya que el explora otras ciudades de la region Guatemalteca, con la necesidad que tiene fue a las oficinas de la Asociación ASDIR, en Pologuá para solicitar un prestamo y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Joel Misael, who is requesting this loan, buys and sells clothing, including T-shirts, pants, and shirts. He lives in Paraje La Cumbre San Antonio Pasajoc, in the municipality of Momostenango, and has 2 daughters who are minors. Joel is the only worker in the family. To maintain his family, he travels more than 500 kilometers from where he lives, searching for opportunities in other cities of the region. Given his needs, he visited the offices of the ASDIR Association in Pologuá to request a loan, and in this manner, to increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING MERCHANDISE TO SELL

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita P. is from the village of Alimannao, Peñablanca, Cagayan. She is 31 years old. Lolita is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she provides recycling services. She hauls plastics and other recyclables for local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately $188 a month for these activities.

In 2007, she joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from ASKI. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional plastics and other recyclables to sell. This will be her 3rd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional plastics and other recyclables to sell

loans.name: Construyendo Un Futuro Mejor Group

texts.es:
LA SRA. JUDITH ANGELA, ES INTEGRANTE DEL GRUPO "CONSTRUYENDO UN FUTURO MEJOR" FORMADO POR 10 PERSONAS QUE VIVEN EN LA ZONA DEL PROGRESO EN EL DISTRITO D. CARABAYLLO. SUS COMPAÑERAS LA ELIGIERON COMO TESORERA D. LA JUNTA DIRECTIVA DEL GRUPO.
LA SRA JUDITH ANGELA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA D. HAMBURGUESAS EN UN CARRITO SANGUCHERO QUE UBICA EN LA PUERTA D. SU DOMICILIO, HACE CINCO AÑOS INCIÓ ÉSTE NEGOCIO, PREPARABA EN SU COCINA Y TENÍA MUY POCA CLIENTELA YA QUE LA PREPARACIÓN DEMORABA, TRABJANDO MUY DURO Y AHORRANDO SUS GANANCIAS PUDO ADQUIRIR UN CARRITO SANGUCHERO Y ÉSTO LE AYUDÓ A HACER CRECER SU NEGOCIO ASÍ COMO AUMENTÓ SU CLIENTELA.
GRACIAS A SU TRABAJO A CONSEGUIDO COMPRAR SUS ARTEFACTOS, PAGAR LA EDUCACIÓN D. SUS HIJOS.
SU PROXIMA META A LOGRAR ES ADQUIRIR OTRA MOTOTAXI PARA PODER ALQUILARLA.
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ EN LA COMPRA D. SILLAS Y MESAS PARA PODER ATENDER CON MAS COMODIDAD A SUS  CLIENTES PARA LO CUAL ESTÁ AMBIENTANDO UN ESPACIO D. SU CASA. ASIMISMO INVERTIRÁ EN LA COMPRA D. BEBIDAS GESEOSAS.
texts.en:
Judith Angela is a member of the Construyendo Un Futuro Mejor Group. It is comprised of ten people who live in the Carabayllo district. Her colleagues elected her to be the treasurer of the group’s executive board. Judith Angela sells hamburgers from a cart, which is located at the doorway of her house. She started this business five years ago. She maD. the food in her kitchen, and she had few customers because the preparation took too long. By working hard and saving her earnings she was able to get a cart. This helped her to make her business grow and increased her customers. Thanks to her work she has purchased her appliances and paid for her children’s education. Her next goal is to get another “mototaxi” (three wheeled motorized vehicle) to be able to rent it out. She will use the requested loan to buy tables and chairs in order to make her customers more comfortable. She is setting up a space in her house in order to do that. She will also buy soft drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tables and chairs to equip her business and to buy soft drinks

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine has been operating her retail shop for more than five years. She is married with twin girls who attend school. Her husband works with the Kenya Ports of Authority, and he contributes to the upbringing of the children. 

With the loan of Kshs 50,000, Josephine would want to buy 50 kg of cooking flour, baking flour, cooking oil, 50 kg of sugar, and soft drinks. Her major challenges are competition and the high cost of transportation. Josephine hopes to open another business of selling secondhand clothes in the future. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to uplift her business and improve her living standards. 

Josephine rents a house with electricity but no piped water, citing school fees, food and clothing as her greatest monthly expenses.

loans.use: To buy cooking flour, baking flour, cooking oil, sugar, and soft drinks for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase firewood and pay for labour

loans.name: Jenet

texts.en: Jenet A. is single and prepares locally-made drinks with bread to sell at Elmina. She has been through senior high school. Jenet uses her income to pay for her accommodations and to take care of herself.  Jenet is of the view that the loan will enable her to produce in large quantities. She will therefore use the loan to buy more ingredients to make drinks to sell.  Jenet plans to reinvest the new profits from her expanded business,

loans.use: To buy more ingredients to make drinks to sell.

loans.name: Jorge Washington

texts.es:
Jorge Washington Valverde G. tiene 25 anos. Vive en union libre en el canton de Ventanas en la provincia de Los Rios. Tiene 1 hijo que se llama Madeli. 

Jorge es un socio de la ventanilla rural San Eraneiseo de Sibimbe. Son 13 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura.  

Jorge se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo de maiz. Realiza sus compras y sus ventas en Ventanas. 

Solicita el prestamo para sembrar maiz, que con el prestamo puede seguir adelante conla auyda de Dios. Su sueno es tener buena salud y seguir adelante.  

En su tiempo libre le gusta pasar tiempo en la casa.
texts.en:
Jorge Washington Valverde G. is 25 years old. He lives with his partner in the canton of Ventanas is the Los Rios province. He has one child named Madeli.

Jorge is a member of the rural communal bank, San Eraneiseo de Sibimbe. There are 13 members in total, the majority of which work in agriculture.

Jorge works in agriculture growing corn. He makes his purchases and sales in Ventanas.

He is requesting this loan to plant corn. With the loan the loan, he can continue to get ahead with the help of God. His dream is to have good health and to get ahead.

In his free time he likes spending time at home.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To plant corn

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Ms. Anita L. has been a member of ASHI since 2005 and has been faithful and active. She’s been in the business of food vending for a year now.

Ms. L. is 53 years old, married, and blessed with three children. Her eldest, Leonilo, 26 years old, is a high school graduate and works in a factory; the second, Maricris, is 23 years old and is also a high school graduate; and the youngest, Edward, 15, is a third-year student.

The family resides in El Dorado, Antipolo City, Rizal, Philippines, where Ms. L. put up her food-vending business. Because their place was proclaimed as a city, migrants from other municipalities transfer to the place to seek jobs. Because of this, it opens business opportunities, especially in food vending.

Ms. L. grabbed the opportunity and has applied for a loan of Php 17,000 payable in weekly installments, so that she can meet the demand of her increasing number of customers waiting for her delicious food. She is planning to buy more meat, vegetables, ingredients, soft drinks and cooking utensils to expand her business.

Ms. L. wanted to learn and cook new menus, too, for her customers to love. With help from ASHI and Kiva she is praying her plans will materialize. The accomplishment of her dreams is to expand her business, earn more, and send her children to college to pursue a career.

loans.use: To buy meat, vegetables, ingredients and additional cooking utensils

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, de 44 años, es una madre de familia muy jovial y risueña, vive en casa de sus suegros, en compañía de su esposo y sus 3 hijos, quienes son su adoración. Su actividad cotidiana de Ana, es el corte de cabello, peinados y tratamientos de belleza en general. Se esmera en hacer un buen trabajo y sobre todo con mucho cuidado a cada uno de sus clientes, ya que valora la preferencia que le dan. Su salón de belleza es un local alquilado, ubicado en una avenida céntrica de su distrito, a media hora en carro de donde vive. Ella disfruta su labor; por ello lleva 18 años trabajando en este rubro, aunque recuerda que en un inicio le era difícil, porque no tenía con quien dejar a sus hijas y trabajaba sola, al final terminaba muy agotada, ya con el tiempo sus hijas crecieron y contrata a una señora para que le que  ayude a cuidarlas. Su mayor anhelo en adelante es comprarse un terreno y construir su casa, para brindarle una calidad de vida a su familia. Este es su doceavo crédito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que anhela contar con posteriores ayudas para seguir progresando. Con el crédito que solicita, piensa comprarse tintes, oxigentas, líquidos y cremas al por mayor, para que siga trabajando de manera eficiente.
texts.en:
Ana, 44, is a jovial and cheerful mother. She lives in her in-laws’ house with her husband and three children who are her adoration. Ana’s daily work is haircuts, styling and beauty treatments in general. She takes great pains to do a good job and above all to be very careful with each one of her customers because she values the preference they have for her. Her beauty salon is in a rented locale on a centrally located avenue in her district a half hour from home. She enjoys her work; she’s been doing it for 18 years although she remembers how difficult it was at the beginning because she didn’t have anyone to care for her daughters and she worked by herself. At the end of the day she was exhausted. In time, as her daughters grew, she was able to hire a woman to help care for them. Her greatest wish for the future is to buy a lot on which to build her house in order to improve her family’s quality of life. This is her 12th loan with MFP and she pledges to repay in a timely fashion because she hopes to be able to have future loans to continue progressing. The requested loan will be used to buy dyes, hair oxygenators, liquids and creams at wholesale so that she can continue to work efficiently.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Gaudencio

texts.es: Gaudencio, de 68 años, es un hombre muy entregado a su trabajo, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa y sus 2 hijos más su nieta. Con mucho esfuerzo, Gaudencio logró comprar su carro, después de haber trabajado durante largos años como chofer de bus. Ahora trabaja con su propio carro haciendo servicio de taxi, de las 7.00 de la mañana a 9:00pm de la noche, es así que viene trabajando durante estos 24 años. El trabajo que realiza le apasiona mucho, ya que, ni el descanso médico que le dieron; por la operación de su vista, ha mellado sus ansias de seguir trabajando. El prefiere trabajar; antes de aburrirse en su casa, y además con las ganancias que obtiene cubre  las medicinas de su esposa que sufre de diabetes. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la conversación que entabla con cada uno de sus pasajeros. En lo sucesivo tratará de mantener en óptimas condiciones su carro, para que pueda seguir trabajando eficientemente. Es el onceavo crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará llantas para su carro para renovar las que tiene.
texts.en:
Gaudencio is 68 years old and he is very dedicated to his work. He lives in his own home together with his wife, their two children and his granddaughter. With a great deal of work, Gaudencio managed to purchase a car. He worked many long years as a bus driver to achieve this goal. But he works with his own car now and he provides taxi services from 7 in the morning until 9 at night. He has had this schedule for the past 24 years. He is very passionate about his work. Even the medical leave he had to take following an eye operation did not deter his wish to keep working. He prefers to work instead of being bored at home. The earnings that he gains also cover the medicines his wife needs. She suffers from diabetes. What he most likes about his work is the conversations he has with each one of his passengers. He will endeavor to keep his car in good working order so that he may keep working efficiently. This is his eleventh loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and he is committed to be on time with his payments. With the loan he requests he will purchase replacement tires for his car.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase replacement tires for his car.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma S. is from the village of San Miguel, Gingoog City. She is 37 years old. Vilma is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Vilma runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products and also buying and selling bananas in the local community. Vilma has been engaged in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Vilma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vilma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional bananas to sell. Vilma is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the third loan taken out by Vilma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

location.town: San Miguel, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Margarate Nabusuba

texts.en:
Margarate Nabusuba J. is a 40 year-old food kiosk owner in Magongo, Mombasa. She is married to Patrick Makoko and they are blessed with three children. She has had her business for the last three years and has made a good income. 

She has applied for her second loan from KADET which she would like to use to carry out renovations on her kiosk and purchase more foodstuff. She will use  the anticipated profit to expand her business.

In future she hopes to open up a restaurant.

loans.use: Renovations to her food stall and food for her kiosk

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn I. is from the village of Sta. Cruz, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 22 years old. Jovelyn is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Jovelyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Jovelyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jovelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. Jovelyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Jovelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
