Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Silas Ngari

texts.en:
Silas is 39 years old and married to Milka, who is a housewife. They have been blessed with four young children. Silas runs a cereals shop which has been in existence for the past two years with an income of 15,000 Kenya shillings a month.

This is his first loan with Kadet which he wants to use to buy 20 bags of maize and beans. He has never borrowed from another MFI before. 

He hopes to educate his children to the highest level and expand his business.

loans.use: To buy 20 bags of maize and beans

loans.name: Nget

texts.en: Nget S., 55, is married and lives with one child in the Takeo province. She works as a farmer and raises cows, making approximately $2.50 USD each day. Her husband works in construction. He earns $5 USD per day which also goes towards supporting the family. Nget S. is asking for a loan of $1000 USD to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila P. is from the village of Maputi, Naawan, Misamis Oriental. She is 58 years old. Teofila is married and has 6 children. To make a living, Teofila owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & junk foods in the local community. Teofila has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Teofila joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teofila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Teofila is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell such as beverages & biscuits. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Teofila from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell such as beverages & biscuits

loans.name: Mario Ramiro

texts.es:
Mario de 35 años, es un hombre trabajador que desde pequeño su padre le enseño a fabricar muebles en un pequeño taller que el tenia. Poco a poco fue aprendiendo hasta cuando decidió que esa iba a ser la actividad económica que iba mantener a su familia. Viviendo en una zona urbana llamada suburbio tiene su taller de ebanista. En la actualidad trabaja de lunes a sábado desde muy temprano haciendo muebles de madera y diseños que con la ayuda de su padre los realiza. 

Quiere continuar con su negocio por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar madera, pegamentos, herramientas y así hacer todos los pedidos que les piden sus clientes. En el futuro quiere seguir trabajando con su padre y que su negocio de ebanista sea conocido.
texts.en:
Mario is 35 years old.  He is a hard-working man whose father taught him to make furniture in a small workshop that he owned when he was a young boy.  He gradually learned the trade until he decided that this was going to be the business activity with which he would support his family.

Mario lives in an urban area called Suburbio and he has a cabinet-making workshop.  He currently works from Monday to Saturday, from very early in the morning, making wooden furniture and designs that his father helps him with.  He would like to continue in his business and is requesting this loan to buy wood, adhesive and tools so that he can fill all of the orders he receives from his customers.  In the future, he would like to continue working with his father and for his furniture business to become well known.

loans.use: To buy wood, adhesive and tools

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena J. is from the village of Tumbao, Banisilan, South Cotabato. She is 57 years old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Lorena owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. Her main source of income comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, junk foods and toothpaste in the local community. Lorena has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. 

Lorena joined HSPFI in 2009 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Lorena is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and junk foods. This will be the third loan taken out by Lorena from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to improve and expand her business. 


About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase products to sell

loans.name: Claudia Lisbeth

texts.es:
Claudia, es una joven de 23 años de edad, reside en Nueva Guadalupe, departamento de San Miguel, actualmente vive con sus padres y hermanos, es soltera y no tiene hijos, ella vende tamales de tres clases de gallina, elotes y pisques (frijoles), desde hace 4 años, realizando las ventas de lunes a sábado.
Ella por el momento necesita materiales para la preparación de estos tamales por lo que solicita un préstamo y comprar con los fondos, elotes, pollo, manteca, frijol, maíz, tomates y condimentos, este préstamo le ayudara a su negocio y a ella para que continúe vendiendo y generando ingresos para ayudar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar.
Su objetivo es ayudar a sus padres para que tengan un ingresos permanente de ella y también ahorrar su propias ganancias y en un futuro formar su propia familia.
texts.en:
Claudia is 23 years old and lives with her parents and siblings in Nueva Guadalupe, in the department of San Miguel. She is single and has no children.
For the last four years, from Monday to Saturday, she has been selling three types of tamale made from chicken, corn and "pisque" (beans). 

She currently needs ingredients to make these tamales, so she is requesting a loan in order to buy corn, chicken, butter, beans, tomatoes and seasoning. This loan will help her business and allow her to continue selling tomales and thus generate income to help her parents with the household expenses.

His goal is to provide her parents with a permanent income and also to save for her own future family.

loans.use: To buy corn, chicken, butter, beans, tomatoes and seasoning

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela O. is from the village of Samay, Gingoog City. She is 55 years old. Estela is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Estela owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods & toothpaste in the local community. Estela has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Estela joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Estela is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & snack foods. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Estela from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & snack foods

loans.name: Moises Alexandre

texts.es:
MOISES ALEXANDRE M. S., ES DE LA CIUDAD DE MANAGUA  EL TRABAJA DIARIO COMO TECNICO EN REFRIGERACION, ES PADRE DE FAMILIA DE DOS HIJOS, Y ESTOS  ACTUALMENTE DEPENDE DE EL Y SE ENCUENTRA EN EDAD ESCOLAR.
DON MOISES ACUDE   A LAS OFICINAS DE CEPRODEL PARA SOLICITAR UN PRESTAMO PARA EL MEJORAMIENTO DE SU VIVIENDA PARA INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION COMO: ARENA, CEMENTO, PIEDRA, PARA LA CONSTRUCCION DE UN BAÑO EN SU CASA DE HABITACION.
TODO ESTO PARA MEJORAR SUS CONDICIONES DE VIVIENDA PARA SU FAMILIA, AGRADECE A CEPRODEL POR BRINDARLE LA OPORTUNIDAD DEMEJORAR SU VIVIENDA.
texts.en:
Moises Alexandre M. S. is from the city of Managua and works each day as a refrigeration technician. He is the father of four dependent children who are currently in school.

Don Moises visited the office of CEPRODEL to request a home improvement loan. He will invest in the purchase of construction materials such as sand, cement, and stone to build a bathroom in his home.

Moises does everything he can to improve the conditions at home for his family. He is grateful to CEPRODEL for providing this opportunity to improve his home.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to build a bathroom

loans.name: Maria Natividad

texts.es:
Maria Natividad M. Aguachela tiene 33 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos solteros en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 6 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO ENMANUEL se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Juan  pertenece al Cantón Guaranda, esta ventanilla de 17 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra maíz, trigo, papas en grandes cantidades y a la cría de animales como chanchos y gallinas.

Maria se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y a la cría de chanchos y gallinas. Compra sus productos en Comercial Silva cada fin de semana por la comida de los animales y los vende en la feria de los jueves en la Ciudad de Guaranda.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz trigo, papas y  compra de  animales además para insumos de alimentación e insumos para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener buena situación economica.

Le gusta visitar a la familia y caminar.
texts.en:
Maria Natividad M. Aguachela is 33 years old, married and lives with her husband and unmarried children in the Guaranda canton in the province of Bolívar.  She has 6 children.  

The members of the Enmanuel Group communal bank live in the San Juan area in the Guaranda canton.  This group has 17 members, like Maria, that work in agriculture planting short cycle crops like corn, wheat, large quantities of potatoes as well as raising animals like pigs and hens.  Maria goes every weekend to the Silva commercial market to buy animal feed and where she also buys products that she then sells at the Thursday market in the city of Guaranda. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase corn, wheat, potatoes and animals as well as feed and farming supplies.  The loan will help her to  financially meet her needs.  The challenges she faces are pests, disease and weather variation.  Her dream is to improve her economic situation.  She likes to walk and visit with her family.

loans.use: to purchase corn, wheat and potatoes as well as feed and farming supplies.

loans.name: Penninah

texts.en:
Penninah N. K. is 31 years old, married and a mother of two. She runs a retail shop and has been in business for almost two years. With income from her business, she helps her husband with the household expenses. 

Penninah hopes to expand her business so that she can employ more people. She has requested a loan for 20,000 KES to buy sugar, milk and maize flour.

loans.use: To buy sugar, milk and maize flour

loans.name: Nvard

texts.en:
Nvard S. lives in the village of Sarukhan, in the Gegharkunik region, with her husband, father-in-law, mother-in-law, and daughter. Nvard runs a business and sells shoes at the market. Her business demand is increasing and she would like to purchase new inventory to help develop her business. 

Nvard is applying to SEF for a loan to purchase more shoes to sell. In the future, Nvard plans to expand her shoe business and increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase shoes to sell

loans.name: Joselito

texts.en:
Joselito A. is from the village of Brgy. Barat, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 56 years old. Joselito is married and has four children. To make a living, Joselito ventures in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Joselito has been engaged in his business for over 28 years and earns approximately 8,500 PHP a month.

In 2011, Joselito joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joselito is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Viwanou Group

texts.fr: VIWANOU est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent toutes dans le même quartier à Kpakpakanmey à Cotonou. La représentante du groupe Suzanne Fassi (qui a la main levée sur la photo) est née en 1968.  Suzanne Fassi est mariée à Valentin. Le couple a sept enfants, tous scolarisés, dont quatre à leur charge. Suzanne Fassi vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari à Kpakpakanmey. Il y a près de onze ans que la famille s'est installée dans ce quartier. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Suzanne Fassi vend depuis huit ans des bois de chauffage à Cotonou, ce qui lui permet de se prendre en charge. Suzanne Fassi s'approvisionne à Bohicon, dans le département du Zou au Bénin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui a bien remboursé les crédits antérieurs. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Suzanne Fassi s’est associée avec deux autres membres en vue de l’obtention d’un autre crédit.
texts.en: VIWANOU is a three-person group whose members all live in the same neighborhood in Kpakpakanmey, in Cotonou.  Suzanne, the group’s representative (whose hand is raised in the photo), was born in 1968.  She is married to Valentin.  The couple has seven children, four of whom they support financially.  All of the children are in school. Suzanne lives with her husband and children in Kpakpakanmey.  The family moved into this neighborhood nearly 11 years ago.  Together, the couple provides for the family’s various expenses.  Suzanne has been selling firewood in Cotonou for eight years, which enables her to support herself.  She gets her supplies in Bohicon, in the Zou department of Benin.  She is a longstanding ALIDé client who has fully repaid previous loans.  Her goal is to expand her business and to satisfy customer demand.  Suzanne has gone into partnership with two other members in order to obtain another loan.

loans.use: To buy firewood

loans.name: Severo

texts.es: El sr. Severo vive  en la localidad de San José  hace 15 años, su actividad es el servicio de  fabricación  de botas el realiza botas a pedido también los ofrece en el los mercados de Santa Cruz, tiene también un taller mecánico del cual los dos hijos se hacen cargo del servicio y así de esta manera poder colaborar con sus hijos que también tienen familia, conviven con la Sra. Isabel ella le ayuda en el trabajo de comercializar las botas que el Sr. Severo fabrica  tienen casa propia, con el dinero de el crédito el Sr. Severo realizara el mantenimiento de la maquinaria que usa para su trabajo, es una  persona responsable y trabajadora su deseo del Sr. Es el mantener a su familia unida y ver crecer a sus nietos, esta agradecido con nuestra entidad por haber confiado en el y brindarle un apoyo económico.
texts.en:
Severo has been living in the town of San José for 15 years.  His business is making boots.  He makes boots to order and also sells them in the markets in Santa Cruz.  Severo also has an auto repair shop which his two children are in charge of running.  In this way, he is able to help his children who have their own families.  Severo lives with Isabel who helps him in his work selling the boots that he makes.  They own their own home.

Severo will use his loan money to have maintenance work done on the machinery that he uses in his business.  He is a responsible and hard-working person whose wish is to keep his family united and watch his grandchildren grow up.  He is grateful to our organization for having trusted in him and provided him with financial support.

loans.use: to have maintenance work done on the machinery in his workshop

loans.name: Shura's Group

texts.en:
Shura is the leader of this group. She is 60 years old and, unfortunately, a widow. She has raised two daughters and three sons. All the children are married and employed. In order to earn money to cover their personal needs, Shura sells 9–10 liters of milk every day. She also owns a piece of land, where she cultivates potatoes. She applied for the loan because she needs additional money to purchase fertilizers for growing potatoes and wheat. Part of the loan will be used to purchase fuel for collecting the harvest. In the future, Shura plans to start building a house for her sons in Bishkek. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious, and socially focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line—People (building human capital and taking care of customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team—Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - Mol Bulak Finance—at: http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and fuel

loans.name: Romelita

texts.en:
Romelita is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 

Romelita has a retail shop that sells rugs. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy materials needed for rug making.

Romelita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Romelita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for rug making.

loans.name: Esau

texts.en:
Esau, 52 years old, is a happily married father of six. For the past ten years he has run a retail shop selling a variety of general merchandise such as sugar, salt, rice, beans, plastics, etc. He opened his shop with savings from his farm. In addition, Esau sells milk and bananas. Weekly, his profits total up to 140,000 UGX.

Esau has gotten acquainted with the nitty gritty and fundamentals of running a business and consolidating its achievements. With the invaluable experience gained, his confidence in the future prospects of his business has been growing. This explains why his business is in high favor with many rank and file people around his operating area in Bushenyi.

This is Esau's second loan from Pearl microfinance. The records show that he paid back his first loan on time. Notwithstanding the ever-rising costs of doing business in Uganda, Esau is upbeat about the future of his businesses. To lend him countenance in the purchase of more retail commodities like sugar, salt, rice and beans is what this Kiva loan is for.

loans.use: The purchase of more retail commodities like sugar, rice,salt and beans to resell

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil will pay his children's schooling education fees with his requested loan of $1200 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l. The school management has warned him to pay the required amount before the beginning of the school year; otherwise, his children will be prohibited from pursuing their education. Khalil’s only target is to ensure a good education for his children until they enter university.

Khalil is a 31-year-old married man living with his wife and two school-aged children. He is from Lebanon. He has been working in a car wheel shop since 1996. He works hard to satisfy his family's needs.

loans.use: pay his children's schooling education fees.

loans.name: Yanett Dionisia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MARIA ELENA MOYANO”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yanett  la socia tiene 57 años de edad; la socia tiene 3 hijos de 26, 23, 19 años y es casada, la socia es enfermera de profesión y ella actualmente, está trabajando en  una institución publica, la socia alterna sus actividades y vende plata, ella compra al por mayor pulseras, collares, aretes, la socia también viaja dos veces al año al inicio del año y a mediados para la ciudad de Lima y trae ropa para la venta a sus amistades, y compañeras de trabajo.  Ella tiene años en este negocio de esta forma la socia incrementa su negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de ropa al por mayor y para ello viajara a la ciudad de Lima para traer ropa para la venta.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Yanett belongs to the Maria Elena Moyano Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

Yanett, age 57, is married and has three children; ages 26, 23, and 19.  She is a nurse by profession, and she is currently working in a public institution.  She alternates her business activities, and she sells silver.  

She buys wholesale bracelets, necklaces, and earrings.  She travels to the city of Lima twice a year, at the beginning of the year and in the middle of the year.  She brings back clothes to sell to her friends and work colleagues.  She has been in this business for years, and this is the way she increases her business.  

Yanett is requesting the loan to buy clothes wholesale and to travel to Lima to get the clothes to sell.

She is grateful for the loan she will get, and she pledges to make her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy clothes wholesale and to travel to Lima to get the clothes that she will sell.

loans.name: Florida

texts.en: Florida is 60 years old and lives in Dapitan City with her husband and four children. For the last three years, she has earned a living by running a general store. She is applying for a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy additional items to sell to her customers. Florida has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in a general store.

loans.name: Lucerito De Jose Galvez Group

texts.es: Isabel tiene 57 años D. edad y tiene 2 hijos, la cual sigue apoyando al menor  D. ellos, la sra. Isabel lleva más D. 8 años  dedicándose  a la venta D. picarones y anticuchos la cual los venD. cerca a un parque D. su comunidad ya que es un lugar céntrico, ella comenzó ayudando a su madre quien también se dedicaba a dicho trabajo es así como llego a tener experiencia y decidió iniciar su propio negocio, Isabel es una mujer empeñosa que ha tenido  que trabajar arduamente para sacar adelante a sus hijos ya que nos cuenta que es madre soltera, aunque eso no fue obstáculo para seguir luchando cada día. El deseo D. Isabel es que sus hijos sean profesionales y crecer en su negocio, es por ello que solicito el préstamo para comprar insumos como harina, carne, azúcar, entre otros. Isabel es unas D. las integrantes D. la Alcancía Comunal “Lucerito D. José Gálvez” este grupo está conformado por 11 personas responsables, ellos agradecen la ayuda D. los prestamistas KIVA y se comprometen a seguir trabando bien.Los socios  JIMMY y  BERTHA no pudieron estar presente por motivo D. trabajo.
texts.en:
Isabel is 57 and has two children, the youngest of which is still in her care.  For over eight years she has been selling tid-bits and snacks near the community park which is in a central location.  She began helping her mother who had the same business, so she had ample experience when she decided to set up her own activity.  Isabel is a hard-working woman who has done her best to proviD. for her children.  She is a single mother but this has not been an obstacle in her daily struggle.

Isabel's dream is for her children to become professionals and for her business to grow.  She has requested a loan to buy flour, meat, sugar and other items.  She is a member of the communal bank "Lucerito D. José Gálvez" which is comprised of 11 responsible members.  They are grateful to the KIVA lenders and are committed to continue working well.  Members Jimmy and Bertha could not be present for the picture because of work.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as flour, meat, sugar and others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 9 children. 

Dolores owns a videoke or karaoke shop that provides a karaoke machine that customers pay 5 pesos per song to use. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy tools and pay for the electricity for maintenance.

Dolores is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Dolores hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the electricity for maintenance of her karaoke machine

loans.name: Clara Luz

texts.es:
Clara de 29 años, es soltera, vive en casa de sus padres, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Zona de actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Desde hace unos años Clara se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y de ganado ovino, su negocio lo tiene en casa de sus padres, cuenta con su propia clientela, con los ingresos que obtenga en ambas actividades podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida y solventar sus gastos personales.  A sus animales los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales, con la venta de sus animales podrá solventar sus necesidades diarias de su hogar.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar más productos de belleza y alimento balanceado para sus animales y así podrá obtener mayores ganancias para cubrir su crédito y mejorar económicamente.  Clara es una mujer trabajadora y dedicada que con su esfuerzo a sabido salir adelante, para seguir ayudando a su familia, en especial a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Clara, 29, is single and lives in her parents’ house which only has electricity and is located in the rural part of Tambogrande District which belongs to Piura Department.  The zone’s activities are farming, livestock raising and crafts making.

Clara has been selling beauty products and raising sheep for a few years.  Her business is located at her parents’ house.  She has her own clientele and uses income earned in both activities to have a better quality of life and to cover her personal expenses.  She feeds her animals nutritionally balanced feed and natural grasses.  Sale of her animals allows her to cover daily household expenses.

She’s asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan to buy more beauty products and nutritionally balanced animal feed to earn higher profits to repay the loan and improve economically.  Clara is a hard working, dedicated woman who has known how to get ahead through her own efforts to continue helping her family, especially her children.

loans.use: to buy more beauty supplies and nutritionally balanced feed for her small farm animals.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda has been engaged in a fish selling business for one year.  She is able to earn about PHP 3,500 a month. She works hard to provide for the needs of her family because she stands as both father and mother to her five children. 

Through her fish selling business, Imelda is able to sustain her children's daily needs but as they grow up her expenses also increase.  So, she needs to increase her profit by increasing the fish she sells. For this reason, Imelda is asking for additional capital in the amount of PHP 7,000 to buy more kinds of fish for her fish selling business. She hopes that she can maintain her business and have greater income to sustain her family's needs and improve their living condition. One thing she hopes for is to become a successful entrepreneur someday.

loans.use: buy fish to sell

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married with 6 school age children. 

Christine runs a food stall, selling fruits, vegetables and dry fish on a retail basis at the market. She has been in business for the last year.  Christine works six days a week .

She has requested a loan of 2000000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more vegetables like cabbages, tomatoes, fish, and ground nuts.  Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. 

Christine gets additional income through rental rooms and a small retail shop.  Her goals and aspirations are to build more rental houses and to own a fully stocked food stall.  She lives in her own house and her family has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees, medication and food.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables like cabbages, tomatoes, dried fish  and  ground nuts.

loans.name: Sari Karya Group

texts.en:
To continue to increase their businesses, the group is requesting another loan. This loan will be used to buy more piglets, feed and for renovation the pigpen.

Ni Ketut succeeded in raising two pigs and sold them with a satisfactory price. She sold the pigs at the price of Rp.3.600.000. and after deducting all the costs, she earns a profit of about Rp.1,500,000. She plans to use her profit to develop the business, set aside savings, and for daily life. 

The new loan will be used to buy 4 more piglets and she will buy the feed from the profit that she earned. The business can help her family, specially to support her children's education.

loans.use: To buy 4 piglets.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en:
Jeannette is 30 years old and has 3 children aged 8 to 10. All of them are currently in school.  She sells foodstuffs such as beans and maize in a store she has run for 4 years.

Jeannette would like a loan to buy more beans and maize to sell. Any profits will be used to renovate her house. She dreams to one day be a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy more beans and maize to sell

loans.name: Amah

texts.fr:
Amah est une femme  âgé(e) de 36 ans. Elle est mariée å un électricien auto avec 03 enfants en charge.
Amah travaille comme revendeuse de produits cosmétiques et divers depuis 1999. Elle vend dans un quartier de la place et est aidée par une personne. 
Amah a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits cosmétiques et divers.
texts.en:
Amah is a 36 year old woman.  She is married to an automotive electrician and they have three children in their care.
Amah has been selling cosmetics and various products since 1999.  She sells in a local neighborhood and has one person who helps her. 
Amah received her first loan through WAGES in order to buy cosmetics and various products.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and general grocery products.

loans.name: Leandre Martin

texts.fr:
Client de 51 ans, marie et père de 4 enfants dont l'age varie ente 5 et 29 ans, 2 sont a l'école et l'aine est a l'université, ayant considéré sa charge , il ouvre une alimentation et a l'obtention de son troisième prêt, elle élargit son activité en ajoutant des chaussures de friperie et tous articles qui intéressent ces clients
Ces differents prêts ont largement contribue a change les conditions de vie de sa vie sociale, ses enfants sont dans les écoles privées, il est entrain d'investir pour ouvrir une grande boutique, ses recettes ont largement augmentes et il fait des épargnes considérables

Tres entreprenant, il veut aller vers loin et il est entrain de s'investir pour construire pour sa maison et s'occuper valablement de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This gentleman is 50 years old, married, and the father of four children whose ages range from 5 to 29 years. Two of them attend school and the eldest is at university.

Considering his responsibilities, he opened a grocery store and after obtaining his third loan, expanded his business by adding second-hand shoes and all articles of interest to his customers.

These different loans have been instrumental in changing his living conditions and his social life: his children are in private schools, he is about to invest in opening a large store, his income has significantly increased and he is putting a lot into savings.

He is very enterprising and wants to go far. He is currently investing to build himself a home so he can properly care for his children.

loans.use: buy canned goods, non-alcoholic beverages, second-hand clothing, and mineral water

loans.name: Odile

texts.fr: Odile est âgée de 28 ans et est mariée à un soudeur du nom de Guy. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Odile et son mari assurent ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Odile n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Depuis environs sept ans, Odile mène comme activité la vente de fruits (pommes fruits, raisins, bananes, etc.) de façon ambulante ; ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et d’assurer les charges familiales. Odile achète ses produits au Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Odile sollicite pour la cinquième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Odile is 28 years old and is married to a welder named Guy. The couple has two children, both dependants and both attending school. Odile and her husband cover the various family expenses together. Odile did not attend school.

For seven years now, Odile has been selling fruit (apples, grapes, bananas, etc.) from place to place. This allows her to provide for herself and support her family. Odile buys her products in Benin.

With the intention of increasing the amount of products that she sells and better meeting the demand of her customers, Odile is asking for a fifth loan through ALIDé. All of her previous loans were paid back in full.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fruit

loans.name: Salina

texts.en:
Salina is 51 years old, married to Paul and blessed with two children. 

Salina owns a retail shop in Kapsabet town. She has been in the business for a period of three years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000.

She is requesting a third loan from KADET Ltd. of KES 50,000. She plans to use the money to purchase more stock of wheat flour, sugar, rice and cooking oil for her shop, with the anticipated profits to support her family.

Her dream is to own a wholesale shop and live a happy and successful life.

loans.use: To purchase stock of wheat and maize flour, sugar, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en: Yusuf is a 47-year-old married man with six children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His personal goal is to educate his children through university and build a permanent house. He has been in the transport sector for the last 15 years after investing his personal savings. His main hardships are price fluctuations and inflation, seasonal weather and high fuel and transportation costs. However, he has a vision of buying land to grow crops. Yusuf intends to use the loan to buy iron sheets for roofing his residential house.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets for roofing his residential house.

loans.name: Mechior

texts.en:
Mechior is 40 years old. He is married with 4 children aged 8 and 17 years. They all go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 7 years. While his wife is a business woman. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and to buy a piece of land.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Aliya

texts.en: Aliya is 30-years old, married and energetic woman living with her husband and three children in the area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan.She owns a General store in which she sells Shampoo, bath soaps, detergents, biscuits, rice, sugar, cooking oil, etc.She manages her household necessities from her own store as well, her relatives like to purchase from her general Store. Due to good relation her sales have increased a lot but she does not have sufficient stock to cope up with the demand. Therefore,Aliya requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she would be able to run her general store.She hopes that lenders will support her and this loan will prove productive for her business as well.She is much impressed with the kiva loan cycle system; is much thankful to the lenders

loans.use: To invest in her general store business.

loans.name: Dian

texts.en:
Dian D. is 37 years old from the village of Sokol with vocational high school education. He is married and has two children. He works as a machine operator in “Sokol-92” Cooperative. His wife is unemployed for 6 years. 
With that loan they will buy seed onions that they plant in their own garden, which is 3,5 decares. With a part of the loan they will buy preparations for plant protection

loans.use: Purchase of seed onions and land cultivation

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en: Hello. My name is Amparo and my main job is trade. Since there are few job opportunities in this city, I took the initiative to establish my own confectioner’s business, and I sell my products on the streets. I have been working at this type of job for several years, work which generates income to cover my family’s costs. Thanks to this business we have been able to provide for our children, most of which are professionals and are in university. Recently, demand has grown and I don’t have sufficient capital to satisfy my clients’ demands.

loans.use: Purchase of flour, lard, sugar, butter, eggs, margarine, etc.

loans.name: Samuel Joaquim

texts.en:
Samuel Joaquim S. is 48 years old. He was born and raised in Maputo. He was raised by his parents. Due to his family’s financial situation, Samuel did not have many opportunities to study. He started working when he was 15 as an attendant.

Since 1998, Samuel has supported his family through his store. In 2007, he was introduced to HLUVUKU- ADSEMA by acquaintances. Currently, his business is doing well, but Samuel needs to increase stock of products in order to serve the demands of his clientele.

With the loan of 11.000,00 MT he plans on increasing the stock of his business and hire additional help. Samuel’s business has a positive impact in his community because it provides employment for Samuel, as well as putting basic products within the reach of his community.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização : Campoane - Boane Cliente: Samuel Joaquim S. Sector de actividade: Comercio Valor de empréstimo: 11.000,00 (440.00US$) Aplicação de montante: Compra de produtos Inicio: 09/05/2007 Fim: 30/04/2008 Samuel Joaquim S. de 48 anos de idade, natural de Maputo, província de Maputo, cresceu na responsabilidade dos seus pais, a situação financeira da família criou-lhe poucas oportunidades para estudar e teve que começar a trabalhar com os seus 15 anos como servente.

Desde 1998 veio assumindo na integra a gestão do negocio da família e possui um estabelecimento comercial. A partir deste ano de 2007 teve o conhecimento de existência da HLUVUKU- ADSEMA por indicações de colegas. Actualmente a sua actividade esta num ritmo razoável, mas precisa de reforçar o stock em produtos de modo a providencia cada vez melhor qualidade de serviços para sua clientela.

Com o empréstimo de 11.000,00MT, pretende aumentar stock e tenciona admitir uma empregada de forma a responder positivamente com as exigências dos clientes. A sua actividade tem um impacto maior na comunidade porque para alem de providenciar emprego para ele próprio, coloca produtos mais perto do cliente.

loans.use: To increase stock in his shop

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is married, the mother of 5 children who are in school. She is an active member of Kandara Moonlight Women's Group. She practices farming which is her only source of income. She rears 1 dairy cow on zero grazing. She is very dedicated to her business and works hard toward its success. She practices mixed farming on her farm.

Jane would like to buy a high-breed dairy cow which will increase the rate of milk production from the one cow she already has. She is applying a loan to be able to buy the cow at once and repay the loan on monthly basis. She is very committed when it comes to repayments.

loans.use: Jane would like to buy a high-breed dairy cow

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea is separated from her husband and has two children. Out of necessity to provide for her young ones, she knew needed to do something to make money and decided to stick with what she knew, which was cooking. That is how she started her restaurant 10 years ago, which she opened in a small rental. Little by little her business grew, and each time she rented a larger establishment to accommodate her growing clientele until she finally could afford her own place. She has worked to remodel her restaurant to improve her service, and the look of her place is very appealing. Now she wants to keep improving and growing her business.

Andrea is requesting a loan of $650, which she will use to purchase materials to remodel her restaurant and make it even more pleasing to her clients. She plans to repay the loan within six months. Andrea and her family are very grateful for your support in growing this business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Andrea es una mujer separada y tiene dos hijos, por la necesidad de mantener a sus pequeños hijos ella tuvo que hacer algo y decidió hacer lo que sabe y era en ese momento cocinar, así que empezó con el negocio de restaurantes, fue hace 10 años atrás que ella empezó rentando un pequeño local y así poco a poco fue creciendo y se veía en la necesidad de ir rentado locales cada vez más grandecitos por que sus clientes se incrementaban, hasta que pudo hacerse de un local propio y con sus utilidades lo ha ido remodelando para mejorar el servicio a sus clientes ya que la imagen de su local da mucho que decir, y ahora desea mejorar más su local y continuar creciendo con el mismo.

Andrea solicita un préstamo por US $ 650 para comprar material para remodelar su local y ponerlo cada vez mas a gusto para todos los clientes que tiene, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses, ella y su familia agradecen mucho por tu apoyo a que continúe con el crecimiento de su negocio.

loans.use: Remodel restaurant

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en:
Mustafa is a 57 year old tailor. This is the seventh time Mustafa is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua. Mustafa started with a $300 loan. The loans helped him buy business equipment and consequently generate more revenue from his tailoring business.

Mustafa lives in the south of Lebanon in the region of Saida. He manufactures children's clothing and cotton items. He needs this loan to buy raw material for his business and to pay the fees of fabric printing. Mustafa is a very hard working and honest man.

loans.use: To buy material for his work

loans.name: Yrene

texts.es:
Yrene is 53 years old; she completed her studies up to secondary school and has 7 children, only one of which depends on her. She has two stands in the Bellavista market located in the district of La Esperanza, province of Trujillo. At one stand she sells food and at the other, shoes, slippers and sandals.

In order to get what she has today, Yrene has worked at different businesses. She started out selling sweets and gelatin deserts in the streets; later she devoted herself to selling pots and containers for plants, also in the streets, and at the same time sold clothing to people she knew. Little by little she saved enough money to rent a space and put up her first stand in the Bellavista market, where she sold food. With her first loan from the Bellavista communal bank, she bought some sandals to start up her second stand.

With another loan from Manuela Ramos, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy plates, silverware, pots, etc., which she needs to prepare meals and to be able to better serve her customers.

Her greatest dream is to buy some property within the market where she currently works.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Yrene tiene 53 años de edad, estudió secundaria completa y tiene 7 hijos pero solo uno depende de ella. Tiene dos puestos en el mercado “Bellavista” ubicado en el Distrito de La Esperanza, Provincia de Trujillo Departamento de La Libertad; en un puesto vende comida y en el otro vende zapatos, zapatillas y sandalias.

Para conseguir lo que ahora tiene la señora Yrene ha pasado por distintos negocios primero se inició vendiendo por las calles dulce de chiclayo, mazamorra y gelatina (postres), luego se dedicó a vender maceteros, también como ambulante, y en paralelo vendía ropa a algunos conocidos. Poco a poco fue ahorrando hasta que pudo alquilar e implementar su primer puesto en el mercado Bellavista donde vende comida. Con el primer préstamo que recibió en su Banco Comunal “Bellavista” compró sandalias para implementar su segundo puesto.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará platos, cubiertos, algunas ollas, etc., las mismas que le hacían falta para la preparación de comida y poder servir al público en mejores condiciones.

Su mayor anhelo es comprar un terreno dentro del mercado donde actualmente labora.

loans.use: Purchase of kitchen supplies (utensils).

loans.name: Yati

texts.en: Yati, 40, is a mother of seven children. Her husband, D., is a driver and earns very little. To support her family, Yati sells Indonesian Salad 'gado-gado' at her house, earning US$10.5 a day. She is a member of MBK and is requesting a loan of US$100 to expand her business, so she could pay for her children's education. Yati will repay the loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Kamwokya C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Catherine N.. She is currently in the business of charcoal selling and is requesting a loan to boost business. Catherine is 37 years old and is married. She has 7 children ranging from age 5 to 20. Each week, Catherine makes approximately UGX 10000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able pay school fees for the children. Harriet has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 250000 in order to increase stock and the loan was paid back on time.

Harriet is joined in her small group by Eva M., Ruth K. , Norah N. and Miranda B.. Eva M. has a retail shop and wants to add in stock. Ruth K. sells fish and wants to boost business with the loan. Norah N. operates a fruit selling business and intends to increase stock. Miranda B. sells charcoal and wants to expand business

loans.use: To add in charcoal business and make more profits

loans.name: Budumuli East B D Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Margret K.. She is 49 years old, married, and has six children ranging from age 25 to 30, all of whom go to school. She rears livestock and is requesting a loan to expand her cattle business. Each week, Margret makes approximately UGX 80000 in profits and with the extra money from her loan she hopes to cover her basic needs. She took a loan of UGX 700000 from BRAC Uganda before to buy more goats and it was paid back on time.

Margret is joined in her small group by Lukia N., Jeniffer N., Ritah N., and Edith N.. Lukia has a laundy business and wants to to purchase more flat irons and ironing boards. Jeniffer operates a grocery store and wants a loan to purchase more groceries. Ritah runs a bar and wants to add furniture. And Edith sells charcoal and is requesting a loan to purchase her goods in bulk.

loans.use: Margret would boost and expand her livestock business with her part of this group loan.

loans.name: Mazama-Esso

texts.fr:
Mr. Mazama-Esso A. was born in 1973 in Adjengré, in the Sotouboua Prefecture in Togo. He is married and the father of two children. He is employed in the University Hospitality Center on the Lomé campus. In 2007 he opened a bar that he calls "Bar Sun 7" in Agoè. He manages the bar himself on weekends and holidays. On workdays, the bar is run by a manager he has employed and pays monthly. The bar is so successful that he is not able to satisfy all his customers' demands with the means at his disposition.

For this reason, Mr. Mazama-Esso A. is requesting his first loan in the amount of US$ 1200 so that he can add to his inventory by purchasing 85 cases of beer.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur A. Mazama-Esso est né en 1973 à Adjengré dans la préfecture de Sotouboua au Togo. Il est marié et père de deux (2) enfants. Il est employé de bureau au Centre Hospitalier Universitaire de Campus à Lomé. En 2007, il a crée un bar qu’il nomme « BAR SUN 7 » à Agoè. Il gère ce bar seulement les week-end et les jours fériés. Le bar est géré les jours ouvrables par un gérant qu’il a engagé et a qui il paie à la fin du mois. L’affluence qui règne dans le bar fait en sorte qu’il n’arrive plus à satisfaire toutes les demandes de ses clients ; et avec ses moyens, seul il ne peut pas faire face à ses demandes.

A cet effet, Monsieur A. Mazama-Esso sollicite un premier crédit d’un montant de 500.000 FCFA pour faire l’approvisionnement par l’achat de quatre vingt cinq (85) casiers de bière.

loans.use:
Purchase of 85 cases of beer

Achat de 85 casiers de bière

loans.name: Yeang

texts.en: Mrs. Yeang M. lives in Samparn Village in Kampong Speu Province. She is a farmer but she cannot make much revenue because her patch of land is so small. Mrs. Yeang M. now wants to expand her plantation so she asked a loan to buy a piece of land in order to cultivate her rice and vegetables. Her husband, Mr. Son Chhim, is a farmer and pig breeder. They have one child who is attending school. Previously, Mrs. Yeang M. has obtained a loan to buy cows to do plough the field. Her husband is presented in the picture with Mrs. Yeang M..

loans.use: to buy a piece of land in order to cultivate her rice and vegetables.

loans.name: Kayainktheke Group

texts.en: Issa B. T. is a pharmacist who sells essential medicines in Magburaka town of Sierra Leone. As a group leader, he is a very successful businessman who started at a very small scale and, with a previous loan, he has expanded his business. Other group members are also engaged in various businesses. Issa is 37 years old and married with 3 children. He would like to increase his stock and, together with his group members, they are requesting a loan of Le. 3,800,000.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of essential medicines

loans.name: Tineimane

texts.en: Tinemane F., 32, is married with 2 children.  She has 8 months of experience in the pancake, ice pop and popcorn business. She sells to the village and public people 5 days per week. She has had no previous loans with SPBD.  This will be her first.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (approximately $125 USD).  SPBD loans are Tinemane’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.  This loan will be used for the business to buy flour, paper cups and popcorn.  Her husband also helps out with the business.

loans.use: To buy flour, paper cups and popcorn

loans.name: Sobe 2023-4 Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Flora Juan. She is currently in the business of selling rice, meat, and bread at the hotel and is requesting a loan to expand the hotel. She is 35 years old and married to a builder. She has two children, age 11 and 15, who are both in school. Each week, Flora makes approximately 70 Sudanese pounds in profit. With the extra capital from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the hotel.

Flora is joined in her small group by G. P., Sarafina J., Suzi P., and Jenifa A.. G. has a business selling tea and cakes at the restaurant and wants to expand the restaurant. Sarafina is currently operating a business selling fried fish and bread at the restaurant on the market premises and wants a loan to expand her business. Susi operates a business of selling charcoal and wants to expand the business. Jenifa is currently in the business of selling local brew and is requesting a loan to open up bar.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es:
Jenny tiene 31 años, vive en casa y compañía de sus padres. Es una joven responsable, con un corazón lleno de gratitud hacia sus progenitores, por tal motivo se dedica, desde hace mas de 5 años, al bordado de fustanes folklóricos de su zona, decidió emprender esta actividad como negocio, debido a la demanda que tuvo a consecuencia de la calidad de los trabajos que ella realiza. Ahora, trabaja a tiempo completo para cada prenda, en la elaboración de un fustán utiliza bellos y variados colores, para que se dé una combinación perfecta, así, con mucho esfuerzo,  entrega a tiempo los pedidos de bordados que le solicitan y es un gran disfrute el hecho de estar en la comodidad de su hogar  realizando sus trabajos, además de ser una labor independiente.
Jenny tiene una razón para  trabajar y esforzarse, mejorar su calidad de vida y también la de sus padres.
Solicita este préstamo, con la cual podrá adquirir telas e hilos, al por mayor, y con ello, aumentar su productividad. Ella se ve en el futuro como una fuente de trabajo para muchas personas, ya que por la creciente demanda que ella tiene podrá contratar personal para sus bordados.
texts.en:
Jenny is 31 years old and lives with her parents in their house. She us a responsible young woman whose heart is filled with gratitude towards her parents. This is why she has spent more than five years embroidering the cotton skirts that are traditional in the area where she lives. She decided to launch this business because of the high demand for her work, due to its high quality. She works full-time, and for each skirt she uses many beautiful colors to achieve just the right combination. With a lot of hard work, she completes her custom orders on time. Jenny thoroughly enjoys the ability to independently work from her own home. Jenny works hard for one reason: to improve her quality of life and that of her parents. She is requesting this loan to buy fabric and thread in bulk, and thus increase her productivity. It looks as though she may be a source of employment for many people in the future, since because of the growing demand for her products she will be able to contract employees to do some of her embroidery work.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials (fabric, threads) for embroidered skirts

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther sells rechargeable phones and rechargeable phone cards. She sells the recharge cards in wholesale and retail and has been in this business for over a year. Esther is 40 years old and married to Mr. A. who is a dock worker at Tin Can Island in the state of Lagos. Esther needs a loan of 1200 USD to purchase more rechargeable phones to sell.

loans.use: To buy more rechargeable phones to sell

loans.name: Rahma's Group

texts.en:
Rahma K. A. has been selling vegetables, coconut, and small snacks in the Mwera neighborhood of Zanzibar since 2004. She begins work at 8:00am every morning and is able to earn a profit of approximately $25 each month. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more vegetables and coconuts to sell in her shop.

Rahma is 30 years old, married, and has five children.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables and coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Zecy

texts.es: Zecy es una mujer de 43 años, es casada, vive con su pareja y sus cuatro hijos. Se dedica a la  agricultura, produce cítricos, lo cual realiza hace  30 años junto a su esposo. Dentro de su actividad le agrada realizar los mantenimientos de sus terrenos, ya que  lo puede hacer todas las mañanas cuando el calor no es muy fuerte, todo el tiempo y dinero invertido es recompensado, ya que los cítricos son unos frutos de gran demandado en su comunidad, donde  vienen gran cantidad de comerciantes a compra grandes cantidades de  frutas. Lo más difícil es poder encontrar compradores que valoren su trabajo y compren a precios juntos  que  cubran los costos de  producción. Este es su cuarto préstamo, hasta la fecha no ha tenido  problemas de pago en los ciclos anteriores. Zecy desea  invertir en la compra de  abonos y nuevas plantas de  naranja  para sembrar  prontamente.
texts.en:
Zecy is a woman of 43 years. She is married and lives with her partner and their four children. She is dedicated to agriculture. She produces citrus, as she has done with her husband for 30 years. Among their activities she enjoys doing the maintenances of their lands, since she can do it in the mornings when the heat is not very strong. All the time and money invested is rewarded, since citrus fruits are in great demand in their community, where a great many merchants come to purchase large quantities of fruits. The most difficult thing is to find buyers that value their work and buy at prices that cover the costs of production. This is their fourth loan. To date she has not had any payment problems in the previous loan cycles. Zecy wants to invest in the purchase of fertilizer and new orange plants to sow promptly.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and new orange plants to sow

loans.name: Memunatu

texts.en:
Memunatu S. sells fish. She buys fish from the fishermen, brings them home for processing and preservation, and then sends them to the market at Abura to sell. 

Memunatu has received no formal education. She is married and has 11 dependents. Her husband is a farmer. Memunatu has been selling fish for about 20 years. She is responsible for helping her husband to pay for their children's school fees, utility bills and family expenses, because her husband's income is too small to meet the needs of the family. 

Her loan will be used to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest in the expansion of her fish trade.

loans.use: To buy fish in larger quantities

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther F. is 32 years old and a married woman with three children. Currently all her kids are in school. Esther has been selling frozen foods like chicken, pork, mutton, fish, sausages, etc., in the local market of Agogo for four years now. She does not have adequate funds to support her business. This has affected her operation, especially in the face of increasing food prices.

With the loan, she wants to purchase more cartons of frozen foods such as fish, chicken, and pork to enable her to raise enough income to expand her sales. It has been her desire to open another branch in the next three towns from where she is selling presently, because customers from those communities come to her to buy meat, which she thinks is quite a distance. She would also be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy cartons of frozen foods like fish, chicken, mutton, etc.

loans.name: Nohra

texts.en: Nohra is a 32-year-old musician living in Fourn Al Chebak in Beirut. He learned to play music ten years ago, and because music is his passion, he decided to embrace this profession and became a well-known DJ. Today, Nohra is requesting $1,000 to buy new sound equipment for his business.

loans.use: Buy sound equipment

loans.name: Karomat

texts.en: K. Karomat first applied to the Microinvest in 2009 and she came with the recommendations of reliable and well placed clients. Karomat applied to our program for a business development loan as she was engaged in commercial service and trade.  Thanks to her first loan Karomat started up a small stand in a local bazaar where she sells a local bread called “lepeshky”. She always has fresh bread so she has a lot of customers. “Lepeshky” bread is a traditional and required product in every Tajik home. Karomat dreams of starting a “lepeshky” bread baking workshop as she is skilled in lepeshky bread making.. Karomat is requestng a business support loan of 1200 STJ for 4 months. She thanks KIVA for its support.

loans.use: To start a bread baking workshop

loans.name: Pastora

texts.es: la señora Pastora es costurera desde hace treinta años, desde muy pequeña aprendió la costura, que ha sido una de sus herramientas para ayudar a su familia, tiene 47 años de edad, reside en el barrio laureles sur, con  cuatro hijos de 12,16,18 y 20 años de edad, su esposo es jubilado. Con  el préstamo va a comprar mercadería como ropa, tela para vender y obtener otras entradas de ingreso. Sus planes es poder hacer su casa de concreto y segura ya que su casa es de tabla y sencilla y desea poder dejar a sus hijos en una casa buena y digna. También desea montar un taller de costura
texts.en:
Pastora has been a seamstress for the past 30 years. She learned dress-making when she was very little, and it has been one of the tools she uses to help her family. She is 47 years old and lives in Barrio Laureles Sur, and she lives with her four children aged 12, 16, 18, and 20 years of age. Her husband is retired. With this loan she plans on purchasing merchandise such as clothing and fabric to sell and obtain another source of income. Her plan is to remake her house of out of concrete to be safe and secure - her house is currently made out of wood planks and she wants to be able to give her children a good and dignified home. She also would like to set up a tailor shop.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing and fabric.

loans.name: Trinh Thi

texts.vi: Chị Trịnh Thị T.  năm nay 40 tuổi, gia đình chị có bốn con đang tuổi đến trường . Năm 1996 chị T. tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn. Đến  nay ngoài chăn nuôi chị Thao còn đầu tư vốn để mua nguyên liệu để sản xuấ đậu và nấu rượu bán. Vơi thu nhập 4.500.000đ/ tháng  cuộc sống gia đình chị đang ngày càng ổn định và phát triển hơn. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư  mua gạo và đỗ phục vụ cho công việc nấu rượu, làm đậu nhằm tăng thu nhập cho gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Trịnh Thị T., 40 years old, has four school-age children. In 1996, Mrs. T. became a member of the TYM Fund and used a loan to invest in raising pigs. Today, besides raising animals, she also uses loans from the Fund to buy raw materials for producing tofu and brewing wine to sell. With a total monthly income of 4,500,000 VND (255 USD), the lives of Mrs. T. and her family are steadily improving and becoming more secure. In the next round of lending, she hopes to borrow 15,000,000 VND (850 USD) to buy soybeans for making tofu and rice for making rice wine in order to increase her family’s earnings from these enterprises.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Making tofu and rice wine

loans.name: Olimpia Venesuela

texts.es: Doña Olimpia es originaria del departamento de Totonicapan conocido como tierra de las manzanas actualmente ella se dedica a la venta y compra  de ropa tipica abulante que visitas las ares rurales del departamento ofrenciendo su producto especialmente para damas. Con ese negocio que lo viene realizando desde hace mas de 25 años a fortalecido a su familia en darles un nivel de vida adecuada con todas la necesidades basicas hoy necesita un credito para incrementar su negocio con el objetivo de visitar otros municipios del departamento de Totonicapán
texts.en:
Olimpia is from the Totonicapán area, known as the land of apples. She currently dedicates herself to the sale and purchase of traditional clothing by visiting the rural areas offering her products, especially for women. With this business, which she has been carrying out for more than 25 years, she has strengthened her family and given them an adequate standard of living that includes all of the basic necessities. Today, she needs a loan to grow her business with the objective of visiting other municipalities of the Totonicapán department.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her working capital.

loans.name: Betania Iv-A Group

texts.en:
Yustinus T. leads a group of 10 people which is named Betania IV-A. He is aged 44 years and married to Naema T., a 40-year-old lady. Both Yustinus and Naema have been living in Nekmese Village for years, since they were children. This village is situated 55 km from Kupang City, and it takes about two and a half hours' ride to get into the village from Kupang City. The road to this village is bumpy and hasn’t been asphalted yet. Most of the community in this village relies on the agricultural sector to generate money to support their lives, including Yustinus and the group members of Betania IV-A.

In Nekmese Village, Yustinus finances his family by farming. His marriage has been blessed with 2 children, aged 9 to 14 years; they are Bifeni and Yosafat. As a farmer, Yustinus is only able to generate income in a small amount. The income is unstable, depending on the season and crops. To generate money, Yustinus usually sells bananas and areca nut in the market. His wife also helps him to generate money by selling vegetables. The hardship that Yustinus faces in financing his family motivates him to find another alternative to support his family life. This is the reason why Yustinus is intereseted in joining TLM Cattle Fattening Program.

Yustinus is requesting a loan amounting to IDR 3,200,000 from TLM to buy cattle to be fattened over a 12 month period. The other members of this group are also requesting loans to buy cattle to be fattened. They hope that the cattle fattening program will help them in improving their lives.

loans.use: To buy cattle to be fattened

loans.name: Đỗ Thị

texts.en:
V. Đỗ Thị (721000685) is a 46-year-old female living in the town of Mê Linh. She is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, V. owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing construction services to local community members. V. has been engaged in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2000, V. joined Kiva partner, TYM Fund, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. V. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed for her business. V. is now requesting a new loan of 15,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be the eighth taken out by V. Đỗ Thị from TYM Fund. V. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Zuly Del Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Zuly del Rosario A. R. tiene 36 años, vive en el distrito de El Porvenir, en la provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Secundaria Completa, tiene 3 hijos que dependen económicamente de ella.
Zuly cuando inició tenía como negocio la venta de insumos para la preparación de alimentos en el mercado luego por falta de tiempo y para brindarles mayor atención a sus hijos empezó con el negocio de la venta de ropa (lencería) , con el cual permanece actualmente. Su producto los distribuye a domicilio y trabaja solo con pedidos.
Su mercadería lo obtiene en Trujillo (Centros Comerciales).
Con el crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal Viva con Esperanza II, lo invirtió en la compra de insumos para su bodega.
Con este crédito de 300 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería (lencería fina).
Zuly tiene como sueño tener una tienda surtida de abarrotes y también de venta de ropa en general.
texts.en:
Mrs. Zuly del Rosario A. R. is 36 years old and has three dependent children. She lives in the El Provenir District of Trujillo Province in La Libertad, Peru, and has a high school education. When she first became a Manuela Ramos client, Zuly sold basic cooking ingredients in the local market. Then, because of a lack of time and in order to spend more time with her children, she started selling lingerie, which she continues to do today. She delivers her products to her clients' homes, and works only with orders. She buys her merchandise in the Commercial Centers of the city of Trujillo. Zuly is a member of the Viva Con Esperanza II ("Live With Hope II") Village Bank. She used her first loan of 300 soles to buy ingredients for her small grocery store. She will use this loan to buy fine lingerie. Zuly's dream is to have a grocery store with a wide variety of merchandise where she can also sell clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fine lingerie

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is 40 years old and is a married mother with five children. All her children are currently in the primary school in the community where they live.

Leticia is very humble and committed to her work. She sells smoked cow meat in bulk at the community market where she lives. She buys her stock of cow meat from the northern region of Ghana.

Sometimes Leticia spends weeks at the northern region so that she can buy more to supply to her customers. This, she said, prevents her from frequent traveling. She requests the loan to buy more smoked meat to upgrade her inventory.

loans.use: To buy a bulk supply of smoked meat.

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es: Oscar Armando G. C. reside en el cantón El Izcatal en el departamento de Cabañas,  A sus 38 años de edad Oscar vive con su madre y sus dos hermanos Santos de 23 años y Guillermo de 33 años quien es agricultor. Oscar posee su negocio con cinco años  de experiencia se dedica a la venta de oro, zapatos  perfumes de manera ambulante, el viaja a diferentes pueblos de Cabañas ofreciendo sus productos, los ingresos que obtiene Oscar son para ayudar a la manutención de su madre con sus hermanos, Oscar solita un crédito porque  desea comprar mayor cantidad de sus productos, de esta manera el tendrá la posibilidad de aumentar sus ventas y obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Oscar Armando G. C. lives in the district of El Izcatal in the department of Cabañas. Oscar is 38 years old and lives with his mother and two brothers, Santos who is 23 and Guillermo who is 33 and a farm worker.

Oscar has a business that he has had for five years peddling gold, shoes, and perfumes. He travels to different towns in Cabañas offering his products. Oscar's earnings help financially support his mother and brothers.

Oscar is asking for a loan because he wants to buy a greater quantity of products to increase his potential to augment sales and therefore his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience is thirty seven year old woman. She is married with five children. Currently three of her children are in school the first two children are married and working.  She is a food vendor and sells banku and kenkey. Banku and kenkey are prepared from milled maize grains and it is taken with hot pepper or soup. She has many customers since it is enjoyed by many Ghanaian as breakfast, lunch and supper. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to improve her income to support her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy food ingredieints

loans.name: María Julia

texts.es: María Julia R. Vda. D. P., resiD. en el departamento D. Cuscatlán. Con 62 años D. edad María se encuentra acompaña D. su segunda pareja sentimental, ya que hace varios años murió su primer esposo. Jose la actual pareja D. María se dedica a la jardinería y ayuda a su esposa en todo. María posee una tienda en su casa con un inventario D. productos D. consumo y también maneja el vivero en el cual don Jose trabaja arduamente para que sus clientes compren sin dudar sus plantas. María solicita un crédito para invertir en su tienda surtiéndola con nuevos productos que le ayudan a incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
María Julia R. Vda. D. P. lives in the department of Cuscatlán. Maria is a 62-year-old woman who lives with her second life partner because her first husband passed away several years ago. Jose, Maria’s current spouse, is a gardener and helps out his wife with everything. María owns an in-home general store in which she sells provisions. She also manages the plant nursery where Jose works arduously so that his customers will buy his plants hands down. María is requesting a loan to invest it in her store, stocking it up with new products that will boost sales.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock general store

loans.name: Caminantes Group

texts.es: El grupo “Caminates”  esta representado por la señora María Rosalia y conformado por 12 miembros D. personas cariñosas, dinámicas y trabajadoras, tienen una amistad desD. hace mucho tiempo y sus edades varían desD. 24 hasta 63 años.  Las socias se dedican a la venta D. frutas y lo venden en una feria todos los lunes y las otras señoras venden comida como almuerzo y cena y las otras socias  venden ropa usada para niños. Todas tienen sus puestos en la feria cerca al barrio. Prácticamente las señoras tienen ya su clientes bien selecta y saben que la competencia es granD. y que para combatirla necesitan D. mas mercadería insumos y también agrandar su ambientes D. trabajo es por esta razón que requieren el crédito que lesa ayudara a genera un mayor ingreso para brindar a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. Este grupo esta emprendiendo su primer ciclo pero en la reuniones han demostrando ganas D. salir adelante, responsabilidad, honradez y sobre todo unión que es lo esencial en un grupo solidario
texts.en:
The "Caminates" group is represented by señora María Rosalia and has 12 members, who are caring, dynamic, and hard-working people. They have been friends for a long time, and their ages range from 24 to 63 years. The members make a living by selling fruit, which they do at a market every Monday. The other women sell food for lunch and dinner, and still others sell used clothing for children. All of them have their own stands in the market near their neighborhood. The women have their customers well-selected, and they know that the competition is great. To fight it, they need more merchandise and to expand their working environment. This is why they need the credit that will help them generate more income to offer their families a better quality of life. This is the group's first loan, but in their meetings, they have demonstrated their desire to get ahead as well as their responsibility, honesty, and above all, their teamwork, which is essential in a support group.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Tum

texts.en: Mr. Tum M. is a villager in Prey Choeur Teal village in Takeo province. He and his wife, Mrs. Neang Vuth, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn for living. In this plantation, they can earn less income to support their household. Thus, Mr. Tum M. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike to be motorbike taxi driver.
