He is 46 years old and the father of four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are enrolled in the local school. His wife is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy a motorbike to be motorbike taxi driver.

loans.name: Rossel

texts.en: Rossel is 28 years old, married and has one child; her dream is to expand her business, a general store, where she gets her income to support her family. She also dreams that her seven-year-old child will be able to obtain a quality education, finish college and find a decent job. Rossel has been a member of Community Economic Ventures, Inc. and she is grateful because her loans were really helpful, not just to her business but also to her family. Now she is requesting a loan of Php 10,000. This loan will be used to purchase goods for the store and hopefully, little by little, to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase goods for her general store

loans.name: Sokhon

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhon P. lives in Boeng village in Takeo province. She is 55 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are farmers.

Mrs. Sokhon P. and her husband, Mr. Den Sa Em, are farmers who own a 3-hectare (7.5-acre) field of land on which they cultivate rice. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

Although this couple tries to work hard, they still earn insufficient income to support their family’s living expenses. Thus, Mrs. Sokhon P. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding and she would use the rest of money to buy fertilizers to support the rice field.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding and fertilizers for the rice field

loans.name: Amale

texts.en: Amale is a married woman with five children. She has been working as a tailor since 1988. She produces a variety of products for her clientele. Over the years, she was able to help her husband take care of the house and the needs of her children. Today, Amale is applying for a loan of $1,200 to purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock of drinks in bulk

loans.name: Mou

texts.en: Mou S., 26, is married and lives with her young child in Kampong Chnang province. Her husband is a taxi driver who makes around $10 USD per day, while she sells cake and school supplies. Mou S. is asking for a loan of $1200 USD, which will be used to reinvest in her business and fix her leaking roof.

loans.use: To reinvest in her business and fix leaking roof

loans.name: Mujeres De Amor Group

texts.en:
Maria is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres de Amor (Women of Love), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Puerto Plata, a port town with a tourism-based economy where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her longtime partner and her three children.

Maria is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loans. She plans to use this loan to invest in her clothing sales business by purchasing a dozen pairs of panties, a half dozen bras and a half dozen blouses in the main market in Santiago, then returning to her neighborhood to sell them to her clients at a profit. She will also use the loan to purchase a sewing machine, so that she can customize her clothes. She will use the profits to invest in her home by replacing her wood walls with concrete, purchasing a telephone, purchasing a computer for her children's education, purchasing school supplies for her children and paying tuition for herself to attend English classes. Obviously, not all these thing may be possible at first, but she believes they are achievable in the long term, along with her ultimate goal of owning her own store and "being my own boss." She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Purchasing clothing for resale and a sewing machine

loans.name: Annabel

texts.en:
Annabel A. is from the village of Sicayab. She is 51 years old, married and the mother of 4 adult-aged children. Annabel owns and operates a business making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Annabel has been involved in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Annabel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Annabel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Annabel is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to increase working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Annabel from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and to increase working capital

loans.name: Rodecinda

texts.es:
Rodecinda es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy que significa Siembra en quechua.
Rodecinda es casada, tiene 61 años y 10 hijos, Rodecinda se dedica a la compra y venta D. cochinilla, tara, cuero, actividad que realiza en el mercado Magdalena, sus productos los venD. en la ciudad D. Lima.
Rodecinda necesita un préstamo D. 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. cochinilla y tara.
Los sueños D. Rodecinda son mejorar su negocio y terminar los acabados D. su casa.
texts.en:
Rodecinda is a member of the Tarpuy communal bank which means "To Sow" in Quechua. Rodecinda is married, she is 61 years old and has 10 children. Rodecinda buys and sells cochinilla (insect used to make red dye), tara (native tree used for different products) and leather. She sells her products at the Magdalena market in Lima city. Rodecinda needs a loan of 3000 PEN which willl be used for the purchase of cochinilla and tara. Rodecinda dreams of improving her business and finishing her home.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of cochinilla and tara.

loans.name: Mélé Juliette

texts.fr: A. Mélé Juliette est née le 30 juillet 1978 à Lomé au Togo, pays voisin du Bénin.  Mariée à HONTONWAKOU Aristide, un chauffeur, Mélé Juliette est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux sont encore à sa charge.  La famille vit ensemble au quartier Avotrou à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin.  Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille.  Mélé Juliette a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au cours secondaire.  Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Mélé Juliette mène comme activité la vente de tissus et des chaussures à son domicile. Parallèlement à cette activité, Mélé Juliette vend des savons, des bonbons, et des conserves en boîtes.  C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et à Lomé que Mélé Juliette s’approvisionne.  Mélé Juliette a déjà obtenu un crédit à ALIDé, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé.  Mélé Juliette sollicite un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé pour renforcer ses activités et mieux satisfaire ses clients.  Elle ambitionne plus tard construire une boutique dans laquelle elle pourra bien exposer ses marchandises.
texts.en:
Mélé Juliette A. was born July 30, 1978 in Lomé in Togo, a country adjacent to Benin. Married to Aristide HONTONWAKOU, a driver, Mélé Juliette is the mother of three children, all having had schooling, and of whom two are still under her care. Mélé Juliette has herself attended school up to secondary level. The family lives together in the Avotrou neighborhood of Cotonou, economic capital of Benin. The couple shares family expenses. To meet her needs Mélé Juliette has been selling pieces of fabric and shoe wear from her home. As a side business, she also retails soap, candy, and canned food. She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, Benin’s international market, and from Lomé. Mélé Juliette has already been granted one loan from ALIDé, which she repaid in full. She is now requesting another loan, to strengthen her business and increase customer satisfaction. Her ambition is to eventually build a shop where she can appealingly display her products.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pieces of fabric, sho wear and various products

loans.name: Celia Cruz

texts.es: Celia tiene 36 años, por lo que esta no es la primera experiencia que tiene con financiamientos ya que los ha utilizado en su negocio. Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de productos plásticos ella tiene 2 hijas menores de edad a su cargo. Su esposo le ayuda en el negocio pues juntos han logrado salir adelante por el apoyo que ambos se dan, pues este medio de vida que tienen los ayuda a proporcionar el alimento diario a su familia. Actualmente Celia solicita este financiamiento para la compra de bolsas plásticas de todos los estilos, colores y tamaño para ofertar a sus clientes. Ella sueña con que sus hijas logren finalizar sus estudios y sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
This isn't Celia's, 36, first experience with financing; she has had previous loans that she has used for her business. She is a plastics retailer and has two young daughters under her care. Her husband helps her with the business and together have managed to get ahead in life. Thanks to the mutual help they give each other they are able to support their family. Celia is asking for funding to buy an assortment of plastic bags in various sizes and colors to offer her customers. She dreams that ther daughters will complete their studies and become upstanding citizens.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plastic items.

loans.name: Lucie Jacqueline

texts.fr: H. Lucie Jacqueline est née le 08 Janvier 1974 et vit depuis cinq ans au quartier Ayélawadjè à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Lucie Jacqueline est une célibataire, ayant à sa charge deux enfants. Lucie Jacqueline vit seule avec les deux enfants à charge et supporte leurs charges. Lucie Jacqueline a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire. Depuis une dizaine d’année, Lucie Jacqueline mène comme activité, la vente des gâteaux de blé, mais aussi des chips de bananes à la devanture d’un collège de Cotonou. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Lucie Jacqueline s’approvisionne. Lucie Jacqueline a obtenu une fois de crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé. Face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de la clientèle, Lucie Jacqueline ambitionne augmenter son fonds de roulement et produire plus de galettes et de chips de bananes, afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. C’est pourquoi Lucie Jacqueline sollicite un deuxième crédit.
texts.en:
Lucie Jacqueline H. was born 8 January 1974 and has lived for the past five years in the Ayélawadjè borough of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Lucie Jacqueline is unmarried, with two children under her care. She lives with the two children and is their sole support. She interrupted school at the secondary level. For the past ten years Lucie Jacqueline has sold wheat flatcakes and banana chips at a stall facing a Cotonou secondary school (college). She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, Benin’s international market. Lucie Jacqueline was already granted one loan from ALIDé, which was repaid in full. Faced with an increasing customer demand, she wants to boost her working capital and produce more flatcakes and banana chips, to increase customer satisfaction. This is why she is requesting a second loan.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wheat flour, sugar and vegetable oil, to prepare flatcakes.

loans.name: Kumba

texts.en: Kumba C. is married with three children all of whom attend school. She trades in assorted shoes and slippers, something she has done for over ten years, and knows that this trade is lucrative so wants to invest more money in the business. Kumba is seeking a loan that will enable her to buy more stock. She hopes to use proceeds from the loan to educate her children and build a house in the future.

loans.use: To buy shoes and slippers

loans.name: Maher

texts.en: Maher I. is a 34 Years old, married man, from Ramallah. He lives with his wife and 7 children. In 2005, Maher  opened his own Tailoring shop. With this loan, he hopes that he would be able to buy a Sewing Machine, which will increase his income and improve the status of his store.

loans.use: he would be able to buy a Sewing Machine

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda D. is from the village of Alimannao, Peñablanca, Cagayan. She is 56 years old. Yolanda is widowed and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Yolanda owns and operates a food stall, tending a canteen in the community. Yolanda has been in business for more than eight years and earns approximately 6,500 PHP a month.

Yolanda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Yolanda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. Yolanda is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Yolanda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Pao

texts.en:
Mrs. Pao P., 42, lives in Prasat village, Kandal province, where she earns income selling various groceries. Mrs. P. has three children, two of whom are attending a local public school, while the youngest one is only two years old. Mrs. P.'s husband, Mr. Ra Ren, is a farmer who grows crops on a small piece of land that he owns.
Mrs. P.'s grocery sales business is going well, and she would like to expand and improve it even further. She is therefore applying for a loan to buy more groceries for resale.

loans.use: Purchase of groceries for resale

loans.name: Vergeleta

texts.en:
This is Vergeleta M., 57, a resident of Dasmariñas, Philippines. She is married to Jovencio M. and is the mother of three children, all of whom are already working and are settled down with their own families. By the grace of God, Vergeleta managed to support her children's schooling until they were able to graduate and work. This is a dream for most poor Filipino parents like Vergeleta, as she believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Vergeleta operates a variety store and a rug-making business. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which offers groceries, toiletries and beverages to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go for to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Vergeleta earns income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling at retail rates. Vergeleta’s store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy higher quantities of products, like groceries, toiletries and beverages, in order to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  
Vergeleta dreams that her family can be financially stable soon. She also hopes that the business will continue to grow and be successful.

loans.use: To buy higher quantities of products in order to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita L. is from the village of Salvador St. Iligan City. At the age of 30, Conchita is married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Conchita owns and operates a business venture in the food sector. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks & native delicacies in the local community. Conchita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2009, Conchita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Conchita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Conchita is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients for her food products. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Conchita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make food products

location.town: Salvador St., Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KANTU DE SAN JERONIMO”; La  socia vive en la provincia  y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Ana; ella tiene 32 años de edad y La socia es natural de San Jerónimo, ella es casada,  Ella es comerciante minorista, la soca tienen una tienda de abarrotes, desde hace 9 años,  la socia se dedica a administrar su tienda de abarrotes  e implementa cada cierto tiempo para que siempre este llena y tenga todo para satisfacer a sus clientes. La socia solicita el préstamo para poder comprar mercadería para implementar y así mejorar sus ventas en su negocio.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the “KANTU DE SAN JERONIMO” communal bank. She lives in the province and department of Cusco. Her name is Ana, and she is 32 years old. She is from San Jerónimo, and she is married. Her business is retail trade: she has operated a grocery store for the past 9 years. She manages the store herself and stocks it regularly to make sure it is always full of everything necessary to satisfy her customers. Ana is requesting a loan to buy merchandise to stock her store and thus improve her sales. Ana infinitely values and appreciates the loan offered to her, since it will allow her to expand her business and improve her quality of life; accordingly, she is committed to making her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise to stock her store and improve her sales

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es: Haydee tiene 31 años y vive con su esposo Hernán de 34 años, con quien tiene 2 hijos pequeños y hermosos, ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en un pueblo tranquilo llamado “Patay”. Desde hace 11 años, ella y su esposo se dedican a la agricultura, siembra papa, arveja, gladiolos y habas  en sus terrenos propios, paralelamente cría caballos que le ayudan a trasladar los insumos y herramientas agrícolas hacia las chacras,  además tiene vacas que le brindan a diario litros de leche, en donde luego elabora quesos, que son vendidos en las tiendas y sus vecinos. Lo que más le gusta a Haydee, es sembrar arvejas y flores, porque son productos muy solicitados en el mercado, ya que al comercializarlos le resulta bastante rentable, debido a que las utilidades las vuelve a invertir en sus sembríos y puede cubrir sus gastos familiares, por eso planea sembrar en mayor cantidad, porque sabe que tendrá mejores oportunidades para el bienestar de sus hijos. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, y está segura de poder pagarlo puntualmente, ya que para ella, el crédito significa una oportunidad para salir y porque le gusta trabajar en su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico y dos bolsas de semilla de arveja, como usualmente lo hace en cada siembra.
texts.en:
Haydee is 31 years old and she lives with her husband Hernan, 34, and they have 2 beautiful little children. They live in their own home located in a quiet village called Patay. Since she was 11 years old she has been a dedicated agriculturer, sowing potatoes, peas, gladiola flowers and fava beans. They have their own fields. In addition they have a stable where they grow horses that help them transport their tools and products to the fields. They also have cows that give them various litres of milk every day with which they make cheeses destined for sale in stores and to their neighbours. Haydee's favorite thing to do is to sow peas and flowers because they are the products that are most sought out in the markets and the sales are very profitable. She is able to reinvest in her plantations while managing to cover the family's expenses. She plans on expanding her plantation so that she will be able to provide her children with better opportunities for her children. This is the fourth loan she seeks with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is committed this process. A loan is the means to have an opportunity to advance and She enjoys working in a group. With the loan she is requesting she would like to purchase several sacks of organice fertilizer and two sacks of pea seeds, as she usually purchases every year.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase organic fertilizers and pea seeds.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Mr. Hong M. ( in the photo with his wife and daughter), is 45 years old and his wife Mrs. Yoeun Chhaum, is 43 years old. They have been married since 1994 and have two young daughters. All of them are in school. The family lives in a small village across Mekong River about 17 Kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Hong is a horse cart driver and fisherman. His wife has full-time employment.  He is asking for a loan in the amount of 250USD to purchase cows to raise.

loans.use: To purchase cow to raise.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas De Fernando Group

texts.es:
El comité “tiene 3 años de formación y trabaja con la Fundación Paraguaya”,  la mayoría de sus integrantes ya  realiza actividades productivas, pero incluyen entre sus integrantes a  señoras que emprenderán actividades.
Incluyen entre las actividades realizadas la venta de frutas y verduras, venta de comestibles artesanales como empanadas de carne, empanadas de pollo, empanadas de jamón y queso, venta de mercaderías varias como: fideo, azúcar, harina, aceite, jabón, entre otros artículos, venta de ropas, venta de remedios etc.
 Anhelan un futuro mejor para sus hijos es por eso que se esfuerzan el doble para facilitarles los materiales para su desarrollo y formación.  
Una de las integrantes es la señora Angélica quien se dedica a la venta de ropas, esta es la actividad que ella realiza para ayudar con los ingresos de su casa. 
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de ropas de manera a contar con mas variedades de ropas para sus clientes, entre las prendas que ella quiere adquirir como remeras, camisas, pantalones, vestidos, blusas y otros.
texts.en:
The committee “has been in operation for three years and works with Fundación Paraguaya.” Most of its members are involved in productive activities but include among its members women who are about to start activities. Among their activities are: fruit and vegetable sales, artisanal food sales like meat and chicken turnovers, ham and cheese turnovers; sale of various merchandise like: pasta, sugar, flour, cooking oil, soap, etc., clothing sales, health remedies, etc. They all hope for better futures for their children and that’s why they double their efforts to provide them with tools to develop. One of the members is Angélica who sells clothes to help generate family income. She is asking for funds to buy clothes in order to have a wider variety of stock for her customers. She wants to buy t-shirts, shirts, pants, dresses, blouses and others.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy assorted clothing.

loans.name: María Rosa

texts.es:
La Señora María Rosa L. es socia del banco comunal Señoras de Taguan, vive en la comunidad que lleva el mismo nombre, que  pertenece al cantón Sigsig, su gente se dedica a la elaboración de sombreros de paja toquilla, a la cría de animales y a la agricultura.
 
Doña María se dedica a la agricultura, siembra maíz para su consumo, también se dedica a la cría de animales como gallinas, cerdos Y cuyes que los vende en Gualaceo y también para su consumo.

La Señora María tiene 70 años, es viuda hace 28 años  y tiene  4 hijos mayores de edad que viven independientemente.Con el trabajo en su juventud ha logrado construir su casa propia.
 
Este es el tercer crédito que realiza el banco comunal y tiene una gran amistad con todas las señoras que forman parte de él. Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en su alimento.
 
Su sueño es seguir conservando su salud.
texts.en:
Señora María Rosa L. is a member of the Señoras de Taguan (Women of Taguan) communal bank. She lives in the community of the same name, which belongs to the Sigsig canton. Her people make their livings making panama hats, raising animals and in agriculture. Doña María makes her living in agriculture. She grows corn for her own use, and she also raisies animals, likes chickens, pigs and guinea pigs, which she sells in Gualaceo and also uses for her own consumption. Señora María is 70 years old. She has been a widow for 28 years and has 4 grown children who live independently from her. She has been able to build her own home, thanks to the hard work of her youth. This is her third loan with her communal bank. She has a great relationship with all the woman who are part of the communal bank. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of chickens and chicken feed. Her hope is to continue preserving her health.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase chickens and animal feed.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 40 years old and married to Stanely N. who owns a business that brings in about $125 a month. They have two children, ages nine and six. Monica operates a quarry business which gives her an income of about $150 a month.

She wants to use the loan to buy tools and equipment for the extraction of stones. She hopes to use the anticipated profit to improve the living standards of the family but also to save for future expansion of the business. She wants to buy more land for quarrying and later buy a lorry for transporting the stones to the customers' premises.

loans.use: To buy tools and equipment for extraction of stones.

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es:
Este comité se conformó con la unión de vaR. agricultores de la zona de Santani, para facilitar el acceso al crédito y ayudarse entre todos y pagar, se agruparon y denominaron al comité San Francisco.
Todos los integrantes se dedican a la agricultura y cría de animales, son pequeños productores de sésamo, mandioca, maíz, poroto y otros.
Todos muy trabajadores ya que procuran brindarles lo mejor a sus familias, especialmente la educación de sus hijos comentaron entre otras cosas.
El presidente del grupo es el señor Tomas S. quien además de ser agricultor también es docente de una escuela primaria donde ejerce medio tiempo.
Tiene plantaciones de vaR. cultivos y también cría de animales. Con este crédito piensa comprar balanceados para sus animales.
texts.en:
This committee was formed by the union of several farmers in the Santani area in order to facilitate access to loans and help each other and pay them back. They formed and named themselves The San Francisco Committee.

All members are dedicated to agriculture and animal husbandry and are small producers of sesame, cassava, corn, beans etc.

All members hard-working and seeking to provide the best for their families, especially the education of their children amongst other things.

The group's president is Mr. Tomas S., who in addition to working as a farmer, also teaches at an elementary school where he works part time.
Various crops are planted and animals are bread. With this loan they plan to invest in their animals.

loans.use: Invest in livestock

loans.name: Kyeshero Bikoguze Group-Rukungiri

texts.en: Alex M. is a 36-year-old father of three and he belongs to Kyeshero Bikoguze Group-Rukungiri. 18 years is the time he has been working hard at his retail shop enterprise in Matumba. He says he also sells coffee to supplement his profits. 200,000 shillings is what totals up as monthly generated earnings for him. With this loan he says he is going to restock his retail shop with additional purchases of mercandise that he says he will resell and as such make more profits.

loans.use: The purchase of more retail stock for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Naisimoi Ene

texts.en:
Naisimoi has been rearing animals for sale in Naivasha town for the last 4 years. She is 22 years old, married to N. Nkuya, and they have two children.

She was introduce to KADET by her friend and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy 10 goats, which she will rear and sell later at a profit.

In the future, Naisimoi hopes to grow her business so that she will be able to comfortably take her children to school.

loans.use: To buy 10 goats which she will rear and sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Djamila

texts.en:
Djamila is 29 years old and is married with four children who are between 1 and 6 years old. Djamila is known in the business of selling new clothes, mainly children’s clothes. She has been in this business for about three years and currently employs one person.

Djamila has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to help expand her business by buying more clothing styles, including clothes for men and women.  If successful, Djamila hopes to continue building a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Silvia Karin

texts.es:
Silvia es una madre de familia de 27 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos menores de edad en el distrito de Pacanga, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Chepén, región La Libertad. La localidad se encuentra situada a mas de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Ella se dedica a trabajar como comerciante: Por un lado cuenta con un pequeño establecimiento en su vivienda en donde ofrece en venta materiales de costura y confección de tejido, ella vende hilos de diversos colores y texturas a sus clientes, adicionalmente vende productos de belleza y cosméticos por catálogo a sus vecinos y conocidos. Ambos negocios cuentan con buena acogida ya que Silvia es una mujer bastante dinámica y los mantiene del mejor modo posible. Los ingresos que ella percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para ayudar a su esposo, quien trabaja como jornalero en los campos de cultivo de la zona, con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Actualmente ella desea implementar su negocio con la instalación de un pequeño estante en donde ofrezca a sus clientes un stock fijo de productos cosméticos. Esto le permitirá satisfacer la demanda con la que cuenta rápidamente, sin tener que esperar a fin de mes, que es cuando llega el pedido. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Silvia is a 27 year-old mother who lives with her husband and three dependent children in Pacanga district.  This is an agricultural area located in Chepén province, in La Libertad department.

Silvia works as a saleswoman.  She has a small establishment in her home where she sells sewing and knitting supplies.  She sells different colored and textured yarns to her customers.  She also sells beauty products and cosmetics from a catalog to her neighbors and acquaintances.  Both businesses are very popular because Silvia is quite a dynamic woman and she keeps her businesses running in the best way possible.

Silvia uses the profits from her business activities to help her husband, who works as a day laborer in local fields, to support their family financially.  Currently, Silvia would like to keep her business running by installing a small shelf where she can offer her customers a fixed stock of cosmetics.  This will allow her to satisfy her customers' demands quickly, without having to wait until the end of each month when her orders arrive.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics to expand her inventory

loans.name: Chham

texts.en: Chham T., 39, is married and lives with his wife and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for ancient temples. He works at a private company, where he makes about $6 a day. His wife is a farmer, and earns about $1 a day. Each month, the family spends about $50 on food and $85 on other necessities. He is applying for a loan for $1,200 to buy a new motorbike for his family to use. In the future, he would like to earn enough money to improve and repair his family's home. This is his second loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy a new motorbike for his family to use

loans.name: Luis Jhonathan

texts.es: Luis es soltero tiene 21 años de edad vive en casa de su tia ubicada en la calle Santa Isabel el se inicio como chofer de manera dependiente aproximadamente tres años actualmente cuenta con dos mototaxis propias la cual una trabaja el de forma independiente y la otra da en alquiler el financiamiento otorgado sera destinado para el mantenimiento y reforzamiento de su dos mototaxis, se le otorga el financiamiento por contar con buenas referencias,voluntad y capacidad de pago.
texts.en:
Luis, 21, is single and lives in his aunt’s house located on Santa Isabel Street.  He started out as an independent driver about three years ago.  

He has two mototaxis of his own.  He works one of them independently and leases out the other one.  The requested loan will be used for vehicle maintenance and repair of his two mototaxis

The loan is granted because he has good references as well as the will and capacity to repay.

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance and repair.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en: Benson would like a loan to buy fuel, soap and sugar for resale. He has a retail shop and his home area is Kyenjojo, Uganda. He intends to expand his business and educate his children.

loans.use: Buying fuel, soap and sugar for resale

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
ALBERTO P. S., ES DE MANAGUA, EL TRABAJA DIARIO COMO CONSERJE, ES PADRE DE FAMILIA DE UN NIÑO, Y ESTE  ACTUALMENTE DEPENDE DE EL Y SE ENCUENTRA EN EDAD ESCOLAR.
DON ALBERTO ACUDE A LAS OFICINAS DE CEPRODEL PARA SOLICITAR UN NUEVO PRESTAMO PARA EL MEJORAMIENTO DE SU VIVIENDA PARA INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION COMO: ARENA, CEMENTO, HIERRO PARA TERMINAR DE CONSTRUIR  UNA PARED DE SU CASA DE HABITACION, POR LO QUE ESTA ANTES SE ENCONTRABA DE TABLAS DE MADERA LA CUAL FUE DESTRUIDA POR LOS COMEJENES.
TODO ESTO PARA EL MEJORAMIENTO DE SU CASA DE HABITACION Y BRINDARLE MEJORES CONDICIONES DE VIDA A SU FAMILIA.
texts.en:
Alberto P. S. is from Managua.  He works as a concierge and is a family man with a school-aged son who depends on him.

Don Alberto has applied for a loan through CEPRODEL for home improvement purposes.  He wants to buy construction materials such as sand, cement and iron to finish a wall that used to be made of wood but was destroyed by termites.  This is to improve his environment and give his family better living conditions.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel tiene 55 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos, Se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, desde hace mas de 14 años que tiene este negocio. El negocio lo inicio por sus padres que son personas que anteriormente se dedicaban a este negocio, con el paso del tiempo lograron ofrecerle este medio de vida a Isabel para que le proporcionar a su familia ingresos para el hogar. Isabel quiere el financiamiento para la compra de melones, mangos, sandias, jocotes, naranjas, papaya, tomates y otras frutas.
texts.en: Isabel is 55 years old, married, and she has 4 children. She has been selling fruits and vegetables for the past 14 years. She started this business because her parents used to have a similar business. With the passage of time they managed to provide Isabel with this means to earn a living and to support her family and earn an income for her household. Isabel requires this loan to purchase melons, mangoes, watermelons, berries, oranges, papayas, tomatoes, and other fruits.

loans.use: to purchase melons, mangoes, watermelons, oranges, papayas, and tomatoes

loans.name: Jacoba Bacilia

texts.es: Jacoba Bacilia es una madre de familia de 46 años. Ella se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte, ella busca la forma de salir adelante con su negocio,  tiene una gran variedad de clientes, pues este negocio lo inicio por su Papa ella es una persona muy tranquila y que disfruta de hablar con sus clientes. Se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez un crédito con el objetivo de invertir en su negocio para la compra llantas, repuestos herramientas entre otros. Ella es una persona bastante entregada a su familia y que siempre está dispuesta a ayudar a los que la necesitan. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una mujer tranquila y responsable.
texts.en: Jacoba Bacilia is a 46-year-old mother.  She works providing transportation service and she looks for a way to get ahead with her business.  She has a wide variety of customers and she started the business because of her father.  She is a very calm person and likes talking with her customers.  She is requesting her first loan in order to invest in her business, purchasing tires, spare parts, and tools, among other items.  She is very dedicated to her family and is always willing to help those in need.  The people who know her consider her to be a very calm and responsible woman.

loans.use: to buy tires, spare parts, tools, and other items

loans.name: Washington

texts.en:
Washington is 28 years old and married with a 1-year-old child and one other dependent. living in Hioma, Uganda. 

He is the sole bread winner of the family and his dream is to have an educated family. 

For five years he has been running a produce business to which he is devoted. He started it by selling goats to get capital.

He faces a challenge of customers not paying. Nevertheless, he hopes in the future that his store will grow to a bigger one.

Washington needs the loan to purchase maize, beans, groundnuts and cassava for resale.

loans.use: To buy beans, maize, cassava and groundnuts for resale
